story:
Our story:

Hello!,

My name is Salvador Domínguez one of the founders of NYC en Español: a media startup that aims to bring quality content about cultural life in New York City to Spanish-speaking viewers in both the U.S. and Latin America.

The inspiration for NYC en Español began six years ago when I moved to New York City, “the city where dreams come true,” from a small town in the middle of the Sonoran Desert. Life was uncertain: I didn’t have a job, a place to sleep, or much more than a suitcase full of essentials and dreams. After a tough time settling in and finding employment in the marketing/retail industry, I began to record my experiences in New York with my phone camera. I started to send short videos to my inner group of friends who encouraged me to post them on social media. The videos were a hit with my 1,000 Facebook friends, and soon I started receiving friend requests from random people, growing exponentially over the next couple weeks. I realized there was a need and demand for honest, accessible content about life in New York for the Spanish-language audience that touched on news, culture, and politics, among other topics.

Since my videos were intended to be watched only by my friends, they never changed in format or content. I documented my whole life, from setbacks to successes and everything and everyone in between including work, love, and living in this amazing city. As of today there are over 1,000 videos across all social media platforms. All were chosen to target specific demographics so I could help educate diverse communities with our stories.

While I kept my “normal job” the team soon grew to include five others who helped with video technology and editing. As more and more viewers demanded content, I soon ran out of time and resources. After being interviewed by local and national radio and television programs in Latin America, the videos took off in popularity. People in the U.S. and Latin America craved better quality, Spanish language content. With our current staffing, we could only provide limited content, and it’s time to reach and help more people with our expertise.

What do we want to do:

We want to take our mission of providing quality content to broader Hispanic audiences to the next level. We will share stories from successful people across diverse industries at the same time that we show everything that happens in real lives of New Yorkers. This will continue to inspire others to be successful and conquer obstacles in any stage of their lives. The format will be an innovative bilingual type of reality show divided into 12, one-hour chapters. This pilot effort will be a foundation for pitching a larger project to media networks. By building on our existing audience on various social media platforms, we hope to broadcast content with information about various causes that will contribute positively to our communities.

Why do we need your help:

Unfortunately we had to end the show last December after five years due to rising costs. Major expenses ranged from people helping me on every area of production, product giveaways, media equipment, trademarks, city permits, etc. Out-of-pocket costs averaged $2,000 a month which led to significant debts. Despite setbacks in production, however, the audience continued to support this type of content, even demanding new videos.

Given the demonstrated need for the media produced by NYC en Español, we concluded that this opportunity would appeal greatly to the INDIEGOGO community. All the raised funds will go directly to improve production and provide fair wages for our professional staff in order to serve our viewers better and set an example in the Latin communities.  

Please help us by contributing to this campaign. Our viewers and our entire team greatly appreciate it and we sincerely hope to welcome you into our community soon!

story:
Premise

A web series revolving around the story of a young introverted girl (Steph) who has never been on a date before. Being out of her comfort zone, she seeks her close friend Emily to guide her by secretly feeding her lines throughout her date. 

Risks & Challenges

Creating a web series can be a difficult task to achieve. There are many challenges we have faced along our way. 

Writing the Script:

Each of the three episodes has to work with each other in some way. One episode has to lead to the next episode and entice the viewers to find out what's happening in the next episode. We've gone through multiple versions of the script and hopefully we have written one that will satisfy the audience. 

Location:

One of the locations we will be shooting to capture the date scene is a restaurant. To shoot at a restaurant, they have to close it during operating hours or we have to be there when they're closed. The latter would mean that we don't have any control over natural lighting and time of day. Both of these options will be costly due to us paying the business for their loss of revenue (if they're closing) or paying for staff members to supervise us.

Working on a small budget, finding a location that is willing to let us shoot can be very difficult. 

Budget

This project is non-profit. 100% of all contributions will be invested into the production of the web series.

Allocation:

  • Minimum $500 for Equipment hire or Purchase
  • Minimum $1000 for Location Fees
  • Minimum $300 for Production Design: Includes Props and Clothing.
  • Minimum $300 for Other: Includes Travel Cost, Catering, other fees.

 

    Crew

    Bec Truong - Director/Writer

    Laurence Jo - Director/Writer

    Teddy Estrada - Producer

    Kie Lay - Director of Photography

    Kevin McMahon - Art Director/Marketing Director

    Jonathan Mcintyre - Editor/Assistant Camera Operator

    Justin Quach - 1st AD/VFX Designer

    Jarrod Coslovich - Gaffer

    Goal

    The web series will be shot in 4K using a RED Scarlet Dragon. We hope to enter as many film festivals as we can, and because of this the web series may be limited to private access only as most festivals would like to premier the series. 

     

    Don't worry if you can't contribute. There are other ways to support our project by following our social media and sharing this campaign. 

    Instagram: @saboru_studios

story:
Catrina the Lesbian Witch is a live action six X 5 minute London based Queer Centric web series about 23 year old Wannabe Wiccan Catrina, who discovers that she has actual magical powers and comes from a long lineage of Female Witches. 

The series is a fresh and funny look at the trials and tribulations of discovering you’re a witch, but this time from a queer perspective. It's a supernatural comedy-drama which puts LGBTQ+ characters front and centre in the fantasy/supernatural genre.

Pre-vis artwork for the animated opening titles by Chanel Smith

Catrina is a 23-year-old waitress and illustrator, into everything new age from crystals to horoscopes. The series opens with Catrina’s discovery of her magical powers during a sexual encounter, and goes on to explore what it all means and why she is only just figuring out the truth about herself now. 

Over the six episodes that make up Season One we follow Catrina as she discovers more about her powers and learns about witchcraft and her ancestry. The series will explore what it means to be Queer in London in 2019, as well as drawing on the current socio-cultural fascination with mysticism and the occult.

Catrina is an out and proud Lesbian and founding member of the Woke Wiccans Conscious Lifestyle Collective. Though initially delighted in her new witchy prowess, Catrina  soon discovers the reality of being imbued with magical capabilities doesn't quite live up to her expectations. Sadly transforming her actor flatmate's loveable but infuriating ever present cat into a unicorn isn't part of Witchcraft 101.

In fact Catrina struggles to tell anyone at all about her burgeoning powers fearing her friends will not accept her anymore. She starts to see them as more of a hindrance than something to boast about, especially when her new found powers start to seriously mess up her dating life. After a mysterious woman ‘Aradia’ shows up in her life,  Catrina starts to suspect that dark forces are at work, and perhaps her previously somewhat superficial appreciation of the supernatural was misguided. 

At the end of the season one we see Catrina faced with an ultimatum. Does she follow Aradia down the path to Wiccan Nirvana, disowning her friends and current way of life? Or does she reject her heritage and continue on the path she was happily leading.

Find out your own Sun, Moon and Rising sign like Catrina here: astrostyle.com/charts-readings/free-birth-chart

We share a passion for the supernatural & fantasy genres and wanted to write in a style we loved whilst also addressing the in-balance of queer characters on TV. The focus of Catrina is not her queerness, its just one aspect of her multi-faceted character. Growing up we loved series such as Buffy the Vampire Slayer, as well as films like The Craft and of course Sabrina The Teenage Witch. We wanted to create a series that celebrates ‘Otherness’  in all of its glory and bring it into the foreground.

We believe Catrina will work best episodically rather than as a short or feature film, and have decided on a web series format because it will enable us to further explore Catrina, her friends and the world of witchcraft she discovers in depth, whilst also being accessible to the largest audience possible for free. We are already planning story arcs for season two and three!

 

Louise and Miranda met in 2016 on the short film Pillow Talk which you can watch here. Louise and Miranda worked together a second time in late 2018 on another short film, Confessional, they produced together, written by Miranda and directed by Louise. The film has recently finished post-production and will begin its festival run shortly - watch the teaser here.

Miranda Horn

Writer, Producer and lead actress

Miranda has always thought of herself as a Witch. Maybe it all harks back to the ceremonial burning of pictures of her ex at sixteen, don't blame her blame her Scorpio rising, whose to say but her films always seem to unintentionally focus on an otherworldly power at hand. Her first film which she shot one afternoon in her parents toilet won ‘Best Film’ and ‘Best Story’ prize at the Elstree Film design and Creative England sponsored ‘A sense of Hope’ competition. She has since upgraded from toilet to confessional booth where her second self penned film Confessional was shot by Harry Baker - Cinematographer for Catrina, and directed by Louise. In fact it was on one of her first films out of drama school that Miranda met Louise, and having fallen in love with her aesthetic and way of working she knew that when she finally got round to finishing her short film about lesbian Mermaids  (coming soon after Catrina) that Louise would be the only person she would want to direct it. Louise approached Miranda with the idea to collaborate on Catrina and she jumped at the chance. 

 

Louise Marie Cooke

Writer, Producer and Director

Louise came of age on a diet of Buffy the Vampire Slayer and My So Called Life. It was only after watching The Virgin Suicides by Sofia Coppola that she decided she wanted to be a filmmaker and set about making a series of ‘serious’ drama short films. After graduation her first short was the Film London supported film First Bite about a teenage girl on the cusp of sexual awakening, a dreamer character, the type consumed with Twilightesque stories (serious stuff honest, no supernatural going ons...). After this she made Siren and Pillow Talk which were both nominated for Best British Short at BAFTA qualifying festival Iris Prize. In 2017 she was funded a second time by Film London to make Breathe, a dark drama about two strangers coming together after a tragic accident. The film was released in 2018 and is currently coming to the end of its festival run. Catrina will be her first time making something a little less serious and she can’t wait for the fun and magic to begin.

louisemariecooke.com

 

We have been developing Catrina since late 2018 and now have all six episodes scripted.

Aside from the financial backing that we are relying on in order to create this series, crowdfunding will help us to grow our audience prior to the planned release in early 2020. 

As a production company Freyja Films has a great track record of gaining traction on YouTube which is where we intend to release Catrina. Pillow Talk, directed by Louise and starring Miranda has been flooded with comments asking us to create a series, so that's what we're doing! The audience for Catrina is there waiting. Young women and non-binary who are starting to discover themselves and learning who they are, just as Catrina is. We strongly believe the importance of seeing yourself and your struggles reflected on screen and we firmly feel that Catrina will provide our audience with encouragement to accept who they are.

The first 20 people to support us will also receive one of these cool Queer Witch stickers gifted to us from Magic Hour

 

This is where you come in!

By supporting Catrina the Lesbian Witch and selecting one of the perks on the right, however great or small, you will get us a step closer to reaching our target of £5k which is 50% of the whole budget we need to shoot all 6 episodes. We are planning to raise the additional budget through company sponsorship and fundraising events. 

Speaking of perks... a huge thanks to Tribal Unicorn who are designing our exclusive soy wax candles for the £75+ perks, find out more about them here

If you are unable to contribute financially towards Catrina but are interested in knowing more and want to see the series get made there are other ways you can help.

WhatsApp everyone you know the link to our Indiegogo page expressing your love for the series and asking them to share with their friends

Follow our social accounts below:

Instagram / Facebook / Twitter /

Subscribe to our YouTube channel

Find out more about the series at catrinawebseries.com

Thank you!

Social profile icon by Chanel Smith

 

Confessional teaser

 
Pillow Talk full film
 

 

If you are a Company who wishes to support us as a corporation rather than as an individual you can choose our £500 'sponsor an episode' perk from the options on the right of this page. As a thank you we will include your Companies logo on the end credits of one of the episodes. The episode you will sponsor will be on a first come first served basis; for example the first to choose this option will sponsor episode one. We will also link to your Companies website in the YouTube description and from our own website. We will provide social media promotion after you have backed us and during the shows release in 2020. We are also open to using brands and products from companies which have sponsored us in the series as a return.

We reserve the right to cancel this perk and refund your donation if we deem your Company to be promoting anything we deem offensive, pornographic, or promoting hateful speech. If you wish to contact us about this perk option please email info@catrinawebseries.com

story:
Logline:

Recently widowed, Joy Lawless is a financially strapped Hollywood hairstylist who is forced to leave her pre-teen kids in the care of their stoner Uncle Bob before departing for a drama-filled movie shoot.

In this half hour comedy I've shared some of my 30 plus years experience working as a hairstylist in the entertainment industry (Vanities department). Crazy, exotic locations, long hours, deceit, lies, unreal requests, along with the humor and camaraderie that comes all in a days work.

Compared to,  EXTRA  and The Office

What we have planed to shoot is a sizzle reel of 12 pages  (the pitch package).  We will shoot at two locations in two days.  

What We Need & What You Get

I am asking for your support in donating money to reach my goal of $10,000. 

We need funds for a variety of production expenses including, funds to pay the cast & crew, editing, insurance, set construction, props, and studio time, 

Here’s what our generous contributors can expect in return for their investment:

The support level ($10-$25) We’ll give you a shoutout and a tag on social media including facebook and Instagram.

The Hats-off Level ( $30 - $ 50) gets you a shoutout and tag, plus a signed copy of the script and Vanities crew t-shirt.

The Vanities Brush-up Level ($60 - $ $75) gets you all of the above plus a Vanities logo hair brush.

The Swag Level ( $100 - $ $150) gets you all of the previously mentioned plus Vanities crew hat.

The Hot Stuff Level ($200 - $1000) gets your all of the previously mentioned plus a contributor status in the credits, your name added to script and a VIP invite to the wrap party.

The Dream Level ($5000 - or more) gets you all of the previously mentioned plus a co-producer acknowledgment in the credits.

IMPORTANT NOTE: The Dream Level is considered investment level, meaning there will be a return on investment at the sale of the show.  We will send simple, easy to understand contracts that explain how this will work.

Angel Investor’s support of $5000.00 so far. 

Your help an support will move this project forward and help bring this comedy to life on screen.

Wanna Know More 

As a not for profit company, funding is always a challenge.

We need funds for a variety of production expenses, insurance, set construction, props, and production locations.

In exchange for your support, we’ve assembled cool perks to show our appreciation. Some of them are tangible items, others are experiences, and meet the cast.

Check-out my youtube channel Hairinhollywood.  I interviewed several crew people above and below the line asking them to explain their job descriptions.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute, that’s cool!  There are other ways you can help.  Like and share,  this campaign and the show "Vanities".

You can share this page with your friends / family / colleagues / ex-partners / neighbors /random people - it really would mean the world to me!

Thank You!

The Hats-off Level ( $30 - $ 50) gets you a shoutout and tag, plus a signed copy of the script and Vanities crew t-shirt.
The Vanities Brush-up Level ($60 - $ $75) gets you all of the above plus a Vanities logo hair brush.
The Swag Level ( $100 - $ $150) gets you all of the previously mentioned plus Vanities crew hat.
The Hot Stuff Level ($200 - $1000) gets your all of the previously mentioned plus a contributor status in the credits, your name added to script and a VIP invite to the wrap party.
The Dream Level ($5000 - or more) gets you all of the previously mentioned plus a co-producer acknowledgment in the credits.
IMPORTANT NOTE: The Dream Level is considered investment level, meaning there will be a return on investment at the sale of the show.  We will send simple, easy to understand contracts that explain how this will work.
Angel Investor’s support of $5000.00 so far. 
Your help an support will move this project forward and help bring this comedy to life on screen.

Wanna Know More 
As a not for profit company, funding is always a challenge.
We need funds for a variety of production expenses, insurance, set construction, props, and production locations.
In exchange for your support, we’ve assembled cool perks to show our appreciation. Some of them are tangible items, others are experiences, and meet the cast.
Check-out my youtube channel Hairinhollywood.  I interviewed several crew people above and below the line asking them to explain their job descriptions.
Other Ways You Can Help

If you can’t contribute, that’s cool!  There are other ways you can help.  Like and share,  this campaign and the show "Vanities".
You can share this page with your friends / family / colleagues / ex-partners / neighbors /random people - it really would mean the world to me!
Thank You!

story:
WAVES is a drama series created, written, directed, and acted in by Shania Banton.  Nia and her sister Jean have an estranged relationship after Jean becomes close with alcohol and partying, around the same time Nia was going through a break up with her fiancé. Jean now returns a year later hoping to mend the relationship with her sister. However, she has a secret that will rip their relationship apart for good.

For season 2 of Waves The Series, we are opening the door to a mature Jean whose life has turned around for the better and a confused Nia who is now trying to figure out what she wants in life. 

Season 1 can be found on;

Kweli TV

Afroland TV

Brainwash Media

Youtube

 

The Story is not over...

Season 1 left everyone wanting, so we must deliver. This story is designed to give hope to the audience so that they know after every downfall the only way to go is up. 

Your Donation

By donating you are contributing to the budget we need to pay the Cast and Crew, feed everyone, and afford amazing loctions we need, not to mention the marketing to ensure we push WAVES to the next level. 

 

Tell. A. Friend

Donations are awesome, but also spreading the word about our fundraiser for Season 2 of WAVES. 

Tweet it

Instagram it

Facebook it

Snapchat it

Please  share &  Tag us on ALL social media at @WavesTheSeries

story:
Short Summary

Hello! We are raising money for our incredible series called “Far Far Away”.

Far Far Away is an original LGBTQ twist on the classic fairytales where we learn everyone deserves to live happily ever after. Join a gay Snow White, a lesbian Rapunzel, and a Transgendered Cinderella as they venture through the forbidden forest to get there happy endings. 

Tony Ardolino is the creator of this story and has been working on it for 2 years. He has been seen on TV, Film, Theater, and is so excited to be brining this idea to life. Growing up Tony hid who he was because, like all of us, he wanted that fairy tale life, but as he grew up he realized you can still be your self and reach that famous happy end.  

We want to make a LGBTQ series that people can find comfort in and relate too. Each episode will include our three characters as they find love, conquer their fears, and meet other fairytales with a modern twist.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are trying to raise $50,000.00. Your contributions will be used for Actors, Permits, Crew, Cameras, Costumes, Editing, and props to bring this magical tale to life! 
  • We would be so honored if you helped us make this dream come true! 
    Any donations will be truly appreciated. Some target amounts will guarantee you a reward! Below you will find what some amounts will get you as a special thanks from us!
    Anything from $5-$10 is very appreciated!!
  1. $25.00- A Special thanks shout out in our closing credits of our Pilot Episode!
  2. $50.00- an Early Bird Copy of our Pilot as well as a signed film still / special thanks Credit! 
  3. $75.00- a limited poison Apple necklace plus a pilot copy and credit! 
  4. $100.00- a personalized baseball hat with our title as well as a copy and credit!
  5. $120.00 or more- signed poster of our pilot cast, plus the other rewards and so much appreciation from our team! 
  • We have been planning this for such a long time and know where each dollar is going to make this series something really special. This is for every  person who has ever felt lost like Cinderella, trapped like Rapunzel, or wishful like Snow White. It’s our time to live happily ever after! We can do this! 

The Impact

We are making something  that has never been made before! We already are receiving so much praise and are bringing this trailer to festivals allowing people to step into a world Far Far Away.

It has already been selected for a few Festivals around the world, visit our website for more details. www.farfarawaytheseries.com

Far Far Away has also received some attention and  we are so thankful that a number of blogs and magazines are reaching out with upcoming blogs and stories about our idea! 

Challenges

We are making a beautiful story that, though is dressed as a lavished fairy tale, is based on things that are happening in our world at this very moment! Tony has been going over and beyond to get this series going to create a story for a community who usually  doesn’t get a story like this. He has been spending money out of his pockets and spent weeks sewing and hot glueing costumes because he is so passionate about FAR FAR AWAY and knows this is story he needs to tell! 
 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Please Help us get the  word out and make some noise about our campaign!
  • Follow us on Instagram @farfaraway.theseries 
  • Use the the Indiegogo share tool and post to your social media! We would be so thankful! 
  • Go to our website and look at what festivals we will be at and come show your support! www.farfarawaytheseries.com

Thank you all so much! As we say in our trailer, “magic is wishing for things to get better- it’s making it better yourself.” 
Thank you for helping our wish come true!

story:
Short Summary

From award-winning filmmaker Mike Swift, The Ushers is about that group of misfits who didn't quite make the cut for groomsmen. They venture through the wedding day with their sarcastic sidekick, a junior bridesmaid by the name of Fallon. It's a story about fitting in, making friends, and realizing what matters in life and we guarantee it'll make you laugh out loud. 

Up and coming producers Helen Li and Tori Kotsen found the script through  NYU Tisch. We knew instantly it was something special that needed to be brought to life.

After workshopping the script and holding several successful readings, we attached and received interest from Emmy award nominated talent to the project.

We have been working incredibly hard on this production for over a year and have already seen interest from some very established leaders in the industry. This series is something we all truly believe in and we are confident it will be successful, but we can't do it without your help.

If you help contribute to our project, your donation will go towards production and post-production costs. You will have a direct impact in the creation of this web series to be pitched to networks like Netflix, IFC, HBO, and Comedy Central.

What We Need & What You Get

With the level of talented people that want to be a part of this series, the budget to begin producing our series is roughly $28,000. 

Your money will be used towards equipment for cameras, lighting, and sound. It will also be applied to securing a location for the filming of the project. You will be helping with costumes and makeup as well as editing in post production. 

Most importantly, your money will help us hire a talented cast and crew and provide them with the proper compensation they deserve for their commitment to the project. 

In addition to being a part of a promising film project, you will also have access to the collection of amazing perks and products we have to share with our donors! You can select many different items and even have a chance to be a more integral part of the final production.

The Impact

Storytelling has the ability to allow humans to release, actively interpret, discuss, escape, and dream in a truly powerful way. Many of you are creative people who don't always have time to pursue this side of you, but this is your perfect chance to do just that by contributing and supporting independent film and art. 

We have had success in this industry before and have never felt so passionate about a project. Mike's most recent web series was presented at Catalyst/ITV Content Fest, Brooklyn Web Fest, New Jersey Web Fest, NYC Web Fest, and more. His previous projects have garnered festival nominations for writing, directing, and cinematography, and won Best Pilot at Brooklyn Web Fest, Best Supporting Actress and  Best Series at Baltimore New Media Festival, and Best Pilot at Minnesota Web Fest. 

Tori Kotsen has produced several successful films that have just entered the festival circuit and already been selected to two. Helen Yi works with tech startup companies and is going to help bring The Ushers to an even higher level.

Comedy has always been something that helps people through rough times. Whether that be a bad day at work, a bad day at school, a break up, family problems, money trouble, or issues with friends, it's always been a place of comfort. Film, television, and web series serve as a medium for people to express themselves and also learn valuable life lessons at the same time. There is no better feeling for an artistic child then going to the movies and escaping into another world. We, The Ushers team, knew we wanted to give this feeling to others and we think this series has the ability to do that. Please consider adding your support to us in this journey.

Risks & Challenges

The entertainment industry can be difficult and we know that every show has a long road to travel before being picked up by a major network. We believe in this project and the promise it has already shown in the team we’ve put together. We are proud of the buzz already created around it. 

We have contacts - executive producers, literary agents, production companies, and casting companies, that have offered their support and expertise in helping us once we finish production. We just need your help in generating the funds to allow us to move forward with producing this entertaining series.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand there are people out there who wish they could be a part of this, but simply are not able to and we want you to know that there are so many other ways to help!

Just by sharing the link to our page you help an immense amount. Telling your friends about this funding launch can lead to them telling theirs and so on until we are reaching an even larger audience. You can show our promo video to people you know in the industry or people who love supporting the arts! Any opportunity you can think of to spread the word and get The Ushers name out there would be greatly appreciated so please take a moment to share this site.

Thank you in advance for your support and we cant wait to send you the announcement when we are ready to premiere!

story:
Short Summary

Aarzu-e-Mann is a love story set in scenic San Francisco, about a Pakistani-American girl, Samira, who is born in a wealthy and politically connected Shah family. 

Her falling in love with an American man with a Pakistani American background, makes things complicated, as she struggles to have her conservative and influential father embrace her choice. 

Being the only child of a wealthy man, other family members are also against her decision and hatch plans to ensure Samira marries within the family. 

Writer Zulfiqar Talpur weaves an intricate web of stories about expatriates living in the U.S., who hold on to tradition while trying to assimilate in their new homeland.

Directed By: Amir Jaffer - http://www.imdb.com/name/nm2060272/

Produced By: Ausaf Masud - http://www.imdb.com/name/nm3721633/

 

Like our page on fb to stay connected. 

https://www.facebook.com/aarzuemann/

https://www.entertainment7.com

https://www.aarzuemann.com

 

Information about cast and crew can be found on iMDB page

http://www.imdb.com/title/tt6091238/

 

Here is a quick list of the cast - details can be found on iMBD and FB Pages

Ausaf Masud - http://www.imdb.com/name/nm3721633/

Saksham Ghai - http://www.imdb.com/name/nm8043049/

Neeru Sehgal - http://www.imdb.com/name/nm7121026/

Sher Ali - http://www.imdb.com/name/nm2757838/

Puneet - http://www.imdb.com/name/nm5988766/

Sivani Bhagwan - http://www.imdb.com/name/nm8464460/

Rashmi Rustagi - http://www.imdb.com/name/nm1884949/

Nandini Minocha - http://www.imdb.com/name/nm3300491/

etc.

story:
Almost Nowhere explores the lives of three best friends as they realize that they only have a year to figure life out and make things happen before their 30th birthdays. 

Society tries to tell you what you should look like by 30 years old.....You should be college educated...You should most definitely be married  or else it may never happen....  You should have a big house, a fluffy white poodle, an impressive portfolio and working on baby #2 or #3,..or at the very least #1.......OR something must really be wrong with you!

NOT......But nevertheless, those of us in our late 20s find ourselves in a "PRE" midlife crises before we enter the decade of our 30s and start trying really hard not to suck by the time we get there.   It's not a bad thing to try to get your life on track on a timer,,,it's just kind of funny to watch. 

Take a ride with us, up and down and back around to Almost........... Nowhere!

 

        

Brittney is an Arkansas native who knew exactly what she wanted to do in life at 8 years old.  She received her first video camera at age 10 and has been hooked ever since.  After moving to Los Angeles,  7 years ago, waiting for opportunities that just weren't appearing, she decided to create her own magic.  After all, she is a Mass Media major who was prepped in writing, producing, filming and editing, so why not DIY?   With lots of great feedback and support from industry friends she is excited to present to the world.... Almost Nowhere.

            

Ron G is blazing a trail as one of the hottest upcoming comedians in Los Angeles. Ron began his stand up career in Atlanta, Georgia, and was crowned first place winner of the 2005 Sierra Mist Late Night Laff Off. After moving to Los Angeles to further his career as a comedian and actor, he was a finalist on Bill Bellamy’s new hit television show Who’s Got Jokes?, and was also a finalist on the most recent season of NBC’s Last Comic Standing. Having Martin Lawrence tell him he was funny is one of Ron G’s career highlights so far, and after receiving his first standing ovation only eight months in the game, he knew he had found his calling.  

Today, Ron travels the globe making people laugh, writes for the award winning CNN Show, #UnitedShades of America, and has begun to show the world his acting chops. We can't tell you everything he has recently been cast for....but look out for him. Have you watched HBO's Insecure lately? ;-) He's a STAR!

              

Krista is a Seattle native that has lived in Los Angeles for over 6 years.  She has studied acting under the highly sought after, Lesly Khan and John Kirby.  Krista never takes herself too seriously and is a comedy addict.  She has appeared in a boat-load of TV shows including, Two and a Half Men, CSI, Veronica Mars, Las Vegas, House, M.D., and the O.C......just to name a few! 

          

Josephine was born in Chicago, IL but spent most of her childhood in Seattle.  She moved to New York City when she was 21 to attend Circle in the Square Theatre School, where she completed their two year conservatory program.  Soon after, she spent a summer in London studying at The Royal Academy of Dramatic Art.  In 2007 she moved to Los Angeles and has been seen on a number of TV shows like Glee and Days of our Lives. Josephine is also part of an award winning web-series that she co-Executive Produced.  She enjoys comedy and sketch comedy.

              

Marché Howell is a Texas native with a background in acting and film production.  She began her career as a print model and commercial actress back home, but after only being in LA a couple of years has found her niche as a comedic goddess.   Marche' has appeared as a host on Black and Sexy TV and has co-hosted Accelerated Ratio's AskALady AskaAMan.  Just recently she wrapped up her live ensemble comedy show, Drinks with Horrible People, and on any random night you may catch her making people laugh doing stand-up around LA!

            

Irwin ‘Moon’ Miller is a passionate and playful creative genius whose academic background and tech savvy mind continue to make an impact among the prominent league of directors for film and television. One of Hollywood’s ‘Next Generation Filmmakers’. Miller’s directing career started in college with multiple short films and Live TV. Directing Live Bowl Games for Direct TV was only the beginning. From live broadcasts for the Emmys, to television promo and concert work for clients like Paramount, HBO, NBC. Not to mention, the multiple short films with nominations in the festival circuit. Miller keeps his Moonlight Film Production Company producing content for high end clients delivering Industry leading content that rivals only the best.

            

Maya Carpenter is an actress, host and producer. Though her career has been peppered with great opportunities, she is in pursuit of the one thing she was always sure of in her life, and that’s acting. She is a storyteller by nature so whether it is writing to convey a message or portraying a role that has a message, Maya finds a way to share people's stories. She’s a quirky girl with southern charm, hailing from the sunshine state of Florida. An old spirit at heart, Maya has the ability to adapt very quickly to change and is able to transform into drama-intense roles people may not see her in at first glance. When she’s not acting, writing or producing, she is steady creating ways to build her brand.  Her ultimate goal in life is to change the lives and perspectives through the gifts God has given her, she says. “God gave me this journey for a reason, and I’m going to do everything in power to fulfill His plan.”

              

Jason Mimms is a Chicago native whose acting talents and passions were first noticed by his mom at an early age.  After practically shoving the once, extremely shy, young Jason into his first acting class, he knew exactly what gifts the world needed from him and began to prepare for his journey to deliver. He began with theatrical training at the Chicago Theatre Company, formerly, a well-known black theatre on the city's South Side, he crushed the infamous stages of Chicago's Second City, and then he went on to receive a Bachelor of Arts degree in Theatre Arts from Clark-Atlanta University.

His latest work includes the role of Cam in the movie,  Boy Bye, which is currently on  Netflix, Robey Theatre Company's Knock Me A Kiss and, The Magnificent Dunbar Hotel, several commercials to mention including Credit Karma,,,and with all that going on, he is producing Almost Nowhere and is the Executive Producer/Creator/Writer of his new comedy series, "Bad Luck", which is slated to begin production later this fall.
          
Melkwych, which is German, because.....well his dad just liked Germany, was born and raised in Miami, Florida.  When he was just 9 years old he sent his drawings of Disney characters to Disney studios and asked for a job as an artist.  They replied with admiration and intrigue but informed him that they did not have any positions for a 9 year old.  To soften the blow, they gave him tickets to see the movie that would change his life forever........ Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles!  After seeing the movie he was hooked and knew that his future was in film making.  Fast forward to the present and he has a whole slew of credits and experience and can operate just about anything on set but his greatest passion is directing.  Melkwych is excited to be a part of the Almost Nowhere family and can't wait to put on his director's hat!......And ACTION!
 
          

Teddy is a Brooklyn native that has lived in LA for a little over 5 years. He has studied at the New York Film Academy and Los Angeles Film school where his focus was cinematography.  He loves being behind the camera and views everything as art.  He is always looking for the, "mise-enscéne."  His over-all goal is to be one of the best cinematographers to ever do it and he wouldn't mind, one day, being compared to Roger Deakins. (Look him up)

         ......MORE AWESOME CAST & CREW

 

              

 

              

We've got a great story, an awesome cast and a really cool crew....BUT we need financial support to finish the series.  That means WE NEED YOU! Every single dollar raised will go towards producing, marketing and distributing this project.  Here's  a breakdown of how the money will be spent:

                   

 

               

​
story_txt:
Almost Nowhere explores the lives of three best friends as they realize that they only have a year to figure life out and make things happen before their 30th birthdays. 
Society tries to tell you what you should look like by 30 years old.....You should be college educated...You should most definitely be married  or else it may never happen....  You should have a big house, a fluffy white poodle, an impressive portfolio and working on baby #2 or #3,..or at the very least #1.......OR something must really be wrong with you!
NOT......But nevertheless, those of us in our late 20s find ourselves in a "PRE" midlife crises before we enter the decade of our 30s and start trying really hard not to suck by the time we get there.   It's not a bad thing to try to get your life on track on a timer,,,it's just kind of funny to watch. 
Take a ride with us, up and down and back around to Almost........... Nowhere!

 

         

Brittney is an Arkansas native who knew exactly what she wanted to do in life at 8 years old.  She received her first video camera at age 10 and has been hooked ever since.  After moving to Los Angeles,  7 years ago, waiting for opportunities that just weren't appearing, she decided to create her own magic.  After all, she is a Mass Media major who was prepped in writing, producing, filming and editing, so why not DIY?   With lots of great feedback and support from industry friends she is excited to present to the world.... Almost Nowhere.
             
Ron G is blazing a trail as one of the hottest upcoming comedians in Los Angeles. Ron began his stand up career in Atlanta, Georgia, and was crowned first place winner of the 2005 Sierra Mist Late Night Laff Off. After moving to Los Angeles to further his career as a comedian and actor, he was a finalist on Bill Bellamy’s new hit television show Who’s Got Jokes?, and was also a finalist on the most recent season of NBC’s Last Comic Standing. Having Martin Lawrence tell him he was funny is one of Ron G’s career highlights so far, and after receiving his first standing ovation only eight months in the game, he knew he had found his calling.  
Today, Ron travels the globe making people laugh, writes for the award winning CNN Show, #UnitedShades of America, and has begun to show the world his acting chops. We can't tell you everything he has recently been cast for....but look out for him. Have you watched HBO's Insecure lately? ;-) He's a STAR!
               
Krista is a Seattle native that has lived in Los Angeles for over 6 years.  She has studied acting under the highly sought after, Lesly Khan and John Kirby.  Krista never takes herself too seriously and is a comedy addict.  She has appeared in a boat-load of TV shows including, Two and a Half Men, CSI, Veronica Mars, Las Vegas, House, M.D., and the O.C......just to name a few! 
           
Josephine was born in Chicago, IL but spent most of her childhood in Seattle.  She moved to New York City when she was 21 to attend Circle in the Square Theatre School, where she completed their two year conservatory program.  Soon after, she spent a summer in London studying at The Royal Academy of Dramatic Art.  In 2007 she moved to Los Angeles and has been seen on a number of TV shows like Glee and Days of our Lives. Josephine is also part of an award winning web-series that she co-Executive Produced.  She enjoys comedy and sketch comedy.
               
Marché Howell is a Texas native with a background in acting and film production.  She began her career as a print model and commercial actress back home, but after only being in LA a couple of years has found her niche as a comedic goddess.   Marche' has appeared as a host on Black and Sexy TV and has co-hosted Accelerated Ratio's AskALady AskaAMan.  Just recently she wrapped up her live ensemble comedy show, Drinks with Horrible People, and on any random night you may catch her making people laugh doing stand-up around LA!
             
Irwin ‘Moon’ Miller is a passionate and playful creative genius whose academic background and tech savvy mind continue to make an impact among the prominent league of directors for film and television. One of Hollywood’s ‘Next Generation Filmmakers’. Miller’s directing career started in college with multiple short films and Live TV. Directing Live Bowl Games for Direct TV was only the beginning. From live broadcasts for the Emmys, to television promo and concert work for clients like Paramount, HBO, NBC. Not to mention, the multiple short films with nominations in the festival circuit. Miller keeps his Moonlight Film Production Company producing content for high end clients delivering Industry leading content that rivals only the best.
             
Maya Carpenter is an actress, host and producer. Though her career has been peppered with great opportunities, she is in pursuit of the one thing she was always sure of in her life, and that’s acting. She is a storyteller by nature so whether it is writing to convey a message or portraying a role that has a message, Maya finds a way to share people's stories. She’s a quirky girl with southern charm, hailing from the sunshine state of Florida. An old spirit at heart, Maya has the ability to adapt very quickly to change and is able to transform into drama-intense roles people may not see her in at first glance. When she’s not acting, writing or producing, she is steady creating ways to build her brand.  Her ultimate goal in life is to change the lives and perspectives through the gifts God has given her, she says. “God gave me this journey for a reason, and I’m going to do everything in power to fulfill His plan.”
               
Jason Mimms is a Chicago native whose acting talents and passions were first noticed by his mom at an early age.  After practically shoving the once, extremely shy, young Jason into his first acting class, he knew exactly what gifts the world needed from him and began to prepare for his journey to deliver. He began with theatrical training at the Chicago Theatre Company, formerly, a well-known black theatre on the city's South Side, he crushed the infamous stages of Chicago's Second City, and then he went on to receive a Bachelor of Arts degree in Theatre Arts from Clark-Atlanta University.
His latest work includes the role of Cam in the movie,  Boy Bye, which is currently on  Netflix, Robey Theatre Company's Knock Me A Kiss and, The Magnificent Dunbar Hotel, several commercials to mention including Credit Karma,,,and with all that going on, he is producing Almost Nowhere and is the Executive Producer/Creator/Writer of his new comedy series, "Bad Luck", which is slated to begin production later this fall.

story:
About Everyone Else Has!

New York Millennials are busy AF, but the hustle doesn’t guarantee gains. Dead end jobs, broken hearts, and nihilism-tinged narcissism are ever-present.

Enter TJ, Delilah, Harry, and Jules. Whether they’re stalling out, hitting setbacks, or reveling in mediocrity, the one thing they can agree on is their lives are not going as planned.  Will they wake up in time to find some meaning to it all? Can they learn to like themselves in a world comparing them to everyone else?

Ever trying, often failing, life is one shit storm of a journey, not a destination. It’s another malcontent day in a world where what you want is what Everyone Else Has.

 

About Us!

Logan, Ewa, Jonathan, and Mary are four NYC-based actors who met doing an Off-Off-Broadway production of a seldom performed Shakespeare play. While the show lasted only three weeks, their friendship has lasted three years. Over many late nights of coffee and conversation, they decided to create something themselves. This endeavor would have a dash more of a contemporary feel than their last project. Through improvisation, character work, and trial and error they created the characters TJ, Delilah, Harry, and Jules. Everyone Else Has is the result of four different voices collaborating to create the kind of show they’d like to not only see, but be in. After a year of writing and rewriting, they are ready for the next stage: to shoot!

 

 Thank you for your interest in our project and we hope that, even if you don’t donate, you will come back and watch the show! We think you’ll like it. And if you DO donate, you’ll not only earn a special place in our hearts, but you’ll earn some truly amazing perks like a walk on role, poster, or cocktails with the cast!

 

Logan Keeler (co-writer/producer, actor) has lived and acted in New York for 6 years and has met every character in Everyone Else Has on the streets at least once. Originally from Maine, his two homes have made him a bit of a jack-of-all-trades, as which he can chop wood as well as he can J-walk. Both skills are competent at best. As an actor, he's had varying success here and there (credentials are available upon request) but as a co-producer/co-writer he has never been more proud than with this fledgling, yet spunky creation, Everyone Else Has. He'd like to thank Phylicia Rashad for the inspiration to make this project possible. 

Jonathan Minton (co-writer/director, actor) is an actor, director, and writer living in Brooklyn, NY, and remembers when Everyone Else Has was just an overlong inside joke during a walk down Amsterdam. He hails from Alaska, where he created the late-night sketch comedy show The Pogo Stick, GoGo Dancer Company (aka The PoGoGoGoCo), for which he was a writer, director, and producer. His greatest claim to fame is being an extra in a Paul Sorvino film, and sitting at a table at Think Coffee in the West Village with John Cameron Mitchell for two polite hours. As a small child, Jonathan had a floppy-eared dog puppet named Whitey; today that puppet sits atop his bookshelf. He would like to dedicate this project to Whitey and extends his regrets at naming him that in the first place.

Ewa Maria Wojcik (co-writer/ actress) grew up in Larchmont, New York attending a French school. She speaks Polish, French, and thinks she can speak Spanish. She holds a BA in Theatre from Fordham Univeristy and an MA in Classical Acting from the Royal Central School of Speech and Drama in London. Ewa Maria took part in a short comedy sketch, The Expert, which has had over 17 million views on YouTube and she most recently played Olivia in Twelfth Night at The Secret Theatre. Morgan Freeman hugged Ewa Maria once after she almost hit him while opening a door. When she was twelve, a drunken mob boss interrupted her family's dinner in a restaurant in Poland to shake her hand. She complied, thinking she would never see it again. Instead, he gave it back to her, along with one hundred American dollars. 

Mary DeCarlo  (co-writer/producer, actor) is a playwright and actor living in Queens, NY. She is originally from Scranton, PA which also happens to be the setting of one of her favorite comedies. Bet you can't guess which one. She has a BFA in Acting from Arcadia University and an MA in Text and Performance (that's text, not to be confused with texting) from the Royal Academy of Dramatic Art and Birkbeck Univeristy of London. While she is beyond the moon thrilled to be making this project come to life, she still holds out hope that our first idea for a web series (Menage a Huh?) will someday see the light of your computer screen. 

 

Where Donations Go

We are asking for a total of $7000 to meet our project goals.  

We will be shooting a total of ten episodes. 

Each episode will take three days to shoot.

Your funds will help cover the cost for our director of photography, sound person, food for our cast, transportation, locations, and totally necessary props like giant foam penises.

Creating new content is challenging, but also hugely exciting! We have worked together previously and know that we can create a unique and fun project together with your help. We are so looking forward to sharing this with you. Thank you in advance!

 

Other Ways To Chip In!

If you can't donate right now, no worries! Please share our campaign and/or our Facebook page with your friends! It would really mean the world to us to see your support. We are going to be putting out a lot of silly photos and funny teasers through our social media pages and you won’t want to miss out! Like us on Facebook and Instagram, Everyone Else Has! https://www.facebook.com/EveryoneElseHas/

story:
Back in 2014, Mark and Jon had an idea, a camera, several actors willing to give their time, and an apartment. Jon wrote a script, the camera rolled, the actors acted, and the idea grew. And then it grew some more. By the time it was completed almost a year and a half later, there were 10 episodes and an entire Season of comedic tomfoolery. Thus came WINK, Season 1. Please watch it here:

http://www.jonsaks.com/wink/

We are ready for Season 2. We can feel it in the air. We are very excited to get started, but we need your help.  We only ask that you give $10 to our campaign.  It's 4 coffees. Dunkin Donuts has bags of coffee that you can take home for $9.99, and they come in a wide variety of flavors (NOT A PLUG). Most of all, you would be supporting a fantastic group of artists and their vision.  Everyone involved will love you forever. Forever. For realz. Thanks for donating!

story:
We are a group of future actors, writers, musicians and directors, but first and foremost we're friends. 

  • This is a passion project we've wanted to make for a long time. We've spent days, nights and endless WhatsApp conversations coming up with larger-than-life characters, writing silly songs, designing costume, makeup and SFX and testing out our corny sense of humour.
  • We are young people in different stages of education and employment. Unfortunately, our funds don't match our ambition, so we're asking for your help to make this show AWESOME!

A dollar makes us wanna holler

  • We have estimated that for location hire, costume, props, set pieces, makeup and prosthetics, we will need around £1000. That sounds high, but it's what's known as a microbudget- believe us, you'd need almost 117,000 times that to make a Star Trek movie! We don't need their pro-level CGI or dedicated wranglers to handle Zachary Quinto's eyebrows, so we can be a little more modest budget-wise.
  • We're offering a whole host of fun, wacky perks. Everything from a producer credit to a shoutout to signed art to- gasp- MERCH! Also included is the opportunity to protect yourself from the upcoming robot apocalypse- don't say we didn't warn you!

Why is this so gosh-darn important to us?

  • Between us, we have an award-nominated filmmaker and props artist, BFI Film Academy graduate, a Touring Theatre student, a recording artist who studies at the Identity School of Acting by day, a writer/actress/director on her way to acting school, a fully-fledged actor/writer with a host of professional credits and a musician who has produced work for countless short films and videos. Not bad for a team with an average age of 19.8! 
  • We are all self-made creators- we weren't handed anything, nobody held our hand or spoon-fed us to get us to where we are. We worked to achieve everything we have today and this is only the next step to our TOTAL WORLD DOMINATION!... Or just having a great career! That's cool too!

Potential Roadblocks

  • In the event we fall short, we will implement some Plan Bs to bolster our income- that might involve selling cakes (we make some pretty tasty ones), making merchandise or hosting some garage sales. Whatever happens, we WILL make Space Pricks happen. The show must always go on!

Can't donate?

If the unrelenting machinations of the capitalist system prevent you from donating to us, no sweat! You can still help us!

  • TELL PEOPLE! SPREAD THE WORD! When you talk to your friends, drop Space Pricks in at every opportunity you get until they tell you to shut up! Tell the cashier at your local supermarket as they scan through your fish fingers and Jaffa Cakes- they'll LOVE it! 
  • Use the shiny Indiegogo share tools! Get this on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram (sorry in advance for messing up your aesthetic), Tumblr, everything! Tell that greasy guy you met on Tinder (but tell him we DON'T want pictures. Please.)

That's all for now, kids! We'll be back with updates on how production's going, so watch this space!

story:
Short Summary

  • What is "Empowered: The Series"? 
    • A 10-episode web series focusing on a group of teenage superheroes as they further develop their powers, and are united in the efforts to rescue an endangered friend and fight a threat to their very existence. 
    • A superhero web series that seeks to turn the typical lack and/or poor representation of women in the genre on its head, and present female superheroes in a new fashion: normal, everyday, strong women who happen to have super powers; someone that girls can actually look up to. Although the characters have super powers, we believe that they can show children, adolescents, and young adults--especially girls/young women--that they can feel empowered simply by who they are as a person. 
  • Crew:
    • Jarrod Finn- Screenwriter/Creator
    • Kris Wilcox- Director
    • Isaac Musgrave- Director of Photography
    • Ryan Marshall- Sound Engineer
    • Leigh Kaiser- Casting Director
    • Linda Evans- Location Scout
    • Mandi Huffman- Brand Consultant
    • Johnny Nation- Practical Effects
    • Bob Dignan- Assistant DP
  • Cast:
    • Laura Bane as Evelyn "Evie" Tobolsky. Evie is a 16-year-old Broadway and theater fanatic who lives for the stage and for performing. She dreams to be a professional singer just like her grandmother from whom Evie gets her affinity for 40s big band music/standards. Evie is one of the most warm-hearted, kind, caring, jovial, and giving people you'll ever meet; her ability to make people feel welcome and appreciated is astounding. Superpowers: Sonic scream; siren song (can bend a person's will to hers by singing).

                                

             

  • Jessica Limardo as Monica Baez. Monica, 19, is a single mom of a wonderful 10-month old boy Kai. After 3-years of training she has been a rather skilled MMA fighter and kickboxer. Juggling the weight of a single motherhood and school certainly stresses her out, but the training has been her means to take care of herself. Don't judge the book by the cover though. She is tough and protective. For Monica, the best way to deal with a criminal or aggressor is to get right to the point: take them down. Talking and working through their "issues" is just not efficient.      Superpower: Super strength

 

 

  • Dominique Allen as Hayden Bennet. Hayden is 17, and has become a close confidant of Evie, and good friend with the rest of the group. She's formed a bond with Tempest--Hayden was once the new kid just like Tempest--and has helped her adjust.                                 On the surface, Hayden is friendly but after years of battling insecurities has developed defenses that can cause her personality to flip quickly. No super powers

                 

                                   

 

   

  • Estella Samii as Bryn Cooke. Bryn is 16, extremely socially and politically active (she is an aspiring journalist), and a military brat. After the loss of her mother Korinne, she and her father moved to Champaign to be closer to her grandmother. The loss, which shattered both their worlds, forged an even closer relationship with her father. She is one of Evie's best friends and is on the school newspaper staff with her. Superpower: Super intelligence; developing telekinesis

 

  • Gwen Kaiser as Tempest Grace. Tempest is a 14-year-old dance student who has love for ballet. She has only been studying for about 6 months or so, but has oddly picked everything up rapidly. Tempest identifies as Queer, and currently has a crush on a junior named Bree. While socially awkward and not entirely skilled at making friends, when she is able to she is incredibly loyal to them. Such is the case as the group of girls (Evie, Bryn, and Hayden) have welcomed them into the group. For most of her youth Tempest has searched for friends to help her break out of her shell, and finally she's found said friends. She and Hayden have formed a close bond as they both battle through insecurities. Superpower: We'll just call it "kinesthetics" for now. She has a sort of super agility, is able to pick up and replicate physical movements (sports, dance, etc) extremely quickly, and can foresee a person's movements/attacks several steps ahead.

 

  • James R. Ling as Alex Davenport. Alex, 30, is a PhD candidate at the local university and works as a TA for Bryn Cooke's father Gregory. What Alex lacks in powers, he makes up for in intelligence and his ability to absorb new information quickly. Throughout his academic career Alex has been obsessed with the regenerative nature of certain organisms. That obsession lead him to discover Gregory Cooke's research, which in turn became the catalyst for Alex's desire to work under Cooke.

           

 

  • Contributions to this particular campaign will allow our team to produce and distribute the pilot for the series. The funding will also help put us in the right direction to potentially sell said pilot to online distributors and/or produce an entire season.  .

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are seeking a total of $25,000. Your donations to this campaign will cover the following:
    • Production/Post-Production Costs (Equipment rental, crew, reshoots/pick ups if necessary)
    • Catering/Crafts Table for Cast and Crew
    • Props/Practical Effects
    • Travel and Lodging for Two Cast Members
    • Any excess or leftover funds will be applied to branding such as posters, etc., and transferred over to funding of the full season. 
  • Perks for contributing will range from a hearty thank you to digital and physical copies of both the pilot and the script to actual props from production to even invitations to set, screenings, and after parties. We even offer an opportunity to be an executive producer. 
  • Funds, if we do not reach our goal, will still be applied to production costs as best we can. 

The Impact

  • While our overall goal is to create an entertaining and well-produced pilot episode, our intentions are to bring a new perspective to the superhero genre. As superhero and comic book fans, we have grown frustrated with not only the lackluster representation of females, but also realistic female heroes when they are present. We have decided to remedy this issue by creating superheroes women, young and old alike, can relate to and support. No fawning over boys. No costumes that make them look like Jane Fonda in an exercise video. Real, down to earth, teenage girls that face everyday struggles and just happen to have powers. 
  • In addition to the female representation, we seek to tackle issues that currently face the nation; issues/topics that we feel the nation needs to see and hear. 
  • In the end, we hope to create a world of superheroes that ALL people can look up to and cheer on. 

Risks & Challenges

  • The only challenges we foresee are:
    • Executing the practical effects. Fortunately we have brought in a consultant to help advise said execution. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • If you are unable to contribute financially, there are still many ways you can help us out! Spread the word. Share the campaign on social media. Tell your friends and family. It's even just as easy as clicking the share tools right here on IndieGoGo.
story_txt:
Short Summary

What is "Empowered: The Series"? 
A 10-episode web series focusing on a group of teenage superheroes as they further develop their powers, and are united in the efforts to rescue an endangered friend and fight a threat to their very existence. 
A superhero web series that seeks to turn the typical lack and/or poor representation of women in the genre on its head, and present female superheroes in a new fashion: normal, everyday, strong women who happen to have super powers; someone that girls can actually look up to. Although the characters have super powers, we believe that they can show children, adolescents, and young adults--especially girls/young women--that they can feel empowered simply by who they are as a person. 


Crew:
Jarrod Finn- Screenwriter/Creator
Kris Wilcox- Director
Isaac Musgrave- Director of Photography
Ryan Marshall- Sound Engineer
Leigh Kaiser- Casting Director
Linda Evans- Location Scout
Mandi Huffman- Brand Consultant
Johnny Nation- Practical Effects
Bob Dignan- Assistant DP


Cast:
Laura Bane as Evelyn "Evie" Tobolsky. Evie is a 16-year-old Broadway and theater fanatic who lives for the stage and for performing. She dreams to be a professional singer just like her grandmother from whom Evie gets her affinity for 40s big band music/standards. Evie is one of the most warm-hearted, kind, caring, jovial, and giving people you'll ever meet; her ability to make people feel welcome and appreciated is astounding. Superpowers: Sonic scream; siren song (can bend a person's will to hers by singing).


                                
             

Jessica Limardo as Monica Baez. Monica, 19, is a single mom of a wonderful 10-month old boy Kai. After 3-years of training she has been a rather skilled MMA fighter and kickboxer. Juggling the weight of a single motherhood and school certainly stresses her out, but the training has been her means to take care of herself. Don't judge the book by the cover though. She is tough and protective. For Monica, the best way to deal with a criminal or aggressor is to get right to the point: take them down. Talking and working through their "issues" is just not efficient.      Superpower: Super strength
 
 

Dominique Allen as Hayden Bennet. Hayden is 17, and has become a close confidant of Evie, and good friend with the rest of the group. She's formed a bond with Tempest--Hayden was once the new kid just like Tempest--and has helped her adjust.                                 On the surface, Hayden is friendly but after years of battling insecurities has developed defenses that can cause her personality to flip quickly. Estella Samii as Bryn Cooke. Bryn is 16, extremely socially and politically active (she is an aspiring journalist), and a military brat. After the loss of her mother Korinne, she and her father moved to Champaign to be closer to her grandmother. The loss, which shattered both their worlds, forged an even closer relationship with her father. She is one of Evie's best friends and is on the school newspaper staff with her. Superpower: Super intelligence; developing telekinesis
 

Gwen Kaiser as Tempest Grace. Tempest is a 14-year-old dance student who has love for ballet. She has only been studying for about 6 months or so, but has oddly picked everything up rapidly. Tempest identifies as Queer, and currently has a crush on a junior named Bree. While socially awkward and not entirely skilled at making friends, when she is able to she is incredibly loyal to them. Such is the case as the group of girls (Evie, Bryn, and Hayden) have welcomed them into the group. For most of her youth Tempest has searched for friends to help her break out of her shell, and finally she's found said friends. She and Hayden have formed a close bond as they both battle through insecurities. Superpower: We'll just call it "kinesthetics" for now. She has a sort of super agility, is able to pick up and replicate physical movements (sports, dance, etc) extremely quickly, and can foresee a person's movements/attacks several steps ahead.
 

James R. Ling as Alex Davenport. Alex, 30, is a PhD candidate at the local university and works as a TA for Bryn Cooke's father Gregory. What Alex lacks in powers, he makes up for in intelligence and his ability to absorb new information quickly. Throughout his academic career Alex has been obsessed with the regenerative nature of certain organisms. That obsession lead him to discover Gregory Cooke's research, which in turn became the catalyst for Alex's desire to work under Cooke.
           
 
Contributions to this particular campaign will allow our team to produce and distribute the pilot for the series. The funding will also help put us in the right direction to potentially sell said pilot to online distributors and/or produce an entire season.  .

What We Need & What You Get

We are seeking a total of $25,000. Your donations to this campaign will cover the following:
Production/Post-Production Costs (Equipment rental, crew, reshoots/pick ups if necessary)
Catering/Crafts Table for Cast and Crew
Props/Practical Effects
Travel and Lodging for Two Cast Members
Any excess or leftover funds will be applied to branding such as posters, etc., and transferred over to funding of the full season. 


Perks for contributing will range from a hearty thank you to digital and physical copies of both the pilot and the script to actual props from production to even invitations to set, screenings, and after parties. We even offer an opportunity to be an executive producer. 
Funds, if we do not reach our goal, will still be applied to production costs as best we can. 


The Impact

As superhero and comic book fans, we have grown frustrated with not only the lackluster representation of females, but also realistic female heroes when they are present. We have decided to remedy this issue by creating superheroes women, young and old alike, can relate to and support. No fawning over boys. No costumes that make them look like Jane Fonda in an exercise video. Real, down to earth, teenage girls that face everyday struggles and just happen to have powers. 
In addition to the female representation, we seek to tackle issues that currently face the nation; issues/topics that we feel the nation needs to see and hear. 
In the end, we hope to create a world of superheroes that ALL people can look up to and cheer on. 


Risks & Challenges

story:
A Knight's Training

 

If you have ever wondered how medieval knights trained themselves for battle, A Knight's Training will give the answer. 

I am Arturo Camargo, I am a historian and for over 8 years I have practiced historical fencing. Along all those year, I have asked myself, do I really have what it takes to become a knight?

To answer that question I did a research on how knights and swordsmen prepared themselves for a lifetime of combat. This project is a way to show the world the findings of that investigation. (Find the research here: http://hroarr.com/take-great-pains-in-your-knig...).

In a series of 10 episodes we will explore the advice of medieval combat masters, and we will visit experts of several disciplines a knight should master before going to battle, from gymnastics and strength training, to running and marching in armor, horseback riding and sword fighting.

Finally we will test this regime at a tournament! 

 

The goals!

 

Our first target is $2500 USD. This will allow us to invest on the basic production of the series, acquire the right equipment for the shooting, and to access several locations were we expect to shoot the episodes.

If you sponsor this project you will get access to behind the scenes material, in most cases you will get a Train as a Knight shirt, and you could even get a piece of armor used during the shooting of the series.

 

What happens if we do not reach our goal?

All the help we get counts, so the money raised will be used to cover the primary expenses of the project.

What happens if we outreach our goal?

This definitely will allow us to deliver an even better series, and we would be able to increase the number of episodes.

 

Other ways to help! 

 

Even just $1 is awesome help. however If you like this project, but you are not able to give financial aid at the moment, you can still help us by sharing it on you social networks, make more people aware of it!

 

The language... 

 

Your pitch video is in Spanish, will the series be also recorded in Spanish?

Do not worry about this, we will make sure the series are available both in English and in Spanish.

 

The episodes 

 

Episode 1. Gymnastics

  • We will visit a gymnastics school and will try some of the basic stunts on the floor, including the handstand and bridges, always present in period representations of physical training. Also we will give it a try to some vaulting moves.

Episode 2. Athletics

  • We will go to the track to learn more about both javelin throw and shot put. Activities practiced since the classical antiquity and repeatedly recommended by the medieval masters.

Episode 3. Steintossen and weight training

  • Within the Germanic areas Steintossen, or stone throwing, was very popular as a way to strengthen the body, so we will check it out, and discuss the main differences with the shot put, and some similarities with modern weight lifting.

Episode 4. Archery

  • An knight had to be proficient in every aspect of combat, range combat included. 

Episode 5. Sword fighting

  • We will talk about the importance of sword fighting in the training regime of a medieval knight, including the several advice given by kings and masters in the matter of the sword. Also, we will have our first fully armored sparring.

Episode 6. Dancing

  • Dancing? really? Well, yes. Not just Talhoffer, a now very well known 15th Century fencing master, but also Jean Le Maingre, Marshal of France, advice their apprentices to practice dancing as part of their knightly practices.

Episode 7. Foot March

  • Foot march is one of the most common activities advised by the medieval masters to improve ones physical condition, preferably wearing armor. To honor this advice we will hike a volcano at no least than 15350ft over sea level, and of course, wearing armor.

Episode 8. Horseback riding

  • It is no secret that knights should master horseback riding. So we will do some of it, and will try some feats knights practiced constantly. Vaulting will be back, but now over actual horses.

Episode 9. Running 

  • Besides foot march, running was also advised repeatedly. As last step in our preparation foe the end of the season, we will run a 5 K race wearing the whole set of armor.

Episode 10. The final tournament

  • As promised we will close the season testing the whole regime within a tournament.

story:
Australia: Cook to Mabo to… is a multi format, multi-platform documentary.  

The idea for this project sprung from a conversation over coffee, Two years ago I was told of the Myall Creek Massacre, I went to school in Australia and never heard of Myall Creek, British A bomb testing on Australian soil, or Australian Vets coming back from WW1 and being shunned, much like Vietnam Vets.

We are also producing a 17 minute Virtual Reality (VR) documentary Bajarajin Quandamoka, that traces the 20,000 years of settlement of the Quandamooka people in their Country. surrounding Moreton Bay Queensland.

Production commences mid 2017 and will be completed mid 2019, from the very beginning of production we will have a conversation with Australians and  promote and live stream from various events and interviews on our own facebook streaming channel where we will encourage live Q and A sessions. Some of these live events will be digifilmed in 360 VR.  Some of the streams will be multi camera. A high level of multi-format and multi-platform material will be produced.

Lengths of the project vary from one minute Aussie Moments to a multi episode 6 part documentary series, a two hour digifilm movie, to 15-16 minute school episodes with on line teacher guides.

Our award-winning production team ensures Australia: Cook to Mabo to… is spectacular, informative, provocative and gripping.  Australia: Cook to Mabo to… will reach into many of Australia's communities to tell the Australian' story and help remove the veneer.

We encourage you to support Australia: Cook to Mabo to... in doing so you will be participating fully in this community project. All funds raised will be used for digifilming, animation and post production and be matched by Cook to Mabo Pty. Ltd..

story:
Short Project Summary

Hello, my name is Zach Letter. I've been a career entertainer for nearly 10 years. And a firm believer in cryptocurrency for longer than I can remember. With my two passions of crypto and entertainment, I created CCN. But I want more, more for the viewer and more for this great community. So I'm setting out to create the most informative, reliable and trustworthy news network on planet Earth! I'm looking to deliver a professional Crypto News broadcast of 30 minutes in length once a day to all the crypto believers out there. With a news set, professional broadcasters, a full production crew and a load of researchers. To bring you the best crypto news out there!

Why We're Fundraising

Funding is important to such a grand initiative such as this. As the creator of CCN I'm putting $40,000 of my own money into the start of this project. But that's nowhere near the cost of starting something as bold as this. So that's where I reach out to you, a very loyal supporter of CCN, myself and cryptocurrency. I want to create a mainstream pro crypto news show, that helps eliminate FUD. The money pledged by you, will go to helping bring this dream to life.

The Budget

30% - Funding a professional studio space to build out an amazing news set!

35% - Funding the salary of 2 professional crypto researchers and 1 additional broadcaster!

30% - Funding Production such as lights, camera's and operators of said equipment and salary!

05% - Funding Campaign Rewards

The Impact

If we're able to fund this dream, we'll become a one stop shop of cryptocurrency news. The only source you'll need, to keep you informed on everything crypto! With 3 cryptocurrency videos a day and then the 30 MINUTE LONG Crypto Evening News you'll have your crypto fill everyday! We're looking to set a new standard in the crypto entertainment and information market!

Challenges

Of course we'll face challenges, such as finding great researchers and one additional broadcaster. Plus trying to turn around relevant professional content everyday. But with your help I know we'll be able to produce the show of our dreams. A show you deserve!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you've decided to pledge to our dream and help make it a reality, thank you! And if you're looking to help more, share this campaign EVERYWHERE! Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and around the water cooler at work. All are appreicated.
