story:
Short Summary

My name is Jay Alexander Fernandez (a.k.a. Xander) and I am a proud native of Ponce, Puerto Rico. Since I was just a kid to this day, I've looked to create stories that can make an audience think out of the norm in order to obtain a new and unforgettable lesson. Because I strongly believe a story is one of the most unique elements in any piece of art; with the power to touch a person’s heart or even tear it apart. My main focus has always been to do one or the other. Xander's Eye Productions is just an extension of myself as an artist. Love Element is just one of the more efficient steps my team and I plan to take in order to not only provide audiences with a compelling parallel on life and its hidden meanings, but also literal expression full of deep and relatable emotions.

  • Love Element, carries a heavy amount of symbolic factors that will naturally allow audiences to relate to what they see on screen, while still being entertained with a  metaphoric visual representation of our planet.
  • All of this will be shown through expression, movement, and setting! In an essence the episodes will be pantomimes broken into five different episodes: Earth I, Water II, Air III, Fire IV, and Love Element V.   
  • I have worked on the script for this series for almost two years now. It began as a small idea dealing with how most of us as humans can become unaware of the fact that things much bigger than us have happened, are happening, and will continue to happen through existence; that this planet holds emotion and expression just like each of us. All in all, I intend to repay each contributor that shares this vision by simply creating something worth sharing with the world, for world. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • Realistically, my team and I need around $10,000 to produce this series; However, we seek at least $6,000 of that. With that budget actors can be supplied a fair payment as well as flat rates for the crew's work and time; Not to mention gas, food, props, set-design, and most of all, emergencies. If our financial goal is achieved or exceeded, then our team will be able to comfortably travel and hire/collaborate with out of state production crews allowing us to shoot on specific locations across the U.S.
  • As you possibly wonder why we need to travel, let me emphasize that traveling to different regions will be crucial for this series. I have always been a huge advocate for picking specific locations allowing proper staging according to whatever script is at work. Locations for this series need to be authentic considering the story will take place almost entirely in nature.
  • We as a team wish to create the right aesthetic in order create the movie magic this story deserves. For the most part, each episode will introduce a new element, hence presenting a new location/aesthetic.
  • Anyone who contributes past a certain donation amount will be given access to a variety of perks such as (Free access to our 5 premieres beginning as early as April, 2019 | Signed poster by the cast and director | Film Credit along with a personalized gift from the writer/director himself | T-Shirt | In-Person or Virtual Q&A with the leadership team and full cast) 
  • If all Earth fails, pun intended, and our team doesn't reach the financial goal of at least $6,000, my leadership team and I will make absolutely sure that whatever amount we had the privilege of earning, no matter how much, will be used in the most efficient way possible, not to mention I as a responsible director would be sure to have a sit-down with my creative department and ensure we take away anything that isn't necessary from the script in order for the story to deliver beautifully avoiding any lack in the quality promised to audiences. 

The Impact

  • This project isn't just about achieving a well-produced web series, it is about spreading a handful of messages directly correlating to our society today. Since the beginning of time darkness has always existed, but it is always strongest in its present time, and for that reason pain has spread around the world more than ever causing disruption in our hearts, in our lives; but love really is a powerful force, and it has been offered to us constantly since we were first brought into existence. Signs point to a path full of peace awaiting in our universe; the knowlege to find it is within us, if only we'd learn to to search in the dark.
  • The truth is, my biggest wish in life is to one day earn the chance to properly craft something powerful and compelling; the beginning to a future full of more stories with the soul purpose of touching a person's heart; whatever way that might be. 
  • Yet I recognize that our team cannot achieve this with the snap of a finger or even a well-structured plan. We also need trust; For all we seek is chance to express ourselves as professionals in a way that is unique and wholeheartedly. 

Risks & Challenges

As much as we believe in our vision, we are also aware that this production is bound to have its obstacles; As does every production ever made. Factors such as permits, liability, and security have been accounted for since the start. Which is why this cannot be possible without a proper foundation and resources, beginning with a reasonable and manageable budget. 

  • My team and I have been very selective about how we plan to bring forth such an ambiguous concept. As the one who first presented the idea of producing a series titled "Love Element", I find it crucial that my team has access to the necessary tools and security they need in order to prosper as professionals/artists throughout the production of this series.
  • I have chosen a very specific roster of talented artists, each specialized in different areas of a production, all for the benefit of the project. All in all, I feel nothing but full confidence that our leadership combined will be the key to a memorable end result. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • I understand that contributing can be a sacrifice to some. In fact, I can relate being a young but aspiring artist, responsible of evenly balancing my craft with my personal life. But it doesn't take more than a few minutes or even seconds to help my team and I share this campaign and its goal to achieve this opportunity in our career. We appreciate any effort made to make the world aware of our mission. 
  • Keep in mind that Indiegogo offers share tools to help anyone promote this project as well as many others on the site.
story_txt:
Short Summary
My name is Jay Alexander Fernandez (a.k.a. Xander) and I am a proud native of Ponce, Puerto Rico. Since I was just a kid to this day, I've looked to create stories that can make an audience think out of the norm in order to obtain a new and unforgettable lesson. Because I strongly believe a story is one of the most unique elements in any piece of art; with the power to touch a person’s heart or even tear it apart. My main focus has always been to do one or the other. Xander's Eye Productions is just an extension of myself as an artist. Love Element is just one of the more efficient steps my team and I plan to take in order to not only provide audiences with a compelling parallel on life and its hidden meanings, but also literal expression full of deep and relatable emotions.

Love Element, carries a heavy amount of symbolic factors that will naturally allow audiences to relate to what they see on screen, while still being entertained with a  metaphoric visual representation of our planet.
All of this will be shown through expression, movement, and setting! In an essence the episodes will be pantomimes broken into five different episodes: Earth I, Water II, Air III, Fire IV, and Love Element V.   
I have worked on the script for this series for almost two years now. It began as a small idea dealing with how most of us as humans can become unaware of the fact that things much bigger than us have happened, are happening, and will continue to happen through existence; that this planet holds emotion and expression just like each of us. All in all, I intend to repay each contributor that shares this vision by simply creating something worth sharing with the world, for world. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Realistically, my team and I need around $10,000 to produce this series; However, we seek at least $6,000 of that. With that budget actors can be supplied a fair payment as well as flat rates for the crew's work and time; Not to mention gas, food, props, set-design, and most of all, emergencies. If our financial goal is achieved or exceeded, then our team will be able to comfortably travel and hire/collaborate with out of state production crews allowing us to shoot on specific locations across the U.S.
As you possibly wonder why we need to travel, let me emphasize that traveling to different regions will be crucial for this series. I have always been a huge advocate for picking specific locations allowing proper staging according to whatever script is at work. Locations for this series need to be authentic considering the story will take place almost entirely in nature.
We as a team wish to create the right aesthetic in order create the movie magic this story deserves. For the most part, each episode will introduce a new element, hence presenting a new location/aesthetic.
Anyone who contributes past a certain donation amount will be given access to a variety of perks such as (Free access to our 5 premieres beginning as early as April, 2019 | Signed poster by the cast and director | Film Credit along with a personalized gift from the writer/director himself | T-Shirt | In-Person or Virtual Q&A with the leadership team and full cast) 
If all Earth fails, pun intended, and our team doesn't reach the financial goal of at least $6,000, my leadership team and I will make absolutely sure that whatever amount we had the privilege of earning, no matter how much, will be used in the most efficient way possible, not to mention I as a responsible director would be sure to have a sit-down with my creative department and ensure we take away anything that isn't necessary from the script in order for the story to deliver beautifully avoiding any lack in the quality promised to audiences. 


The Impact

This project isn't just about achieving a well-produced web series, it is about spreading a handful of messages directly correlating to our society today. Since the beginning of time darkness has always existed, but it is always strongest in its present time, and for that reason pain has spread around the world more than ever causing disruption in our hearts, in our lives; but love really is a powerful force, and it has been offered to us constantly since we were first brought into existence. Signs point to a path full of peace awaiting in our universe; the knowlege to find it is within us, if only we'd learn to to search in the dark.
The truth is, my biggest wish in life is to one day earn the chance to properly craft something powerful and compelling; the beginning to a future full of more stories with the soul purpose of touching a person's heart; whatever way that might be. 
Yet I recognize that our team cannot achieve this with the snap of a finger or even a well-structured plan. We also need trust; For all we seek is chance to express ourselves as professionals in a way that is unique and wholeheartedly. 


Risks & Challenges
As much as we believe in our vision, we are also aware that this production is bound to have its obstacles; As does every production ever made. Factors such as permits, liability, and security have been accounted for since the start. Which is why this cannot be possible without a proper foundation and resources, beginning with a reasonable and manageable budget. 

My team and I have been very selective about how we plan to bring forth such an ambiguous concept. As the one who first presented the idea of producing a series titled "Love Element", I find it crucial that my team has access to the necessary tools and security they need in order to prosper as professionals/artists throughout the production of this series.
I have chosen a very specific roster of talented artists, each specialized in different areas of a production, all for the benefit of the project. All in all, I feel nothing but full confidence that our leadership combined will be the key to a memorable end result. 


Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that contributing can be a sacrifice to some. In fact, I can relate being a young but aspiring artist, responsible of evenly balancing my craft with my personal life. But it doesn't take more than a few minutes or even seconds to help my team and I share this campaign and its goal to achieve this opportunity in our career. We appreciate any effort made to make the world aware of our mission. 
Keep in mind that Indiegogo offers share tools to help anyone promote this project as well as many others on the site.

story:
Hell Inc - Where You Get What You Deserve

We are a band of passionate filmmakers, actors, writers and comedians who have come together to bring the world an off beat, funny, and highly politically incorrect sitcom. 

Vinnie's life is miserable. He's been busting his chops for nearly 7000 years, worked to the bone in the corporation that is Hell. And yet, he gets no reward other than a snooty new dead woman to look after. 

6 episodes of this comedy will be shot in 2019. We're a non profit, indie group so any contribution we will get will go towards actor's lunches, equipment and lights. 

Hell Inc is the brainchild of Ronika, our head writer and producer, who has slaved overt he script for the better part of 2018 and now wants to make it become a reality. 

We are all in it for the passion of filmmaking and because making people laugh is the best way to get close to them. 

One Hell of a Ride

We are deep into preproduction, with the first rehearsals starting just after Christmas.

We were lucky to be able to rehearse in the location we're actually going to be shooting in (shout out to awesome MD7 Dublin!), so we saved a lot of money on that front. 

The rest of our (as of yet, non-existent) budget will go towards: 

  • Editing: The edit is the life blood of each production, as the script is the bone structure. Without a solid and highly qualified editor we are doomed to mediocre results. We won't have that, and if it's the last thing we do!
  • Camera and Lights: Since we are all involved in the indie film business, we do have equipment available to us, but... it's old. It's got little aches and pains. So any funds we will receive will help us get/rent better cameras to bring you even closer into Hell! 

Our main goal here is to bring you a comedy that will get your heart thumping and get your fists clenched. You will love to hate these quirky characters. We sure do!

Ever cent we are given will go into this project. It will be made, regardless of how much contribution we receive. But it will be made a lot better with your help!

 

Want to come to Hell?

Find us on Facebook, on Twitter, on YouTube. If you're in Dublin, come meet us for a coffee or help us on set!

story:
Yuppies was created and directed by Colin Bowles and is made up of a cast of improvisers and actors in Chicago, and was made possible with help from talented friends and colleagues. Here's about how things went down:

  • Sept. 10, 2017:  Colin moves to Chicago and begins working at The Second City
  • Oct. 28, 2017: Colin begins writing initial versions of  scripts for "Yuppies"
  • Nov. 23, 2017: Colin makes new friends / future cast members
  • Jan. 28, 2018: Script is finalized (as much as an improvised script can be)
  • March 3, 2018: Cast is finalized, crew is amazing
  • May 4, 2018: Camera tests BEGIN!
  • June 6, 2018: Filming begins!
  • June - September 2018: shoots are scheduled, actors arrive, pizza is ordered, producers find locations, DP sets up cameras, crew gets good at holding mics, car is rented, cat is borrowed (shoutout Countess Olenska), talented people arrive, talented people say lines, talented people improvise lines, cast and crew goes to the beach, cast and crew goes to on a ferris wheel
  • Sept. 14, 2018: THAT'S A WRAP!
  • Oct. 1, 2018: We realize things are expensive and we need more money

We'll start by saying WE TRIED. Over $3,000 of personal, hard-earned money has been lovingly poured into Yuppies, but that number has turned into a single digit during production. We've put off starting a crowdfunding campaign (such as this) for as long as possible and have called in every favor to keep our expenditures low, but everything costs something and we think the hardworking people involved deserve at least a little payback.

Every penny of your generous contribution will go towards at least one of the following:

  • festival submission fees
  • post-production costs (such as music, graphic design, videography)
  • transportation
  • location costs and rental
  • repaying professionals (the ones who have been doing favors and haven't asked for more money, but we think they deserve to be paid)

  Colin Bowles as Decker (also writer, director and executive producer)

  Sarah Lucas as Vanessa

  John Love as Danny

  Gideon Redic as Joe

  Alexa Erbach as Heidi

Also featuring:

RILEY MONDRAGON as Sly
MATT SPECHT as Mr. Williams
EVAN MULROONEY as Goldrush
JENNIFER PETERSON as Beth
JOHN DENNY as Ben
DAN BAZALDUA as Anthony

 

Hi!

Thank you for checking out this kickstarter and checking out Yuppies. As someone who has never done this before, this has been one of the most amazing/stressful experiences of my life. As some of you know, this art project has been extremely personal and honestly quit scary - but the support from family, friends, and this crew has been amazing. I owe so much to the people that have helped with this. If you choose to donate, I thank you from the bottom of my heart. If not, I hope you follow our journey on social media and check out Yuppies!

Cheers!
Colin

 

YOU'VE GOTTEN THIS FAR...

We think you deserve one last thing before considering a donation... now presenting: Behind the Scenes Footage! Please enjoy seeing some hard work in action:

 

Risks & Challenges

The series has been filmed, and we are keeping close count of our budget during this post-production phase. Every penny made will go towards the hard work that has already been put into this project, and we're doing everything we can to produce the highest quality and funniest web series you've ever seen.

 

Other Ways To Help

Even if you're not able to contribute financially, please consider sharing this campaign or following us on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram @YuppiesChi!

story:
The Project

Secrets of the Caribbean, is a lifestyle/history/culture program that goes beyond the beach and resorts.  We'll introduce you to the "real" Caribbean and it’s people as we sail the azure waters on the historic tall ship S/V Mandalay visiting islands off the beaten path and telling stories of the people and cultures that make the Caribbean unique.

We have been developing our program in cooperation with Mississippi Public Broadcasting and One Caribbean Television.  Season One of Secrets of the Caribbean is scheduled to launch on One Caribbean Television mid-summer 2018 and nationally on public television stations throughout the U.S. in Fall, 2018.

Who we are

We are veteran producers with a team of folks, all of whom have decades of experience in long-form and documentary programming.   We know what we’re doing and we want to tell real and personal stories of the people of the Caribbean.  After last years devastating storms, we think it’s more important than ever that people know there is more to the Caribbean than beaches and resorts.  There are real people, with real hopes and dream.  We want to tell those stories.

We’ve done this before, having launched two other series on public television in the past, but this is our most ambitious project and we need additional production funding to meet our launch dates.  We’ve shot a lot of material, have great stories waiting to be told, but need final post-production funding to get over the hump and make these shows a reality. 

What we need

Funding for television and film projects is always tough, we're close, but still need an additional $30,000 to:

  • Finish post-production on our first 13 weekly episodes
  • Pay some very patient vendors
  • Activate the web site
  • Hit our launch dates

Any funds raised over our goals will go into the pre-production fund for Season 2.

We hope you take a look at our demo and share this with family, friends and anyone with an interest in this fascinating region.  We have wonderful stories to tell and need your help.

story:
What is this?

Hello! If you don't already know me, my name is Elise Taff and I am a bartender and actor living in New York City. Last year I launched my webseries, Strug-Free Cocktails and it was a blast! (If you haven't seen it yet - watch it here!) My goal was to teach people how to make cocktails in a fun, approachable way, but I couldn't have imagined the scope of people I've been able to connect with because of this webseries. I funded the first Season of Strug-Free Cocktails on my own, and now I need your help to make Season 2 even better (and of course, strugglier)!

 

What We Need & What You Get

Funding for this project will go towards hiring a crew, equipment, set decorating, alcohol (duh!) makeup, and editing! I already work with a fantastic production company, Halleloo, and after trying out some stuff on my own, I know I am better and funnier with them (and don't we want that?) 

As a thank you for helping me fund Strug-Free Cocktails, I have some awesome perks that aren't just a shout out in the comments. Strug-Free Cocktails is here to help you have a strug-free day, so I am not going to leave you high and dry. Every donation over $20 will send you home with either my Strug-Free Spirit Guide or a free copy of my e-book, a full recipe book of all of the cocktails from Season 1.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, or if you want to help spread the word please help by sharing this campaign on any or all of your social media platforms. As a way to celebrate and spread the word for my campaign I will be releasing a different video every single day - so please feel free to share those and laugh with or at me while I tell some embarrassing strug-filled stories.

story:
Wait, what do you mean video personals??

Love in the modern world is all about online dating, from dating sites to dating apps, Literary Personals takes this idea to the world of Classic Literature! Here you will find the charterers you know and love attempting to find love, in the most modern way possible, online dating! We have kept them in the time periods they hail from, full of the personalities you love, sometimes exploring what *might* have happened after that last page...

 

Who are we?

Literary Personals was created by Jennifer Anne Scott, an actress and self avowed book worm, with a crazy idea and a lot of determination! Jennifer enlisted the many talented actors and actresses, crew and make-up artists she has met working in Hollywood, bribing them with food, fun and the chance to wear amazing costumes and the promise of comedic glory!! 

 

What exactly is the show?

The show consists of "micro shorts" from famous literary characters, explaining to camera what they are looking for when it comes to love. Our amazing actors and actresses will be portraying characters from books and plays through out history, and giving you the chance to interact with them. The website, LiteraryPersonals.com not only hosts the personals ads themselves, but gives each character an actual ad that you can respond to from all the characters.  This will then lead to additional shorts of the characters responding to the inquiries they receive!

 

This is what we have done so far...

We have filmed the first series, Shakespeare Personals and they are live on the webpage at www,LiteraryPersonals.com. They feature Nick Bottom, Hamlet, Beatrice, Titania, Bianca, Richard III, Mercutio, Viola and Horatio kicking off the show on April 23rd in celebration of Shakespeare Day!!! Additional characters are being added this month to finish this first series!

 

What we need to release episodes weekly :

Bribery will only get you so far, and we need your help to continue filming this show!! All money is going back into the show, to make  to pay for things such as :

  • Paying the Actors! These amazing people have so far donated their time, and I want to pay them in more than food & credits!! 
  • The crew - Camera, Sound, Makeup, Production Assistants, these are the people that make the show look good, sound good, and keep it running smoothly!! 
  • Studio rental ,costuming, and feeding everyone!! These are some of the many additional costs associated with filming the show.

The great thing about this Indigogo campaign is even *if* we don't reach our entire goal, the funds will still go into the show and allow us to continue filming for as long as possible. The show must go on! 

Spreading the love of Literature...

We hope by making characters more relatable, and putting them in a setting more familiar to modern audiences, that we will inspire people to explore the amazing works that each of the come from. In our media obessed world people are more likely to have seen "the movie based on.." than read the actual book. There is room for both, and we hope to share this love of books  with the world! So many films and  TV shows draw inspiration from classic literature, we hope to bring the originals back into the conversation!

 

 

The Perks of funding us!

For helping fund this project you get:

  • Our eternal thanks and the knowledge that you are helping bring the love of literature to the world!
  • A whole bunch of other fun stuff along with that thanks! From bookmarks to tshirts, to starring in your own ad!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to help fund us, but still love what we are doing, please spread the word!!!

  • Share our Indigogo campaign!
  • Tell your friends and family about the show, and follow us online on Instagram, Twitter, and Facebook!!
  • Send your favorite character an email! 

And most importantly, enjoy the show, laugh and be merry as the day is long!

And that's all there is to it.

Additional characters are being added this month to finish this first series!
 

What we need to release episodes weekly :
Bribery will only get you so far, and we need your help to continue filming this show!! All money is going back into the show, to make  to pay for things such as :

Paying the Actors! These amazing people have so far donated their time, and I want to pay them in more than food & credits!! 
The crew - Camera, Sound, Makeup, Production Assistants, these are the people that make the show look good, sound good, and keep it running smoothly!! 
Studio rental ,costuming, and feeding everyone!! These are some of the many additional costs associated with filming the show.

The great thing about this Indigogo campaign is even *if* we don't reach our entire goal, the funds will still go into the show and allow us to continue filming for as long as possible. The show must go on! 

Spreading the love of Literature...
We hope by making characters more relatable, and putting them in a setting more familiar to modern audiences, that we will inspire people to explore the amazing works that each of the come from. In our media obessed world people are more likely to have seen "the movie based on.." than read the actual book. There is room for both, and we hope to share this love of books  with the world! So many films and  TV shows draw inspiration from classic literature, we hope to bring the originals back into the conversation!
 

 
The Perks of funding us!
For helping fund this project you get:

Our eternal thanks and the knowledge that you are helping bring the love of literature to the world!
A whole bunch of other fun stuff along with that thanks! From bookmarks to tshirts, to starring in your own ad!


Other Ways You Can Help
If you are unable to help fund us, but still love what we are doing, please spread the word!!!

Share our Indigogo campaign!
Tell your friends and family about the show, and follow us online on Instagram, Twitter, and Facebook!!
Send your favorite character an email! 

And most importantly, enjoy the show, laugh and be merry as the day is long!
And that's all there is to it.

story:
Welcome to 2-G!

Hi We are the crew of 2-G Digital Media, Inc. We've been producing film and television content since 2001. We've had films in Blockbuster, Hollywood Video, Walmart and Best Buy. We've recently had a string of bad experiences with traditional distribution and decided it was time for us to take control of our own destiny.

With the help of our friends at Amazon, we've been able to shoot a 4 episode season of Music & Murder and distribute it through Amazon. Season 1 is currently streaming and can be watched on Amazon Prime and Amazon Instant Video. We have over 7 million minutes viewed and over 500,000 unique streams. We have a 3.5 star rating and with your help we'd like to get as close to 5 stars as possible.  With your help we have the ability to get to 5 million unique streams per month and put the show and the Atlanta indie production scene on the map. Most importantly your support will allow aspiring actors and crew members the chance to practice their craft and showcase their talents to a worldwide audience.

What is Music & Murder?

"In the streets of Atlanta, Money & Violence go Hand in Hand. Chastity Michaels is one of the best video producers in Atlanta, but when she gets pushed by the streets, she pushes back. Music & Murder is an Urban Crime drama about Chastity Michaels and Venom studios. When , a music video producer in Atlanta gets framed for murder her family and friends rally together to keep her out of jail and find the people who framed her for murder.

This series is a cross between the TV shows "Power", Empire and "How to Get Away with Murder", so if you like juicy tv dramas, you won't want to miss ‪#YourNewTVAddiction!

 

WE LOVE WHAT WE DO, BUT...

 

Rahiem (Grandmaser Flash and the Furious 5 & Platinum Producer Stephen "Stix Josey" on set.

WE NEED YOUR SUPPORT!

We're seeking production funds in the amount of $15,000 to cover our production costs such as:

1. Equipment Purchase & Rentals: $4,000.00

(2) 4k Cameras

(2) 3000 Watt Light Kits

(1) Audio Package

-Tascam Recorder

-(4) Wireless Lavaliers

-Boom Pole & Shotgun Mic

2. Cast: $6,000.00

3. Marketing: $5,000.00

If we don't reach our entire goal, we will use the funds proportionately in each category. Instead of buying, we'll rent equipment and we will reduce our marketing budget as needed.

Supa Peach from Jermaine Dupri's "The Rap Game" on set.

What You Get!
In return for your awesome and generous support we're offering fun and pretty DOPE perks and opportunities. For instance, we shout you out all over social media for a $25 donation, but the dopeness doesn't stop there! Want to direct an episode of Music & Murder? Here's your chance!
 
We have perks from everything to a DVD of both seasons to all inclusive flights and hotels to be on set and at special screening of the season 2 premiere!
 
 
 

The State of Indie Filmmaking 

We've been making independent content for over 10 years now and we've notice how harder it gets every year to get your tv show or film distributed to the world. Once upon a time a distributor would pay you a healthy advance for your hard work and creativity. Today, few and far between offer any up from money for your film. Well we're here to say we don't need them anymore!

We want to show the world that indie productions are viable and can make money. We want to show that there is a market for indie content and we want to show other indie production companies that there's a new formula for success as independent film producer.

Showing and proving is the 1st step in our vision. Step # 2 is to be a part of the change. We intend to use a portion of what we make to pay it forward and help other producers get their content on Amazon and other platforms. We'll help with marketing campaigns and provide production support as needed.

Entrepreneurial filmmaking is all we love and we're asking for the support of like minded people like you to help us and this movement of creating great indie content!

 

Season 1 Ep. 4 Promo

This ain't no walk in the park!

You know what they say, "if it were easy everyone would be doing it" Well that's true with filmmaking as well. More productions go unfinished than not, and the ones that are seldom get to be seen by the world. Amazon is a great platform for making this a reality, but its not without its challenges. A long road is ahead of us, once we get past production we have post production to complete.

If all goes as expected with production and post production, people also have to like the content we create. Our experience in writing and production will help us to produce compelling and visually stunning content you will be proud of. Even if you don't have the means to help financially, please tell your friends and family about the show we need all the views and positive reviews we can get. Here is a link: http://bit.ly/ep101mm

story:
Hello! This is Andrew, Kate, and Chris. We’re a writer/director/novelist/producer/ advertising team, and we need your help.

With what?

With making the first episode of Temporary Guardian. It’s a show about Gary, who’s a freelance Guardian Angel. Like a substitute teacher, Gary covers for regular Guardians when they take a sick day or go on vacation. Each episode will follow Gary on a new assignment, with a new character for him to protect. And when his human meets other people, Gary gets the joy of interacting with their Guardians as well. Which usually doesn’t go so hot.

So what's his first assignment?

A one-night stand! Gary finds himself with a client who has brought a girl back to his apartment. Her Guardian is stressed, but Gary isn’t too worried … though maybe he should be.

Drama. Will it be ... um ... good?

Hopefully! We think this show will be really fun. And smart. Like with High Maintenance, you’ll get a voyeuristic glimpse into a new life every episode. Tonally, it’ll be the absurdity of Wilfred with the insight into human emotion you loved in Inside Out. It's also a little bit Flight of the Conchords, with maybe a touch of Quantum Leap.

We’re pumped because this is a concept that allows us to explore an incredible range of experiences and emotions, from a unique vantage. In other episodes, Gary guards an old grandfather in a retirement home who misses his family, a member of a drug cartel in the middle of a deal gone wrong, and a woman checking into a motel after a brutal fight with her abusive husband. See: range!

As for look and feel, we want the show to be colorful and slightly-stylized, but always a little scruffy. Here's our production mood board:

Eh.

If that doesn’t sway you, we have some cool stuff we’re offering in exchange for your hard-earned money. Check out our perks to the right. There's a lot of options: for $20, you can get your own personal Guardian Angel. For $500, you get an awesome piece of art from our angel wing feathers. But perhaps our favorite perk: the super sweet lapel pin for $40. It'll look so good on your jacket, and show folks that you support indie entertainment. 

Ehhhh.

At the very least, you’d be helping us chase a project we’ve been working on for ages. And a dream we’ve had since we were little. That has to count for something, right?

Fine. I guess. But have you ever made anything before?

We have. Over the summer, we made some ads for DIRECTV(!), complete with Game of Thrones tie-ins and flying cabbage. And we also made this short film, which won the Audience Choice Award at the Nitehawk Shorts Festival in Brooklyn. Independently, Andrew is a director and producer who’s made ads for YouTube, Google, Sprint, and whole a lot of alcohol brands. Chris has penned spots for Sprint and Virgin Atlantic, and did this weird one for World of Warships with Steven Seagal. Kate wrote the book that became The CW's Hellcats, starring Ali Michalka and Ashley Tisdale, and she was the consulting producer on the series. Currently, she’s a writer at TED where she penned their first original online series, Small Thing, Big Idea. It just premiered and is getting millions of views.

Fancy. So why do you need all this money?

Shooting a film is expensive. Doing it in New York City is even more so. We’re committed to having a top-notch cast and crew and we want to pay them what we're worth. Below, a breakdown of how we'll be spending our budget. (Notice that the location fee is hefty, holler if you know of an apartment we could use for a reasonable rate.) Every contribution, no matter how big or small, truly helps. If you give $25 — that means we can afford the lights we want. If you give $100, you pay for a set of angel wings. If you give more, well, you'll help us lock in great music. 

We will put every dollar you give to good use. Well, except maybe the one in the video above. That one, we burned. Sorry.

I changed my mind. I’m not giving you idiots anything.

That’s okay. Just post about the campaign and/or show on Facebook, Instagram, and/or Twitter. It’d really mean a lot.

Twitter makes me depressed. Here’s twenty dollars.

Great! Whether we hit our goal or not, we're shooting this thing in late February. Like we said, every little bit counts. And if this campaign goes REALLY well, we’ll move on to make episode two and three. We’ve got our entire first season written and it’s pretty incredible. Ping us if you’d like to read scripts.

Are you done yet?

Almost. We’ll end by saying, we’re really excited to get this thing off the ground. We’ll keep you posted on our progress, and get your donation perks in the spring.

We can’t wait to introduce you to the world of Temporary Guardian. Thank you for your time, your help, and your... faith.

An angel pun. I already regret my donation.

Fair.

But maybe look at these cool Guardian Angel images we created. We'll be adding more through the campaign. Share at will. And thank you.

story:
Okay, but why? Why now? Why this sperm?

The night is dark and full of terrors. We all need the clowns to make us laugh.  Yes, the actual Avengers are fun and funny, but they also go dark and devote entire films to Tony Stark agonizing over his role in the death of a child. 

The Amehngers are pure, silly fun.  Our motto is no angsting, no brooding, and absolutely no dead children. 

Also, the real Avengers, while lovely to look at, are  frankly, TOO awesome.  We regular people are not as beautiful as the Black Widow or as buff as the Black Panther. Nobody loves us the way Cap loves Bucky. The Amehngers are attainable, relatable heroes. They put the human in superhuman. 

In this age of gritty reboots and imminent global thermonuclear war, the Amehngers are here to make you giggle, and even sometimes guffaw, for 5-7 minutes.  

Short Version, If You Don't Want to Read A Lot

    Long Version, If You're Into Words

    There was an idea, to come up with a skit about superheroes with goofy powers, and see if it could become something more. To see if two people could work together and write the scripts that no one else could. 

    Three years later, here we are. 

    What Are You Going to Do With the Money?

    This is a really ambitious project with a large primary cast, guest roles in every episode, multiple locations, and some moderate SFX. 

    Even with leveraging every connection we have, and a cast and crew willing to work for nominal fees, we need quite a bit of cash to pull this off. 

    Budget Breakdown:

    Equipment rental - $5,000 - this includes cameras and rigs, lighting and sound

    Cast and Crew - $15,300 - this is the biggie.  Our show has six principal characters that appear in almost every episode, as well as one recurring character and six guest stars for the season. We have extras too, but we aren't paying them (sorry extras!).  Crew includes the director, assistant director, director of photography,  location scout, lighting crew, sound crew, hair/makeup/wardrobe, and production designer.  

    Everyone involved in the production is working for a nominal fee, because they love and believe in the production, but even those rates, times 20+ people, add up. 

    Locations, props, sets, costumes - $3,500.  Most of the action takes place in the Amehngers basement apartment, but in season 1, they foil a bank robbery, stop a museum heist in progress, challenge a villain to a showdown in the street, and battle demonic mimes in a park. All while wearing clothes!

    Insurance, Legal, Admin Fees  - $2,500. The bulk of this expense are the fees Indiegogo charges to collect and process your contributions. We also need to purchase insurance for the production in case anybody trips and falls or breaks that equipment we rented. 

    Food - $3,000 - Remember those 20+ people? They need to be fed, every day they are working on set. We are looking at 8 shooting days, which breaks down to $375 per day. 

     

    What's In it For Me?

    • You'll get to watch a funny web series with good production values. 
    • You'll get one, some, or all of the nifty perks on our perks page. 
    • You'll get to watch the series again and spot all the cool stuff in the background and subtle jokes and references you missed the first time that only you are smart enough to get. 
    • You'll get in on the ground floor of a whole new fandom.  How often does that happen?  You can be our BNF! 
    • You'll laugh. Seriously y'all (were from Texas so that's authentic), this is a downright joyful production. If you laugh half as much watching it as we have creating it, your money will have been well spent. 

    Who Are You People, Anyway?

    We are an autonomous collective, taking it in turns to act as an executive officer of the week.  You're in good hands. Just look at the quality of our headshots!

    The Amehngers is a collaboration between Lettuce Go Productions and ChancePants. 

    Chance Barnett, Creator, Producer, Editor

    Chance is a graduate of the KD Conservatory Film School, creator of the ChancePants Youtube channel and banned in over 100 countries (edgy!) He created an award-winning commercial for Lost Paws, an animal rescue organization (don't breed or buy while shelter pets die!) and his influences are Sam Raimi, Steven Spielberg and James Cameron. 

    Barbara McCormick Thomas, Writer, Producer

    Barbara's films have screened in festivals throughout the US and the  United Kingdom and even won a bunch of awards that all went to the director and she's fine with that, really. Her plays have been staged by Rover DramaWerks and the Small But Mighty theater company of Toronto. She has also written for the nationally syndicated top forty radio program, Kidd Kraddick in the Morning. Barbara is a partner in Lettuce Go Productions. You can tell she wrote the bios because hers is the longest.

    Todd Slaughter, Producer, Post Production Wizard

    Todd is a media developer, animator, illustrator, dreamweaver, Unix speaker, space cowboy. Most recently, he has been developing educational videos for Edmentum, a provider of online learning programs. Todd is a partner in Lettuce Go Productions.

    The Cast 

    Clockwise from top left: George William Phillips III as Mr. Prepared; Gwen Moores as Temperate Girl; Francis Reza as The Arborist; Brenna Leigh Whitten as Galendar; Kayla Smith as Pre-Teen Girl; and Makenzie McClure as the Silver Screamer. 

    Our heroes get their Mission of the Day from crack journalist Jocelyn Townsie (played by Jocelyn Townsie) who reports for ENN - the Exposition News Network.  

    Learn more about our cast at our Facebook page. But later - don't leave this page until you've made a contribution! 

     

    Risks & Challenges

    There are no risks. This will be a seamless production and nothing will go wrong.  Ha! Of course not. This is filmmaking. All kinds of things are going to go wrong. We're going to get behind schedule some days,  it's going to rain when we need it to be sunny, ideas that sounded amazing will turn out lame on camera.

    All that has already happened, just in the filming of the pitch video. But that just means we already know how to haul our butts over those obstacles when they pop up. 

    The most significant risk is that we will not reach our funding goal. If that is the case, our plan is to produce as many episodes as we can without compromising production values or failing to compensate our cast and crew.  

    What If You Surpass Your Goal?

    OMG that would be awesome.  If we surpass our goal, we will apply those funds to Season 2! We have planned a multi-season arc for these characters, and hope our audience will be along for the full ride.   Indiegogo allows campaigns that meet their funding goal to continue raising funds through their InDemand platform and that is our desired outcome for this project. 

    Wait, Can You Even Do This?

    We are not affiliated with Marvel Entertainment. Our project is a parody and as such, is afforded certain protections under the doctrine of Fair Use. This is a not-for-profit production; we aren't lining our shoes with the money. All funds raised, whether by crowdfunding, income from streaming services, or passing the hat (which we are NOT above) will be used for the production. 

    I'm Sold! How Can I Help?

    Fork over the cash, of course. But if you cannot contribute funds at this time, you can:

    • Share our campaign on your social media or via email,  along with a personal message from you, and like us on Facebook.
    • Offer an in-kind contribution of a location, props or catering (contact us to work out the details). 
    • Watch the series when it airs and tell everyone you know how awesome it is!

Locations, props, sets, costumes - $3,500.  Most of the action takes place in the Amehngers basement apartment, but in season 1, they foil a bank robbery, stop a museum heist in progress, challenge a villain to a showdown in the street, and battle demonic mimes in a park. All while wearing clothes!
Insurance, Legal, Admin Fees  - $2,500. The bulk of this expense are the fees Indiegogo charges to collect and process your contributions. We also need to purchase insurance for the production in case anybody trips and falls or breaks that equipment we rented. 
Food - $3,000 - Remember those 20+ people? They need to be fed, every day they are working on set. We are looking at 8 shooting days, which breaks down to $375 per day. 
 
What's In it For Me?

You'll get to watch a funny web series with good production values. 
You'll get one, some, or all of the nifty perks on our perks page. 
You'll get to watch the series again and spot all the cool stuff in the background and subtle jokes and references you missed the first time that only you are smart enough to get. 
You'll get in on the ground floor of a whole new fandom.  How often does that happen?  You can be our BNF! 
You'll laugh. Seriously y'all (were from Texas so that's authentic), this is a downright joyful production. If you laugh half as much watching it as we have creating it, your money will have been well spent. 


Who Are You People, Anyway?
We are an autonomous collective, taking it in turns to act as an executive officer of the week.  You're in good hands. Just look at the quality of our headshots!
The Amehngers is a collaboration between Lettuce Go Productions and ChancePants. 

Chance Barnett, Creator, Producer, Editor
Chance is a graduate of the KD Conservatory Film School, creator of the ChancePants Youtube channel and banned in over 100 countries (edgy!) He created an award-winning commercial for Lost Paws, an animal rescue organization (don't breed or buy while shelter pets die!) and his influences are Sam Raimi, Steven Spielberg and James Cameron. 

Barbara McCormick Thomas, Writer, Producer
Barbara's films have screened in festivals throughout the US and the  United Kingdom and even won a bunch of awards that all went to the director and she's fine with that, really. Her plays have been staged by Rover DramaWerks and the Small But Mighty theater company of Toronto. She has also written for the nationally syndicated top forty radio program, Kidd Kraddick in the Morning. Barbara is a partner in Lettuce Go Productions. You can tell she wrote the bios because hers is the longest.

Todd Slaughter, Producer, Post Production Wizard
Todd is a media developer, animator, illustrator, dreamweaver, Unix speaker, space cowboy. Most recently, he has been developing educational videos for Edmentum, a provider of online learning programs. Todd is a partner in Lettuce Go Productions.
The Cast 

Clockwise from top left: George William Phillips III as Mr. Prepared; Gwen Moores as Temperate Girl; Francis Reza as The Arborist; Brenna Leigh Whitten as Galendar; Kayla Smith as Pre-Teen Girl; and Makenzie McClure as the Silver Screamer. 
Our heroes get their Mission of the Day from crack journalist Jocelyn Townsie (played by Jocelyn Townsie) who reports for ENN - the Exposition News Network.  

Learn more about our cast at our Facebook page. But later - don't leave this page until you've made a contribution! 
 

Risks & Challenges
There are no risks. This will be a seamless production and nothing will go wrong.  Ha! Of course not. This is filmmaking. All kinds of things are going to go wrong. We're going to get behind schedule some days,  it's going to rain when we need it to be sunny, ideas that sounded amazing will turn out lame on camera.
All that has already happened, just in the filming of the pitch video. But that just means we already know how to haul our butts over those obstacles when they pop up. 
The most significant risk is that we will not reach our funding goal. If that is the case, our plan is to produce as many episodes as we can without compromising production values or failing to compensate our cast and crew.  
What If You Surpass Your Goal?
OMG that would be awesome.  If we surpass our goal, we will apply those funds to Season 2! We have planned a multi-season arc for these characters, and hope our audience will be along for the full ride.   Indiegogo allows campaigns that meet their funding goal to continue raising funds through their InDemand platform and that is our desired outcome for this project. 
Wait, Can You Even Do This?
We are not affiliated with Marvel Entertainment. Our project is a parody and as such, is afforded certain protections under the doctrine of Fair Use. This is a not-for-profit production; we aren't lining our shoes with the money. All funds raised, whether by crowdfunding, income from streaming services, or passing the hat (which we are NOT above) will be used for the production. 

I'm Sold! How Can I Help?
Fork over the cash, of course. But if you cannot contribute funds at this time, you can:

Share our campaign on your social media or via email,  along with a personal message from you, and like us on Facebook.
Offer an in-kind contribution of a location, props or catering (contact us to work out the details). 
Watch the series when it airs and tell everyone you know how awesome it is!

story:
Once Upon A Time...

Hi, my name is Taylor Polydore and I’m a storyteller. I’m also a writer and the creator of the animated comedy web series Dishes. I had the idea for the pilot episode of Dishes in 2016 one night before going to work at the news station I was currently at. I thought about how weird (and hilarious) it would be if utensils could speak, and what they would talk about. I immediately thought about the conflict of inter-utensil marriage and this is how Dishes was born.

Dishes hilariously pokes fun at everyday situations that any human would be in and takes a peek into these social constructs and how we all (dishes included) function within them. This is comedy but it does get kinda deep. I'm talkin layers, baby! It's like an onion. It's good and gon lowkey make you cry... Anyway, this show isn’t just important to me, it’s important to everyone involved, including you, the viewer. This show gives opportunities and jobs to creators of color. It’s no secret that it can be a bit hard to break into the film and television industry, especially with COVID, but this web series provides many the chance to do just that.

The show is created by a black woman, animated by a black woman, and we have a diverse cast of voices and will continue to amplify and support talented people, no matter their gender, race, sexual orientation or religious views.

Meet the Team

Taylor Polydore - Creator and writer of the show 

 

Tavia Harris - Animator and editor of the show

 

Team Involved with Teaser

EJ Neri - voice of Lee

Taylor Polydore - voice of Marie

Steven Etienne - voice of Jacques

HB Gibson - voice of Walter

Kate Wathall - voice of Reporter

Protestors chanting: Khaya Fraites, Francesca Calvo, Karla Espino, Jay Thomas

What We Need & What You Get

$30,000 looks like a huge number, and it is, but it will help us in many ways.

With these funds, we will pay for:

  • Animation 
    • It takes a lot of drawing, time and energy for our talented artist and animator, Tavia, to create the world that these Dishes live in
  • Writers and Talent
    1. Creating art is no easy feat and we want to pay those involved with helping this project come to life
  • Audio production
    • We’d like to have an original theme song and a custom soundtrack filled with songs you love as well as independent artists who deserve the spotlight
    •  We also want to provide our talent with professional audio sessions to deliver the best voice over quality
    • We also want the best sound effects (pew pew)
  • Production
    • Editing takes time and resources. With these funds we can deliver the best product for you to watch and enjoy!
  • Merchandise + Perks
    • We will take a small portion of the funds to make those dope ass perks I mentioned above

*And most importantly, your funds will help a few dreams come true :) 

Perks

  • $5 – Thank you!
  • $10 – 3 sticker pack
  • $20 – Face Mask and stickers
  • $25 – Romantic Poster of show’s pilot characters + 3 sticker pack
  • $75 – T-shirt, poster, sticker pack
  • $150 – Sweater weather pack (hoodie and mug), poster, sticker pack
  • $500 – EXCLUSIVE plush dolls of pilot show main characters (we will have all pilot episode plush dolls available for sale – collect them all!) + sweater weather pack, poster, sticker pack (limit 10)
  • $1,000 – Be a character on the show! + Hoodie, shirt, poster, sticker pack (limit 3)
  • $1,500 – Associate Producer Credit + Hoodie, shirt, poster, sticker pack (limit 2)
  • $2,500 – Virtual dinner with creator and animator of the show + AP credit, Hoodie, shirt, poster, sticker pack (limit 3)
  • $5,000 - Join us for the premiere party, pending pandemic (limit 2)

Other Ways You Can Help

Times are tough and we know that not everyone can contribute financially, and that's totally fine! You can still help by sharing this campaign so that Dishes can be watched and enjoyed by everyone. So share the joy on social media, texts, snail mail, however you want to send it. Just be sure to share, share, share! Especially to those rich relatives who are in the giving spirit ;)

When posting about the show, be sure to use [this] Indiegogo link! And don’t forget to hashtag #DishesCartoon and tag us on all on your social media channels. We can be found @dishescartoon everywhere!

And if you want, you can send us money to our CashApp ($thepolydoregroup), Venmo @Taylor-Polydore and PayPal too paypal.me/thepolydoregroup.

Love and gratitude to you all and thank you for helping us bring Dishes to life!

 

-------------------------

This production is brought to you by The Polydore Group, LLC dba BakedPoTaylor Productions :)

story:
Short Summary

The show is called, Are Ya’ll Brothas?, which is a comedy-drama series about Red and Blue, two professional dance teachers, who are thick as thieves and the world treats them as such! With a united work and living relationship, the duo experience some of the most personal, racial, and awkward situations together as an African American Creative . Thank goodness for them being family and they aren’t even related by blood!

What We Need & What You Get

The funds will go toward equipment, costuming, production, and the ability to make the show the most authentic it can be!

The Impact

The show will bring about change and a new light into the human interaction for people of different culture, generational and ethnic backgrounds  

Risks & Challenges

The risks and challenges we face come from the entire behind the scenes process of putting together this production but with positivity and drive I know we can do it!

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand times are roughs and funds can be but that’s okay! If you can’t donate, spread the word and continue to bring exposure to the project ! We appreciate any type of support!

story:
Short Summary

What is it?

Gentrification is a terrifying and timely cautionary tale - presented in both English & Greek.
(with subtitles). A 13-Part web series, part-thriller, part-mystery, part-horror, all depending on your perspective.

Inspired by the films of David Lynch, the novels of JG Ballard and the comedy of Simon Pegg, Gentrification will keep you guessing, as well as keep you on the very edge of your seat.

Will you ever answer the door again?

Starring: Billie Vee, Konstantinos Kavakiotis, Helen Bang, Peter Rae, Sophie Aldred, Lisa Bowerman, Beatrice Hyde, David Alwyn, Nina Bright, Rosalind Blessed, Chris Pybus, Meg McNaughton, Katy Manning, Michael Fenner, Dan Snelgrove, Maria Hildebrand, Nicola Bryant, Kristyna Rasova, Candida Gubbins & Robert Duncan. 

Directed by Peter Rae & Helen Bang - Director of Photography: Katie Duke  

Original Music by Paul Flush - Design by Sarni Strachan

 

  • Who we are: Gentrification is created by husband & wife team Helen Bang & Peter Rae - creators of comedy web series The Self-Tapers - seasons 1 & 2 available on YouTube. They are joined by actress & producer Kristyna Rasova.
     
  • Our team: We have a fantastic ensemble cast, lead by leading, award-winning Greek actors, Billie Vee & Konstantinos Kavakiotis, plus a fabulous (& female-heavy) crew who have worked tirelessly to bring Gentrification to life. Help us reward them and spread the word...

                        
                           KONSTANTINOS KAVAKIOTIS                    BILLIE VEE

     
  • Our Special Guests - drawn from the worlds of Cult Sci-fi and Hit Comedy we are delighted to be joined by a cavalcade of Guest Stars - including from the worlds of Doctor Who: Sophie Aldred, Lisa Bowerman, Nicola Bryant & Katy Manning; 
     - and from hit 90's comedy Drop The Dead Donkey - Robert Duncan.
     

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • Our fundraising goal: £8000
  • How we will funnel these funds:
    • Ex-gratia payments for cast & crew
    • Production & Post-Production costs
    • Entry Fees to Web Series' Festivals
  • All fund will be divided between these areas.
     
  • 10% of all funds raised will be donated to charity. We have a lovely project close to our hearts:
    • Friends of Targoviste - Romanian Rescue Dogs: these wonderful people currently house 1700 dogs rescued from the streets or 'kill-shelters'. They keep them warm in the winter, fed, housed and looked after. They also have an amazing adoption programme where dogs are found homes in the UK and across Europe. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute - we get that! But that doesn't mean you can't help:

If you could post this campaign with a little note to encourage others to contribute we would be eternally grateful.

story:
The Film

Coworkers is a comedy-fantasy webseries about 5 employees who wake up dazed and confused in a desert with no memory of how they got there.  They try and retrace their steps so that they can get back home. They soon realize they are no longer on Earth and that they are dead and have portled to another dimension where they become the "chosen ones". 

 

The Project

We plan on finishing Season 1 by 2021.  We are currently shooting episode 2 and writing episode 3.  We have a tight schedule but I have a very strong and talented cast and crew and I know we will be able to capture all the shots we need and worst case scenario I have a backup date available if we need more time.  This episode is going to shot in multiple takes instead of how the first episode was shot in one single take.  That was mainly because that was the rule for the contest I submitted the first episode to.  

J. R. Fortin plays the role of Liam, a hilarious yet typical stoner. Ryan Vilacci plays the role of Derrick, a hopeless romantic who is not the brightest lightbulb in the box and is head over heels for Lanna.  Lanna is a girly girl played by Elizabeth Haskell. Lila is a determined and bossy woman played by Caitlynn Mccauley.  Cody Curtis plays as the character Zane who is Liam's best friend.  Connor Hall will play them magical mystery man and Delanna Swett will play the magical mystery woman character.

Cody Curtis is also the producer and assistant director for Coworkers. Christopher Fyfe is the Director of Photography.  Sherry Estabrook and John Rondaeu, owners of Epic Studio in Portland, ME, will be doing sound and  behind the scenes photography and videography on our film set.  Tamiya Joseph is the 1st assistant camera and also will be helping out with photography. 

The Impact 

By donating to this cause you are helping me cover the costs of making this episode and by doing so you are helping me achieve my goal; creating Coworkers Episode #2. 

 

Risks & Challenges

I am aware that shooting during the COVID-19 Pandemic is going to be a difficult challenge.  I can eliminate the risk of spreading the virus by making sure everyone sanitizes their hands frequently throughout the day and making sure everyone adheres to wearing masks and staying socially distant when possible.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this video on your social media platforms to help get the word out to more people.  We can't wait to share this episode with you all and thank you for supporting my passion.
