story:
Reasons for Crowdfunding 

  1. With 10 Swiss Francs (approx. 10 Dollars) or more you can express your love of film and your social responsibility 
  2. To help raise money and shine a light on the fantastic charities that are dedicating their lives to make the world a better place. 
  3. Everyone on the team has the same priority and that is; be better, do better. We’ve got a world-class team on this project including people who have worked on productions like Lord of the Rings, Avatar and Planet of the Apes.
  4. We are a carbon-neutral film project; for all CO2 emissions we create, we will plant bamboo in Ethiopia* 
  5. Help put a spotlight on swiss film productions as we aim for international streaming

If you are someone who wants to fight for a brighter future or maybe you are a parent who worries what kind of world will be left behind for your children and grandchildren  – this is a story for you. This is a story that will drive you to make a change.

All the information about this project is on: www.narikosvoyage.com 

 

Supported Charities Benefiting from your Donations 

  • OceanCare, who has been committed to marine wildlife protection for more than 30 years. Through research and conservation projects, campaigns, environmental education, and involvement in a range of important international committees, OceanCare undertakes concrete steps to improve the situation for wildlife in the world's oceans. With the money raised from this campaign, OceanCare plans to use it for the protection and saving of stranded animals in Mauritius.
  • Compassion In World Farming, who aim to eliminate all practices of factory farming through peaceful protests and creating a more humane and sustainable food and farming system. They aim to do this through a  5-year strategic plan that involves recognising the problem, exposing the myth that factory farming is a ‘necessary evil’ and persuading food companies and legislators to adopt higher welfare solutions. Compassion in World Farming plans to use the money raised towards their End the Cage Age campaign which fights against factory farming.
  • Born Free Foundation, who work to ensure that all wild animals, whether living in captivity or in the wild, are treated with compassion and respect and are able to live their lives according to their needs. They promote Compassionate Conservation to enhance the survival of threatened species in the wild and protect natural habitats while respecting the needs and safeguarding the welfare of individual animals.

  • Jane Goodall Institute UK, founded by Dr. Jane Goodall, was created to ensure the continuity of her programmes including ongoing research, two sanctuaries for orphan chimpanzees, TACARE the community-centred conservation programme now being replicated in other countries and Roots & Shoots. Roots & Shoots is Jane Goodall's humanitarian and environmental programme empowering young people of all ages in more than 65 countries to become involved in hands on projects to benefit the community, animals and the environment we all share.

If you would like to know more about these charities and what they will use the donation for, look for their interviews on our website here. 

 

Our Rewards

For your contribution, we have a range of fantastic perks such as; screensavers, your name added to the credits, baseball caps, mugs, artwork from our concept artist Myriam Catrin (the creator of the dragon Smaug in the feature film The Hobbit), a 30min call with one of the main actors Dan Richardson and more. If you donate over 100 Swiss Francs (approx. 110 USD) or more, you can choose which charity will receive your donation, please email contact@extinctionfilms.com with your choice, give your full name, aount donated and charity choice. If you donate under 100 Swiss Francs (approx. 110 USD), the money will be distributed to all four charities equally. We will then distribute the money accordingly. If we do not receive an email, the donation will be distributed equally between the four charities. All tangible perks will include a shipping cost depending on the country you want to send it to. (Please keep in mind that filling out your bank details manually is advised, as the auto-fil mechanism can be faulty). 

 

The Inspiration behind the story

During the past few years Max, the writer and producer of Nariko's Voyage, has become more and more conscious of the fact that there is hardly an animal species in the world that is not impacted by humans – be that pollution of the oceans, the hunting of rare wildlife or the damage to animals and the environment caused by factory farming. He was sitting in a restaurant, on the table in front of him was a paper table mat with a drawing of three leopard seals on it. At that instant, the image of Greta sailing across the Atlantic and the leopard seals fused into one image to create the beginning of Nariko’s Voyage. Within a few days, Max created an outline and began to write the screenplay. That was in September 2019 and now one year later here he is with his colleagues, ready to shoot the teaser for what is intended to be a 30-episode TV series.

 

Risks & Challenges

Our biggest challenge is filming in the Covid era. So far everything is running to plan, and worst-case scenario, we have to reschedule the shoot. We have contingency plans in place in case this were to happen. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

To show your support for this project, you can follow and share our Facebook page @narikosvoyage, our Instagram page @narikos_voyage, and our YouTube page @Narikos Voyage
story_txt:
Reasons for Crowdfunding 

With 10 Swiss Francs (approx. 10 Dollars) or more you can express your love of film and your social responsibility 
To help raise money and shine a light on the fantastic charities that are dedicating their lives to make the world a better place. 
Everyone on the team has the same priority and that is; be better, do better. We’ve got a world-class team on this project including people who have worked on productions like Lord of the Rings, Avatar and Planet of the Apes.
We are a carbon-neutral film project; for all CO2 emissions we create, we will plant bamboo in Ethiopia* 
Help put a spotlight on swiss film productions as we aim for international streaming

If you are someone who wants to fight for a brighter future or maybe you are a parent who worries what kind of world will be left behind for your children and grandchildren  – this is a story for you. This is a story that will drive you to make a change.
All the information about this project is on: www.narikosvoyage.com 

 
Supported Charities Benefiting from your Donations 


OceanCare, who has been committed to marine wildlife protection for more than 30 years. Through research and conservation projects, campaigns, environmental education, and involvement in a range of important international committees, OceanCare undertakes concrete steps to improve the situation for wildlife in the world's oceans. With the money raised from this campaign, OceanCare plans to use it for the protection and saving of stranded animals in Mauritius.

Compassion In World Farming, who aim to eliminate all practices of factory farming through peaceful protests and creating a more humane and sustainable food and farming system. They aim to do this through a  5-year strategic plan that involves recognising the problem, exposing the myth that factory farming is a ‘necessary evil’ and persuading food companies and legislators to adopt higher welfare solutions. Compassion in World Farming plans to use the money raised towards their End the Cage Age campaign which fights against factory farming.

Born Free Foundation, who work to ensure that all wild animals, whether living in captivity or in the wild, are treated with compassion and respect and are able to live their lives according to their needs. They promote Compassionate Conservation to enhance the survival of threatened species in the wild and protect natural habitats while respecting the needs and safeguarding the welfare of individual animals.
Jane Goodall Institute UK, founded by Dr. Jane Goodall, was created to ensure the continuity of her programmes including ongoing research, two sanctuaries for orphan chimpanzees, TACARE the community-centred conservation programme now being replicated in other countries and Roots & Shoots. Roots & Shoots is Jane Goodall's humanitarian and environmental programme empowering young people of all ages in more than 65 countries to become involved in hands on projects to benefit the community, animals and the environment we all share.

If you would like to know more about these charities and what they will use the donation for, look for their interviews on our website here. 
 
Our Rewards
For your contribution, we have a range of fantastic perks such as; screensavers, your name added to the credits, baseball caps, mugs, artwork from our concept artist Myriam Catrin (the creator of the dragon Smaug in the feature film The Hobbit), a 30min call with one of the main actors Dan Richardson and more. If you donate over 100 Swiss Francs (approx. 110 USD) or more, you can choose which charity will receive your donation, please email contact@extinctionfilms.com with your choice, give your full name, aount donated and charity choice. If you donate under 100 Swiss Francs (approx. 110 USD), the money will be distributed to all four charities equally. We will then distribute the money accordingly. If we do not receive an email, the donation will be distributed equally between the four charities. All tangible perks will include a shipping cost depending on the country you want to send it to. (Please keep in mind that filling out your bank details manually is advised, as the auto-fil mechanism can be faulty). 

 
The Inspiration behind the story
During the past few years Max, the writer and producer of Nariko's Voyage, has become more and more conscious of the fact that there is hardly an animal species in the world that is not impacted by humans – be that pollution of the oceans, the hunting of rare wildlife or the damage to animals and the environment caused by factory farming. He was sitting in a restaurant, on the table in front of him was a paper table mat with a drawing of three leopard seals on it. At that instant, the image of Greta sailing across the Atlantic and the leopard seals fused into one image to create the beginning of Nariko’s Voyage. Within a few days, Max created an outline and began to write the screenplay. That was in September 2019 and now one year later here he is with his colleagues, ready to shoot the teaser for what is intended to be a 30-episode TV series.
 

Risks & Challenges
Our biggest challenge is filming in the Covid era. So far everything is running to plan, and worst-case scenario, we have to reschedule the shoot. We have contingency plans in place in case this were to happen. 
 

Other Ways You Can Help
To show your support for this project, you can follow and share our Facebook page @narikosvoyage, our Instagram page @narikos_voyage, and our YouTube page @Narikos Voyage

story:
Summary

Little Miss Perfect is an upcoming series that is intriguing from the start! After the tragic killing of a group of teens, the sole survivor, class valedictorian and the killer’s girlfriend must recount the tragedy to a down and out detective put on a seemingly open and shut case. She begins to tell him the tale of what happened that evening and how her boyfriend seemed to snap. As Detective Richards begins to dig a little deeper, he seems to begin to find holes in the girl’s story.   He strives to find out the truth in her story however he never imagined what truth lies under her picture-perfect exterior.

We have a passionate cast and crew who are ready to bring this lively story to your screens.  With so many twists and turns this story is bound to keep you on the edge of your seat episode after episode.  We are fortunate to have a cast that are ready to bring these complicated yet relatable characters to life.  No matter who you are or where you come from there is someone in this character that you can relate to.  We are here to give each and every one of you the type of content you deserve, and we promise you won’t be disappointed.

Who Are We

Sarah Ashley: Writer/Director/Producer

Sarah has been interested in Film since the young age of two years old. In elementary school, she started doing theater productions.  It was in middle school that she started picking up a camera and looking at the world from both in front of and behind the lens.  She was an active member of The National Forensic League throughout middle school and high school competing in Original Oratory, Humorous, Dramatic, Duet and Duo competitions throughout the State of Texas.  She attended Miami International University of Art and Design.  She has since made a feature film in Florida entitled Heartland Blues and is in Post Production of a Short Film Amongst Friends.

Cequoia Johnson: Jillian Danver/Executive Producer

Cequoia was born in Baltimore and raised in Miami, Florida.  She attended UCF and graduated in 2013 with her BA in Theater Studies.  She was a featured actress in the Indie Film Wallflower based on true American untold tragedy, which was featured at the Seattle Film Festival in 2017 and had a statewide theater release in October of 2019.  She also stared in the Short Film Amongst Friends working alongside Sarah Ashley.  In 2018, she started her own Swimwear line named QuoiFish Swimwear which will be shown in Little Miss Perfect.

 

Bobby C. King: Detective Lee Richards/Stunt Coordinator 

Bobby studied theater at the University of Southern Mississippi and at AMDA in New York. After moving to Los Angeles in 1989, he launched his career in acting, as a Stunt Coordinator and Fight Choreographer. Since then, he has worked on a wide range of performances on stage: The Royal Family, The Cover of Life, NYC, Richard III, Shakespeare in the Park, N.O.L.A. As well as TV and film: Happy Texas, Infested, Would You Rather, Ted Bundy, Easy A, Mother’s Day, and Criminal Activities and most recently worked on the T.V. Series The Fosters, Miss 2059 and Outsiders, and the upcoming films The Card Counter, Stream, Rucker.

 

Kelley Poling: Cynthia Conrad

Cleveland, Ohio born, Kelley Poling has transitioned from being one of the top bathing suit and athletic models of the late 90's to working as an actress in film and television today. As a model, Kelley worked on campaigns with Hawaiian Tropic, Nike, Yamaha, and Harley Davidson. For a year between her modeling days and her acting career, she was on tour with Madonna.  Having grown up in a military family, she is also a marksman with handguns, rifles, and archery. Kelley is also trained in automatic weapons and martial arts techniques specific to film and television.  When not filming, she travels the world as a competitive Classical Fencer and is proficient with foil, small-sword, dueling sword, rapier, and sabre. Poling has been training for more than 20 years in New York with Maestri Jeannette Acosta Martinez and Ray Martinez of the prestigious Martinez Academy of Arms.  

 

Sam Ballard: Aidan Norton

Sam Ballard knew from a young age he wanted to act in films in television, loving the storytelling, art, and everything that comes with being an actor. He started taking acting seriously when he was 21, getting involved in classes, and learning the craft. After being in numerous small projects in the San Francisco area, he moved to Los Angeles to further his career. Sam’s main passions other than acting are his Catholic faith, family, bodybuilding/ fitness, and sports. He’s incredibly excited to be a part of “Little Miss Perfect” and can’t wait to get started on a special project with great people”.

 

We want you to get a chance to meet everyone on our Cast and Crew check in with us daily.  We will be releasing a new cast or crew member in our updates section throughout the campaign.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We want you to know that every cent you contribute to our project will be put to good use.  Making a series of this magnitude does not always come cheap.  Your funds will go directly to renting the locations, needed equipment, as well as feeding our amazing cast and crew.  Additionally, it will help us with anything that might pop up along the way.

The Impact

I have been fortunate enough in my life thus far to meet some amazingly talented individuals and I have picked the best of the best to be a part of this project.   We have all gathered together with the common goal of bringing you, the audience, a great series that will keep you coming back for more.  The Cast and Crew you will get to see in this series are a mix of seasoned actors as well as up and coming talent that you are not going to want to miss.  Everyone involved with Little Miss Perfect is striving daily to make this show a success and that is our promise to you; that by talking this journey with us, you will not be disappointed by the outcome.

Risks & Challenges

Undertaking any film project has its challenges and we are ready to meet each one head on.   Our Cast and Crew want you to know that we are invested in seeing this project through and working hard every day to overcome any challenges this crazy world and industry can throw our way.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know not everyone can financially back a project like this.  You can make a big difference by sharing our project with your friends and family.  Consider a share to expand the awareness of this great project.

story:
Where does the money go?

 

Pre-production
• Locations
• Film permits
• Extra camera, sound, and lighting equipment
• Props
• Set design

Production
• Extra hands on deck - when two is just not enough. (i.e. sound operator, make-up artist, etc.)
• Feeding the cast and crew
• Travel expenses

Post-production

Music

Sound Mixing

Visual Effects

 

What can you do?

No contribution is too small, and spreading the word goes a long way! Just sharing this page can do so much for the project. We definitely understand not having a lot of money to go around.

story:
Friends, webseries fans, countrymen, lend me your ears

I'm Jessamyn, the head of Travelling Lemon Productions and showrunner for Twincidents. You may know me from my work as a co-creator of Project Dashwood or one for the several other literary-inspired webseries I've been privileged to work on. For Twincidents, I'm joined by an amazing team of talented young women around the world who've developed and written the story with me, and we can't wait to bring it to life. 

To do that, we need your support! Project Dashwood was produced on virtually no budget--my two co-creators and I chipped in a few bucks here and there for props, snacks, and things like memory cards, but almost everything we used--including the camcorder we shot it on--were borrowed. For Twincidents, we'd like to up the production quality and make the story the best it can be!

Since we're dealing with identical twins, we'll be filming "Parent Trap"-style, with one actress playing two characters.  To pull off those special effects, it's important that we can have consistent lighting and good editing software. 

If money go before, all ways do lie open

We're hoping to raise enough money to invest in a DSLR camera, a simple lighting kit, mics and sound equipment, and some sundries like camera batteries,  memory cards, better editing software, and an extra hard drive for storage. Our goal covers all that, plus perks and Indiegogo fees. Here's the basic breakdown of where the money goes:

And speaking of perks, we have some great ones for you including scripts and postcards from both Project Dashwood and Twincidents, plus the chance to help this series become reality. Be sure to check out all the perks details!

Signed postcards!

           
 
   

Signed Scripts!

If we don't hit our goal, all the funds left after fulfilling perks and paying fees will still go to equipment and production costs, starting with a camera and working down our list. 

If we exceed our goal, we can invest in even better equipment and have budget for things like costumes, props, and snacks. Plus we have some fun bonus content stretch goals for you guys:

Stretch Goals:

  • $1750 - our lovely Project Dashwood actress Amelia Hahn will come back and film that long-awaited Margaret Dashwood book review. 

  • $2000 - our resident drama queen character Adriana has been a vlogger before. If we hit this goal, we'll film bonus videos of some of her in-world theatre vlogs from "last year". 

  • $2500 - we'll film scenes from Shakespeare's original play A Comedy of Errors with our Twincidents actors. 

Gentles, perchance you wonder at this show

Our Story:

In our genderbent update of Shakespeare's A Comedy of Errors, join adopted sisters Alex and Drew as they film their quest to find Alex’s birth family. They end up in the town of Ephesus, where drama student/vlogger Adriana’s life is going great - she’s vlogging, she has the lead in the play, and she’s in love with her girlfriend Alex. But everyone encounters more mixups, mayhem, and romance than they bargained for when it turns out the two Alexes are long-lost identical twins.

Our Vision:
Our hope is that this series will bring new perspective to one of Shakespeare's less loved comedies by adding challenges facing modern day foster and adopted youth and their families--whatever that may look like. 

Our Team:
The creative team behind this show has worked on just about every LIW you can think of including The Misselthwaite Archives, Northbound, Away From it All, Merry Maidens, and WH Academy. We've been working hard to develop a story that will make you laugh, cry, and everything in between!

The course of true webseries never did run smooth

As with any film project, there's always a chance things can go wrong: cast or crew might bow out, equipment might break, locations might become unavailable. Any of those things might delay the project for a while. If we learned one thing on Project Dashwood, it's to be prepared for anything. 

Give me your hands, if we be friends

Even if you don't have the means to contribute financially, you can still help!

Talk up Twincidents using #Twincidents, share our campaign on ALL your social media or (gasp) even in real life, so more people have a chance to be involved in making Twincidents happen! Indiegogo even has some handy buttons over on the side to make it super easy.

story:
What is this Production Project about?

-We have two outstanding TV Shows that we have been in talks with various networks about possibly being a new show on their schedule in 2018. One show is a 30 minutes sitcom about three best friends, who were determined to have a career and the man of their dreams and the other show is a one-hour (mystery, thriller) drama based on the lives of four business women from four different worlds. All are graced with beauty, intelligence, passion, drive and an appeal that is undeniable to those around them.

Synopsis:

-First, you have the 30 minutes sitcom about three best friends growing up in the Hamptons who are known for partying, shopping, famous friends and various men. Now embracing their 30’s they believe they’re ready to settle down in their careers and search for Mr. Right. Needing an environment to support their trendy lifestyle, they decide to move Manhattan to start their careers. These “Designing Women” of the new millennium seemed to be living their dreams, fulfilling their goals, and accomplishing their aspirations. All is in place, but the one thing they all desire...’The Perfect Guy’. After all, what good is a fortune, and success without one to share it with? Yes, searching for Mr. Right could possibly be one of the most challenging if not demanding tasks our ladies have ever taken on given the lives they’ve lived. There lies our dilemma for the 3 of them, should they wait for Mr. Right? Or would they choose Mr. Right Now?

Next, the hour long (mystery, thriller) drama where we want everyone to take a journey through the lives of four of the most powerful and hungry women around. Discover how high the price can be to get to the top and what it takes to stay there. Who will win, who will lose, and who will be able to keep the darkness from coming to light? From the outside, it seems perfect and what every woman would want, but is it really? What drives these powerful women? Is there a darker dimension to their lives that most are not privy to see? All four of these women have secrets. Some are bigger and darker than others, but they are there. When you mix the desire to get ahead at any cost with the ability to get anything done, things can happen. Bad things can happen, or at least the types of things they never want to see the light of day. Hiding secrets often involve devious deeds, forming strange alliances, and nearly selling their souls. Each lady has perfect, powerful lives on the outside, but only because of the dark and devious moves underneath. Enemies are prone to disappear mysteriously, interested men are abundant and calling, and while good lovers are hard to come by, these ladies know that their friendship is one of the strongest assets they have. Each of them knows that their business is their heart, and they will stop at nothing to keep it beating!

Why are these two TV Shows important?

-The networks desperately need some fresh new shows so people can enjoy watching TV again. We are over saturated with Reality TV Shows depicting violent fights, cussing, drinking, smoking, extreme ratchet behavior, and too much sex with other women’s men.  Right now, women are not being depicted in a positive and respectful way. It is NOT a lot of good shows on TV and these two shows would help to mitigate the negative and degrading way women have been portrayed. These TV Shows would display young women trying to establish a career and other women who have been successful in their careers. Lady K Productions are looking to submit this 30 minutes sitcom about three young women who are determined to get their career popping and find a good man to settle down and get married. The hour long show will be about four successful women in business from different culture and nationality.

Why Crowd fund this project?

- These shows will have a very position image for all our young women who only had stripping, ratchet, sex tapes, side chick, music video vixens, and THOT’s activities to be glorified to them. Lady K Productions want to show women that having a career and being an entrepreneur is way better than what Reality TV Shows are offering women to humiliate themselves on National TV in front of millions of viewers. Let’s all demand better shows to watch on TV and we can start by helping to fund these two shows that Lady K Productions is close to getting on the TV Network lineup for 2018.

Meet the Producers and Director

Daphne Hayes is a writer, producer, and set decorator who was born in Newark, NJ, currently living in Lithonia, GA. She began her career in the entertainment industry in 2005 and will make her directorial debut by filming House Arrest, which she wrote. Daphne has been a part of some notable projects like Vampire Diaries, The Blind Side, Million Dollar Arm, and The Game, just to name a few. She is very enthusiastic about working with Lady K Productions as the producer of the hour long (mystery, thriller) drama TV Show about four POWERFUL Business Women.

Warren Pemberton is an active filmmaker and director who was born in New London, Connective, but now resides in Lawrenceville, GA. His first independent film Ear Wax displayed his idea that all dreams are worth fighting for and in his sophomore debut, Criminal Behavior, he explores the notion that you can never truly escape your past. He just completed his third independent film, The OtherSide which will be a big hit in 2018. After learning about this newly formed group of talented women in the TV/Film Industry, Warren has decided to join forces with Lady K Productions and this amazing upcoming Script Writer to direct an hour long (mystery, thriller) drama TV Show about four SHREWED Business Women.

About Lady K Productions

Lady K Productions is a start-up production company located in Suitland, Maryland. We have an experienced, talented team who can handle both small and large projects for TV and filming movies. As a start-up, our growth stems from being innovative, working on a variety of ideas, and following a strategic vision to succeed.

At Lady K Productions, we believe in honesty and in loving what you do to achieve success. We also pride ourselves on helping others make their dreams come true! Please visit us at http://www.ladyk.org/ if you have a TV Show, Documentary, Commercial, Stage Play, or Movie you want to be filmed.

What will your money pay for? 

-Your money will be used for.

  • Film/Production Crew
  • Security
  • Equipment Rentals
  • Travel and Lodging
  • Cast Fee
  • Licensing
  • Trailer
  • Post Production, Editing
  • Graphic and Web Design
  • Distribution Marketing

Featured Perks:

Lady K Productions Friends-$10

Lady K Productions Associates-$25

Lady K Productions Family-$50

If you have more questions

- Great! You can contact us at­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­ ­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­­ ladykproduction301@gmail.com. You can also find us on Twitter, Instagram, and Facebook. 

Thank you so much!!!

We want to personally thank you. Words cannot express our gratitude for your consideration and investment in these two TV Shows.  We have invested so much time and personal resources into bringing these shows to TV. Now, we need you!

Raising +$100,000 through small donations is a monumental task. But, our mission is to portray women in a more positive light than what we have seen on TV over the last 8 to 10 years.  We are extremely thankful for your support. The more you give, the more positive TV Shows we can bring to the network for you to watch... 

Risks and challenges

- Making two quality TV Shows on an extremely tight budget is an extraordinary challenge. Then too, the security risks are immeasurable. We are a highly experienced team and know the TV Shows industry through and through. With your help, we promise to do everything possible to give this project solid reporting and the high-quality look and feel that it deserves. We are devoted to delivering two compelling TV Shows for the networks worthy of your contributions.
story_txt:
What is this Production Project about?
-We have two outstanding TV Shows that we have been in talks with various networks about possibly being a new show on their schedule in 2018. One show is a 30 minutes sitcom about three best friends, who were determined to have a career and the man of their dreams and the other show is a one-hour (mystery, thriller) drama based on the lives of four business women from four different worlds. All are graced with beauty, intelligence, passion, drive and an appeal that is undeniable to those around them.
Synopsis:
-First, you have the 30 minutes sitcom about three best friends growing up in the Hamptons who are known for partying, shopping, famous friends and various men. Now embracing their 30’s they believe they’re ready to settle down in their careers and search for Mr. Right. Needing an environment to support their trendy lifestyle, they decide to move Manhattan to start their careers. These “Designing Women” of the new millennium seemed to be living their dreams, fulfilling their goals, and accomplishing their aspirations. All is in place, but the one thing they all desire...’The Perfect Guy’. After all, what good is a fortune, and success without one to share it with? Yes, searching for Mr. Right could possibly be one of the most challenging if not demanding tasks our ladies have ever taken on given the lives they’ve lived. There lies our dilemma for the 3 of them, should they wait for Mr. Right? Or would they choose Mr. Right Now?
Next, the hour long (mystery, thriller) drama where we want everyone to take a journey through the lives of four of the most powerful and hungry women around. Discover how high the price can be to get to the top and what it takes to stay there. Who will win, who will lose, and who will be able to keep the darkness from coming to light? From the outside, it seems perfect and what every woman would want, but is it really? What drives these powerful women? Is there a darker dimension to their lives that most are not privy to see? All four of these women have secrets. Some are bigger and darker than others, but they are there. When you mix the desire to get ahead at any cost with the ability to get anything done, things can happen. Bad things can happen, or at least the types of things they never want to see the light of day. Hiding secrets often involve devious deeds, forming strange alliances, and nearly selling their souls. Each lady has perfect, powerful lives on the outside, but only because of the dark and devious moves underneath. Enemies are prone to disappear mysteriously, interested men are abundant and calling, and while good lovers are hard to come by, these ladies know that their friendship is one of the strongest assets they have. Each of them knows that their business is their heart, and they will stop at nothing to keep it beating!
Why are these two TV Shows important?
-The networks desperately need some fresh new shows so people can enjoy watching TV again. We are over saturated with Reality TV Shows depicting violent fights, cussing, drinking, smoking, extreme ratchet behavior, and too much sex with other women’s men.  Right now, women are not being depicted in a positive and respectful way. It is NOT a lot of good shows on TV and these two shows would help to mitigate the negative and degrading way women have been portrayed. These TV Shows would display young women trying to establish a career and other women who have been successful in their careers. Lady K Productions are looking to submit this 30 minutes sitcom about three young women who are determined to get their career popping and find a good man to settle down and get married. The hour long show will be about four successful women in business from different culture and nationality.
Why Crowd fund this project?
- These shows will have a very position image for all our young women who only had stripping, ratchet, sex tapes, side chick, music video vixens, and THOT’s activities to be glorified to them. Lady K Productions want to show women that having a career and being an entrepreneur is way better than what Reality TV Shows are offering women to humiliate themselves on National TV in front of millions of viewers. Let’s all demand better shows to watch on TV and we can start by helping to fund these two shows that Lady K Productions is close to getting on the TV Network lineup for 2018.
Meet the Producers and Director
Daphne Hayes is a writer, producer, and set decorator who was born in Newark, NJ, currently living in Lithonia, GA. She began her career in the entertainment industry in 2005 and will make her directorial debut by filming House Arrest, which she wrote. Daphne has been a part of some notable projects like Vampire Diaries, The Blind Side, Million Dollar Arm, and The Game, just to name a few. She is very enthusiastic about working with Lady K Productions as the producer of the hour long (mystery, thriller) drama TV Show about four POWERFUL Business Women.
Warren Pemberton is an active filmmaker and director who was born in New London, Connective, but now resides in Lawrenceville, GA. His first independent film Ear Wax displayed his idea that all dreams are worth fighting for and in his sophomore debut, Criminal Behavior, he explores the notion that you can never truly escape your past. He just completed his third independent film, The OtherSide which will be a big hit in 2018. After learning about this newly formed group of talented women in the TV/Film Industry, Warren has decided to join forces with Lady K Productions and this amazing upcoming Script Writer to direct an hour long (mystery, thriller) drama TV Show about four SHREWED Business Women.

story:
Check out the video below for more info!

Director Aidan Weaver and co-writer Chris Stephens have been developing Clouds since September of 2016, and after a year of revisions, production meetings, late nights, and countless cups of coffee,  we are finally ready to bring the 174 pages to life. 

But Here's the Catch

While certain expenses are covered, we still need to raise an additional $5,000 to cover our final expenses. 

Below, you will find out why. 

When you're a kid, sometimes you feel alone. Sometimes you feel scared. And, sometimes, you should.

The things that happen to us at a young age stick with us, whether we like it or not. Milo, a 12-year-old boy growing up in a small town, has a more challenging set of circumstances than most - he has a stalker. In the summer of 1999, Milo's peaceful upbringing comes to a screeching halt when a series of disturbing and inexplicable events begin to dominate his life. As the threat builds, Milo stumbles into a mystery involving the people around him and what they are trying to hide. 

Years later, Milo, now 27-years-old, discovers a collection of unsettling videotapes he believes to be connected to his childhood, leading him on a mission to discover what was hidden from him for so many years.

This is a story about the secrets that people sometimes bury, and what happens when they finally come to light.

 Let's Break it Down

  • Clouds is a 30-day production to be filmed entirely in Asheville, North Carolina,
  • The production begins on July 3rd and ends on August 11th, and
  • Our 20 person crew has worked together on multiple short films, allowing us to work quickly and efficiently to immortalize this project on film in less than a month's time.

Why We Need a Little Extra Help

Locations | Props | Music Licensing

  • From dingy dive bars to small-town elementary schools, we've scoured practically all of Asheville, North Carolina to create the world of Clouds. Some of our best locations were completely free, but others require a small fee, and that fee is well worth it in the end production.
  • Clouds is a partial period piece set in 1999, forcing us to source props ranging from VHS cameras to bulky televisions to cassette tape players. 
  • To accent the world we're building, we need to license a few key pieces of music truly convey the right tone.

This is Where You Come In

Any contribution will have a direct effect on the screen. Below is a breakdown of our budget, so you can see where you will be helping us out!

 

 

        

We all met in film school. We made a lot of short films together. Now, we're making a big one. 

Aidan Weaver - Writer/Director

Since he was 10 years old, Aidan found his passion in filmmaking. Through short films, documentaries, and commercials, Aidan taught himself how to tell stories through visuals. He has won best film at the 48 Hour Film Project and best director 3 years in a row. His films have screened at Shriekfest, the Sidewalk Film Festival, the 48 Hour Film Project, and many more festivals around the world. Check out his YouTube page or his demo reel. 

Jared Freeman - Director of Photography #1

Jared is a Director of Photography from North Carolina. Over the past few years he has worked on a wide array of productions, ranging from commercials to complete films. Check out his demo reel. 

Andrew Mirmanesh - Director of Photography #2

Andrew Mirmanesh is a freelance cinematographer based out of Winston-Salem, North Carolina. One of his most recent works included traveling around the globe to showcase the vision crisis in developing countries for the feature length documentary Envisioned. Check out his website. 

Lori Whitus - Production Designer

Lori Whitus is an up-and-coming Production Designer and is the head Production Designer for Clouds. She has single-handedly designed two independent short films, Thicket and Husk, along with almost a dozen school projects. She is a cultured world traveler and has lived in several different US States, as well as overseas. 

Joseph Tarnacki - Producer

Joseph's first filmmaking experience was the big-budget, stop-motion Lego James Bond short he created in his bedroom. Many consider this his magnum-opus. Years later, Joseph has struggled to top himself, making short films, commercials and documentaries. He currently studies Producing at University of North Carolina School of the Arts where he has written, produced, and assistant directed several short films. 

Elliott Emfinger - Producer/1st AD

Elliott Emfinger is a producer and 1st Assistant Director from Birmingham, Alabama. She has worked on various independent short films, features, and music video productions such as Husk, The Arbors, and Millwood County. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Not everyone can contribute, but you can still support us!

We want as many people as possible to enjoy Clouds. Subscribe to our YouTube channel, share our Facebook page, and help us grow our audience! You can also follow our behind-the-scenes journey on Instagram!

  • Clouds Facebook 
  • Clouds Youtube
  • Clouds Instagram

Clouds Youtube

Clouds Instagram

story:
Why Mango & Mushroom?

Hello! I am Shaun, the creator of Mango & Mushroom Cooking.  Thank you for taking the time to check us out!

Mango & Mushroom Cooking is an online cooking show focused on creating recipes with fresh, healthful ingredients. Cute chef-cats Mango, Mushroom, and Calcifer will co-star in a variety of videos including complete meal-prep preparation, refined show-off meal tutorials, and simple skill-building tips.  

The world needs positive, thoughtful content. Our channel will help make a healthy food lifestyle accessible to everyone. This is a pet project I have been stewing on for years. Please join me as I share my love of cooking and cute chef cats!

Contribute and be a Cool Cat!

What we need support doing:

  • Paying artists for their work so our content can be engaging and polished from the start
  • Collecting a fan base before our videos launch 
  • Buying more efficient and effective software for photo and video editing

What you get for supporting us:

  • Awesome limited-edition swag
  • Exclusive content
  • Personalized videos and recipes

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Challenges & Plans

While creating an online presence is a little more difficult than herding cats, having a group of excited fans makes it easier! Here are our biggest hurdles and our plans on how to chop them down.

  • We don't have a kitchen right now!
    • Yes, it is hard to film videos with no kitchen!
    • Our kitchen is slated to be completed in December, right around when our campaign ends
    • Our new kitchen has better lighting and is more visually appealing, which helps raise our final video quality
  • We don't have a functional house right now!
    • Hurricane recovery is hard, but luckily online work can be done with a computer
    • This time is for building our fan base and planning our videos for more consistent output
  • Consistent output to engage (and retain!) followers
    • We will be pre-recording our weekly videos so we launch with a two-week buffer to compensate for any production hurdles
    • Our current channel launch date is January 1 (reaches new-years resolutions for eating healthier)
  • Weekly video schedule
    • Phase 1 (January) will have 2 weekly videos
      • Sunday: complete weekly meal-prep 
      • Tuesday: short tip video (such as knife skills, preparation tips)
    • Complete launch (February) will add:
      • Friday: show-off meal for two 
      • Saturday: short snack or smoothie video

Help us find more Curious Cats!

Every share helps us! Contributions include sharing our project with your friends:

  • Use Indiegogo share tools (they are the easiest ways to spread the word)
  • Don't forget to use our hashtags
    • #mangoandmushroomcooking
    • #culinarycats

THANK YOU for checking us out!

story:
WingChick, The Series: IMDB Page 

New Logo By Vogue Wilborn Of Moderna Images

Following a successful production campaign (so many lovely donations, including one from Academy Award-nominated producer, Kimberly Steward!), we began filming on the weekend of July 28, 2017. During our two-day shoot (with a pick-up day later on!), we tackled the typical struggles of production: scheduling, losing light, sound issues... and everyone's favorite... going over budget. We bonded over each and every one of these aspects and became a family. 

Oh, and guess what?! With your contributed funding, we were actually able to film two episodes: "Hatched" (Pilot) and "Fried Hard!" Y'all did that! We did that! 

*PLEASE NOTE*: We will also be fulfilling perks from our original crowdfunding campaign, so please look out for more information while we run this current campaign! You will receive your perks, we promise!  

Now, with two filmed episodes under our belt, we are setting our eyes on the film festival circuit. This is where y'all come in, once again! 

 

JIGGA WHO?
Tonja Renée Stidhum - Creator/Director/Executive Producer
Bonique’a Matthews - Executive Producer
Alysia Allen - Producer
Mariscela Beatríz Mendez - Director of Photography
Carl Jones - Editor 
Bree Mei-Li - Raven
Aubrey Marquez - Michael
Lesette Latimer - Lenora aka "Leo"
Johanna Middleton - Tess
Riannah Pouncy - Greer
Shondriette Kelley - Consulting Producer
Tanya Hayles - Consulting Producer
Lauren Persons - Consulting Producer
Girl I Guess Productions

JIGGA WHAT?
WINGCHICK SYNOPSIS - Raven is a late twenty-something bougie-mixed-with-a-dash-of-hood Black girl juggling her burgeoning job as a professional dating site profile writer and a professional dating flop. She has mastered the art of intimacy without being intimate: the best friend, the confidant, the wingwoman for dudes.

Raven’s male partner-in-crime is Michael and their relationship is your typical “sexual tension splattered all over their faces, but somehow they don’t own a mirror” situation. When Raven needs some fellow estrogen in her life, she hangs with her BFFs: Greer, Lenora (called “Leo”, for short), and Tess.

Navigating the ins and outs of dating and the tangled web she and Michael have unknowingly weaved leads Raven to a whirlwind of shenanigans and self-discovery.

JIGGA WHEN?
Our post-production campaign will run for 60 days!

JIGGA WHERE?
Post-production will take place in Los Angeles, CA. Viewing will take place at various film festivals and will be available on the internets (YouTube) after the film festival world premiere: here, there… everywhere!

JIGGA WHY?
In an effort to facilitate increased visibility and improved quality of the images featuring Black folks -- specifically Black women -- on-screen and in Hollywood, Girl I Guess Productions was established in 2015. We hope to create a space filled with Black Girl Magic and beyond! WingChick is one piece of the “Representation Matters” pie!

Plus, our set was full of inclusion -- from racial to gender identity. 

JIGGA HOW?
Your lovely coins will contribute to all aspects of WingChick's post-production schedule. The funds will go toward aspects such as, but not limited to:

• Editor 
• Color Correction 
• ADR (Sound)
• Film Festival Fees
• Travel Expenses (as necessary)
• Publicity/Marketing
• Music
• Wrap Party/Screenings

SHARING IS CARING! 

We have fun tweetable promos you can copy & paste to share with your networks! 

- Retweet & support #WingChick, a comedy about the habitual homegirl! https://igg.me/at/WingChick-Post

- Are you #TeamDrums or #TeamFlats? Rep your chicken wing squad and contribute here: https://igg.me/at/WingChick-Post #WingChick

- Whether you got $5 on it or you're Diddy On A Yacht, please support #WingChick webseries! https://igg.me/at/WingChick-Post

Stay tuned for more opportunities to experience our very interactive campaign! There will be contests as well!

We did that! *PLEASE NOTE*: We will also be fulfilling perks from our original crowdfunding campaign, so please look out for more information while we run this current campaign! You will receive your perks, we promise!  Now, with two filmed episodes under our belt, we are setting our eyes on the film festival circuit. She has mastered the art of intimacy without being intimate: the best friend, the confidant, the wingwoman for dudes.Raven’s male partner-in-crime is Michael and their relationship is your typical “sexual tension splattered all over their faces, but somehow they don’t own a mirror” situation. When Raven needs some fellow estrogen in her life, she hangs with her BFFs: Greer, Lenora (called “Leo”, for short), and Tess.Navigating the ins and outs of dating and the tangled web she and Michael have unknowingly weaved leads Raven to a whirlwind of shenanigans and self-discovery.JIGGA WHEN?Our post-production campaign will run for 60 days!JIGGA WHERE?Post-production will take place in Los Angeles, CA. Viewing will take place at various film festivals and will be available on the internets (YouTube) after the film festival world premiere: here, there… everywhere!JIGGA WHY?In an effort to facilitate increased visibility and improved quality of the images featuring Black folks -- specifically Black women -- on-screen and in Hollywood, Girl I Guess Productions was established in 2015. We hope to create a space filled with Black Girl Magic and beyond! WingChick is one piece of the “Representation Matters” pie!Plus, our set was full of inclusion -- from racial to gender identity. JIGGA HOW?Your lovely coins will contribute to all aspects of WingChick's post-production schedule. The funds will go toward aspects such as, but not limited to:• Editor • Color Correction • ADR (Sound)• Film Festival Fees• Travel Expenses (as necessary)• Publicity/Marketing• Music• Wrap Party/ScreeningsSHARING IS CARING! We have fun tweetable promos you can copy & paste to share with your networks! - Retweet & support #WingChick, a comedy about the habitual homegirl! https://igg.me/at/WingChick-Post- Are you #TeamDrums or #TeamFlats? Rep your chicken wing squad and contribute here: https://igg.me/at/WingChick-Post #WingChick- Whether you got $5 on it or you're Diddy On A Yacht, please support #WingChick webseries! https://igg.me/at/WingChick-PostStay tuned for more opportunities to experience our very interactive campaign! There will be contests as well!

story: Short Summary
story_txt: Short Summary

story:
BLISS, is going to be a made for television comedy sitcom.  The sitcom focuses on the fictitious BLISS Wedding Chapel  and its employees here in Las Vegas.  From the bride who married a mannequin, to the swinger couple who wanted me to continue my “service” in their hotel room… it has been one unusual wedding after the other.  Each episode focuses on those crazy weddings that Las Vegas is known for.  There will be many surprises! Chapel employees are not immune to the quirky, unusual and downright craziness that happens.  We will have an up close and personal looks into the lives and dealings  of the  chapel staff.

BLISS will be a faced paced comedy, with plenty of all that comedy has to offer, witty banter, physical comedy, one liners, and total absurd situations.

 

Our target campaign goal for BLISS is $60,000. The focus is on the talent, because a successful comedy requires spot-on acting performances, physical and facial expressiveness, and comedic timing.

Using the format of such successful sitcoms as Friends, Big Bang Theory, Always Sunny in Philadelphia, they started with a somewhat unknown cast, and turned it into something big.  We feel we’ve assembled a cast that has that comedic “it” that will make this show a success. The BLISS ensemble members are some of the brightest and funniest talents! We truly believe that and want them to shine through this sitcom.

The success of a comedy lies, not only with its actors, but will the cameras ability to capture the right moment, and the ability of the video editor to make the perfect shot cuts.  For this reason, a majority of the budget goes to the camera/editing.  We are shooting a single camera situational comedy and with this fund raiser are looking to use cameras suggested by Netflix, as well as the networks.  Our goal is to have 2 cameras rolling to catch those actors in the moment.  In a nutshell, whatever is raised with this campaign, it will go to the actors, camera and editing teams, and an upgrade in cameras.

We feel that with your help and with the fun and exciting perks we have to offer that we can achieve out 60,000 goal. 

We have offered many different tiers of perks, and hope that you can contribute what you can and make this project come to life the way it deserves.  If you love the idea behind this project and would like to see it made, please share our campaign.

Sitcoms are and will always be a breath of fresh air.  Making one laugh is our gift to others. "A day without laughter is a day wasted". Charlie Chaplin.  "You don't stop laughing because you grow old. You grow old because you stop laughing." Michael Pritchard.

 

This project is near and dear to my heart, as it is 14 years in the making.  14 years of meeting and associating with some of the most wonderful and astonishing people, not only whom I've married but whom I've worked with.  It has been fulfilling and rewarding.  And like relationships there have been a lot of roller coaster rides in this journey(sorry, the minister in me likes to use analogies). We've wanted to make this happen for so long, but we realized that we couldn't do it half a#@ed. The timing and the funds needed to be in order. This was a lot more work and money than we imagined, but we've loved every step of this journey. We are so close now, and we truly believe that this project deserves to be seen by all.  We  need your help in knocking this out of the park.  Thank you in advance for your help and support.  Please, if you can't contribute, we would love for you to get the word out to as many of your family and friends as possible. On this site there is the Indiegogo share tools...please forward to everyone...as Sean Dillingham our limo driver in the sitcom says.."It's time to make some noise!"  Contribute and share...thank you! Robert and Donna

Special thanks to Donna Fischer, co-creator, whose enthusiasm and vision is making this all possible!

story:
The Inspiration For z'lectrik

z'lectrik [pronounced: zuh-lek-trik] originated from the mind of Steven Lopez. He drew inspirations from Blade Runner, Ghost in the Shell (1995), Inception, and Black Mirror  to help fully create the concept of artificial memories and the corporate-run retro-future of Zenith City. Not only will the series be a tip of the hat to 80's science fiction films, it will go in-depth about the premature growth to a technological advancement too big to fully comprehend and its sociological impact.

The series follows a woman with an infected mind as she goes for outside help, looking to discover the meaning behind the voices in her head. However, as events unfold, she will delve into a world much larger than herself...

 

"The shadows of your past will come to consume your present."

 

The Journey Ahead & The Reward

12/15: As of right now, we're currently on board to create the pilot - no matter the outcome. With your help, we can help push the production up to fully produce the whole 8-part web-series and make it to be the best internet-viewing experience for everyone!


As you can see, most of the budget will go towards production design in part being that we're creating a fictional retro-future in the year 2000. We'll need props, set-dressing, miniatures, and even create our graphic art to compliment the setting you'll be immersed into! Just like story and characters, production value is key! As for any other cost for concerns (locations, insurance, catering, paying for actors), fret not, we have that covered!

 

Our main goal for this campaign is to make our web series the best possible experience for all you viewers at home! At the end of the day, all of this is for you!

 

And for your generosity, here we have these list of perks to make the experience a more memorable one...

You can even help us by following & sharing our campaign to others along with our Facebook page! Spread the word!

 

Meet the Cast

Alexandra Küas hails from Cologne, Germany and keeps strong ties to her family and friends abroad while calling New York City home for many years.

She has acted in many short films, including a film based on Wagner’s opera, Das Rheingold - performed entirely in German, and the short, 6 Minutes, in which Alexandra plays one of the leads is currently being edited for the film festival circuit.

This past summer Alexandra had a supporting part in the independent feature film, The Library, a story of survival in a post-nuclear world, written and directed by J.J. Koester, to be released in 2017.

She is a co-producer of Stripped Scripts, a unique play reading series currently in collaboration with LIC-Artists in Long Island City, Queens.

IMDb • Acting Reel • Website

 

Formally trained for both stage and screen, and armed with quirky charm to spare, Emily McKinley Hill is quickly becoming a force in the independent film world. She has a solid foundation of theatre training from Towson University's prestigious Acting Track and Savannah College of Art & Design. She also honed her skills at New York Film Academy, and with renowned sitcom actress and coach Margaret Reed.

Most recently she graced the big screen in award-winning college comedy, What Happened Last Night (2016). Look for her in upcoming indelible horror flicks, including riveting performances in edgy nightmare fuel Back Road, and Mad Sin Cinema's Ted Bundy Had A Son.

IMDb • Acting Reel

 

Having trained at the London Theatre Academy, Andrew Binger is man who lived and breathed theatre life. From his early days at the Thomas H. Kean Theatre, to regional theatres like The Forestburgh Playhouse, Andrew performed in countless shows including one as the titular Tom Robinson in To Kill A Mockingbird. On the film side, he played one of the main roles in the teen-comedy web-series, Unrelated. Andrew is a founding member of The Company, Newark's premiere theatre company, dedicated to works of social justice and a faculty member at the world renowned Newark Boys Chorus School.

 

Roberto Ragone is a former member of the 68 Cent Theatre Group. He performed countless roles in various showcases for the Drama Committee Repertory Theatre. Most recently he played Felix in The Odd Couple, the title character, Faust in a theatrical adaptation of the opera, Faust and Marguerite, and the male lead, Bailey Bryce, in a theatrical production of The Tangled Skirt.

 

Meet the Crew

Living across the street from a local movie theater in his childhood years at West New York, motion pictures were as much of a family to Steven Lopez as his own mother and father.

He went to Montclair State University, earning a B.F.A. degree in Filmmaking. During his college years, he would sound mix and sound design countless short films, including notable works like Prose For Rose, The Vessel, and Fistful of Candy. On top of helping his fellow filmmakers, he also wrote and produced some films of his own, including the upcoming 1960's-style business comedy, A Table Discussion. He gained notoriety for his work in production sound mixing for feature films such as the Kevin Smith biography film, Shooting Clerks, and the musical mockumentary, Happy Yummy Chicken (starring Taryn Manning, Diane Guerrero, Suzzanne Douglas, and Emma Myles).

Deeply passionate for his work and his audience, Steven aspires to create original work that differs from the norm and to bring audiences together to explore new scopes of weirdness and creativity. He wishes for audiences to live the adventure as he would try in normal life every day.

IMDb • YouTube

 

Nick Capra (also goes by Nicolas J Capra), is an NJ based Director of Photography. He's shot countless short films, including award-winning films such as Writer's Block (2016) and No Sleep (2015). On top of working on shorts (including his very own, Waffle), he has also worked on two feature length indie films, both as either a cinematographer or camera op, getting to work with stars like Emma Miles, Suzanne Douglas, Taryn Manning from Orange is the New Black in the musical mockumentary, Happy Yummy Chicken.


He loves shooting music videos, weddings, and promotional shorts, but he really loves shooting narrative films. His specialty may be at the camera department, but he can also stand on his own in other fields as an editor, director, and writer of films.
 

Vimeo • Cinematography Reel • IMDb • Instagram

 

Brittany Zwier is a producer, production manager, and assistant director based in Northeast  NJ. She has produced and organized a number of successful and imaginative short films in her career including, but not limited to Breeding Grounds: The Web Series, A Table Discussion and The Vessel. Brittany is passionate about assisting others with the realization of their creative works and is enthusiastic about embarking on the journey that will be z'lectrik.

 

As much as he loves creating and designing sets, Burak Aydogan always had a soft spot working with small scaled models and figures, and making them look as realistic as possible in front of a camera.  He skills in miniatures and set design were put to the test in several films, including when he directed A Table Discussion  - a business comedy set in the 60's, and other shorts like The Vessel  -  a sci-fi film set in the 80's. z'lectrik will prove to be his next greatest feat, and he is looking forward to the challenge!

IMDb • Instagram

 

Chris Giuseppini has produced many of Montclair State’s most successful crowdfunding campaigns (including the sci-fi short, The Vessel ) and is excited to be a part of z'lectrik. He was the Director of Photography when shooting the films trailer, and is passionate about delivering an incredible product with the film.

Chris is in his junior year at Montclair State University and has directed two narrative films, a documentary and the first commercial to be produced by the university. He looks forward to working with a team that he has grown close with over his years at school.

IMDb • YouTube

___________________________________________________________________________

Crowdfunding Trailer Credits

Writer & Director: Steven Lopez
Director of Photography: Chris Giuseppini
Production Designer: Burak Aydogan
Gaffer: Michael S. Miller
Sound Mixer: Kyle Murphy
Narrator: Eric Gerstein

Alexandra Küas as Silvia
Negin Sedaghat as The Figure

story:
Short Summary

Creator Richard Sirgiovanni’s interest and career always ran on parallel roads as a cartoonist and musician at an early age. By day he worked as a cartoonist on hundreds of diverse projects, and by night as a drummer in several rock bands for live performances and studio recordings. His interest always was cartooning and music… Ergo… “Birth of The Grimps”. Richard's dream has always been to create a program for kids that every family, including his own, would love together. 

The team is made up of music-industry experts who have spent decades of their career bringing iconic music to millions. Toni Bongiovi and Ron Alexenburg joined Richard Sirgiovanni to bring this project to life. 

The campaign will enable us to bring The Grimps to the next step of getting a television development deal and launching this project. Although the music is in place with producer Tony Bongiovi, his studio and our live boys band (The Grimps) the animated series needs a distribution deal to launch this project.

It is no longer the norm that networks will buy and develop a show even with a good idea on paper. They need to see a short film that will represent the ongoing series. The Grimps is a unique entertainment property and now an animated short needs to be made. Your contributions are key to helping us make the film.

 

Website:

www.thegrimps.com

 

What We Need & What You Get

Animation is expensive and cost varies dramatically depending on the type of animation needed and could range from $10K to $30K per minute. We are looking to raise $30K to produce a 6 minute 2D animated short. To give you some examples of 2D animation we would have to compare it to The Simpsons, Dora The Explorer, or other family favorites.

The $30K cost to complete this animated short consists of many elements and talent within the animation studio. Storyboards, background design, character design, effects, voiceover talent, sound effects, music, audio mix, and edit.

If we don't reach our full goal we will still make the most of your generous contributions and produce a shorter video within the budget that will be prepared for a studio review. 

 

The Impact

    Although there are a lot of great kids shows out there, there are also a lot of shows that are irreverent and do not send good messages to kids. The intention of The Grimps is to produce a series that is fun, entertaining and sends positive messages to our youth. A show that kids can watch with their parents and grandparents. Your contributions would enable us to make this animated short which will be a tool to present to TV networks for a development deal. We believe that The Grimps TV series will make a positive impact on kids in many ways.

    The Grimps musical partners, Tony Bongiovi and Ron Alexenburg have been involved and responsible for some of the most successful hit songs and albums in rock history. Michael Jackson, Bon Jovi, Meatloaf, Aerosmith, Bruce Springsteen, The Ramones, and The Beach Boys to name a few.


    Our intention & goal is to make The Grimps a relevant rock n roll band presented animated in the TV series and then to tour live on stage with our boy band (The Grimps) with hit songs to a new generation.

    The creator and partners of The Grimps have many years of experience in the entertainment and music business. Our confidence in the content of this idea and the success stories in the music business, drives us knowing we can find a home for The Grimps on TV once this short film is made.

     

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Any help is a great help! If you can not contribute any amount of money doesn’t mean you can’t help. Please help us spread the word on your social media outlets to expand our message. It would be greatly appreciated.

    Please enjoy the slides below which include more information on The Grimps!

     

    Website:

    www.thegrimps.com

Although there are a lot of great kids shows out there, there are also a lot of shows that are irreverent and do not send good messages to kids. The intention of The Grimps is to produce a series that is fun, entertaining and sends positive messages to our youth. A show that kids can watch with their parents and grandparents. Your contributions would enable us to make this animated short which will be a tool to present to TV networks for a development deal. We believe that The Grimps TV series will make a positive impact on kids in many ways.
The Grimps musical partners, Tony Bongiovi and Ron Alexenburg have been involved and responsible for some of the most successful hit songs and albums in rock history. Michael Jackson, Bon Jovi, Meatloaf, Aerosmith, Bruce Springsteen, The Ramones, and The Beach Boys to name a few.
Our intention & goal is to make The Grimps a relevant rock n roll band presented animated in the TV series and then to tour live on stage with our boy band (The Grimps) with hit songs to a new generation.
The creator and partners of The Grimps have many years of experience in the entertainment and music business. Our confidence in the content of this idea and the success stories in the music business, drives us knowing we can find a home for The Grimps on TV once this short film is made.

 
Other Ways You Can Help
Any help is a great help! If you can not contribute any amount of money doesn’t mean you can’t help. Please help us spread the word on your social media outlets to expand our message. It would be greatly appreciated.Please enjoy the slides below which include more information on The Grimps! Website:www.thegrimps.com

story:
Dear Friends,

My name is Buck and I'm a Screenwriter/Filmmaker/Actor based out of NY. I wrote "Evanston" as a story of two brothers and it grew into something so much bigger. Our story is about a family in Maine and its struggles, including Loss, Grief, Addiction, and Mental Health. I want to keep telling this story and I need your help!

 

What We Need & What You Get

Breakdown of Costs to Produce the Full Episode:

$7500 for Filming/Audio
$3000 for Editing
$4000 for Actors
$5000 for Locations & Insurance
$2000 Miscellaneous

No Contribution is Too Big or Too Small. However, for donations in certain increments we will offer rewards as an incentive, including a "Special Thanks" in the Credits and a Walk-On Role just for you, and more! 

Any contribution you make will help contribute to telling the story of Evanston. I want to tell this story and make people Feel and Think and know that they are Not Alone in their struggles. This is an original story, and we believe that the script contains something for everyone.

My wonderful crew includes a Cinematographer/Editor, Audio Specialist, and an outstanding group of actors. I want to continue to tell this story so that they can partake in the process, and so can audiences.

First and foremost, we are telling Human Stories about the Struggles that Everyday People face in Towns Everywhere.

Challenges

We have calculated the costs to produce a Full Episode, and hope you can help us achieve this goal. Together with my crew, I'm determined to tell this story of Family, Loss, and Redemption.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone is able to contribute financially, but I ask that if you believe in this project, please spread the word to friends, colleagues, anyone who might be interested.

Much love,

Buck
@evanstontvpilot

story:
Synopsis

Sara arrives for her first year at university and discovers that her randomly assigned roommate is a 60 year-old woman named Rayna.  They must learn to live with each other’s differences as they progress throughout their tumultuous first semester of college, struggling with friendship, tattoos, drugs, and parties on top of their atypical living arrangement.

 

The Team

Samantha Rayne Harris (Producer/Writer/Creator)

Olivia G. Mills (Associate Producer/Writer/Creator)

Kai Yost (Director)

Savannah Vu (1st Assistant Director)

Arnas Ribaciauskas (Director of Photography)

Ana Gonzalez (Art Director)

Leanne Villanueva (Social Media Manager)

Derek Walker (Lead Editor)

 

 

We are a team of Entertainment and Media Studies students at the University of Georgia who are professional and care deeply about content creation and telling stories. 

Samantha Rayne Harris (Producer/Writer/Creator): "What started as a class project quickly became a personal passion, a story I had to tell. I think everyone can learn from Sara and Rayna and see themselves in these women in some way. They learn to navigate life, loss, fear, and adventure all through the lens of their freshman year of college. This series was the first project I have written from start to finish. The creation of this story was not an easy ride. There were arguments, writer’s block, frustration, and even character’s written off that were there from the beginning (RIP Charlotte). In the end, I saw a story of two women coming-of-age at very different times and finding themselves in the most unlikely of circumstances (sorry, I had to). Sara and Rayna have a part of me and I hope everyone who watches will carry on a part of them too" 

Olivia G. Mills (Associate Producer/Writer/Creator): "For me, college has been a series of unexpected growing pains. Sara and Rayna’s story is a reflection of this sentiment in every way possible. Their differences as people, their struggles, and their arguments are all modeled after people and situations that my friends, co-creators, and I have encountered in life so far. It’s a story that shows the importance of intergenerational conversation, as well as the truth that you can find a friend in the most unlikely places (you saw this coming).  Sara and Rayna have taught me a lot about life as well as creating and I hope that their story continues to teach not only me, but also others."

 

We are looking for funding to cover 6 areas of cost: equipment rentals, locations fees, transportation, food for the cast & crew, props & wardrobe, and festival submission fees. 

Your contribution will go directly toward the production of the series!

 

 

If you can't contribute- that's okay! You can help us by sharing this campaign and following us on social media!

Instagram.com/unlikelywebseries

Twitter.com/uwebseries

story:
We are:

Melissa Pressman, Alison Robertson, Gina Kelly and Robin Long.  With some help from you, we would like to share this silly series with the world! 

This girl gang would like to stop this relationship guru from spreading her sexist advice. We'd like to invite you to be a part of the journey. This ragtag group of women will make you laugh along the way. 

We have a season of six episodes all typed up and ready to shoot!

We have a very talented cast and crew that we would very much like to pay. They would like it too...we said we would.  

We are looking to raise $30,000.00 to cover all of our production costs. 

This will cover: equipment rental, crew, cast, locations and food for a nine day shoot.

By contributing to our campaign, you are sharing laughter with the world...and lobbing a brick or two at the patriarchy at the same time.

Any amount is appreciated! If you don't have spare cash to splurge, sharing the campaign on your social media accounts is also very helpful.

Thank you for considering our project!
