story:
Marc and Maria Unger are a  husband and wife team grateful for the opportunity to work with an extremely talented and devoted cast and crew drawn almost exclusively from the DC/MD/VA region.  They created the show, do most of the post production work (not sound, we're not great at sound yet) and do their best to make sure the on-set experience is one of artistic commune, professionalism and inspired work.

 

 

 

Thousands of people have already watched season one and, for season two, we plan to delve even deeper into Adam's struggles as he seeks to reinvent himself while remaining relevant at an age where it's easy to feel like you've disappeared.   This season, we'll also learn more about Adam's wife Abby (played by Nikki Cozart) and her frustrations as she tight rope walks marriage and career.  With her husband travelling back and forth to New York to pursue his acting dreams, she's the one bringing home the bulk of the earnings while working in a field that's draining her spirit. Meanwhile, Petra Antonelli (Sasha Carrera) deals with sobriety and works to rebuild her relationship with her daughter and resume her acting career. .   As in season one, the city of Baltimore remains an integral character in the show and, because of the success of the first season, locations have been offered to us that will further highlight the city and its rapidly growing arts scene. 

Marc Unger

Marc's been a comedian, actor writer and filmmaker for over 25 years.  His credits include several appearances on Comedy Central, guest starring roles on the HBO hit comedy "Veep", NBC "Friends" and tons of stage and short film work.  Over his long tenure he's been blessed to work with many notable actors including Emmy winner Julia Louis-Dreyfus, Academy Award nominee John Hawkes, Emmy nominee Paul Dooley and Pulitzer Prize winning playwright Stephen Adly Guirgis.

 

 

Nikki Cozart

A former star athlete at the University of Tennessee, Nikki has quickly moved up the ranks to become a much sought after actor in the DMV region as well as nationally. Her credits include NBC's  "Law and Order- Special Unit" and the hit Netflix series "House of Cards".

 

 

 

Sasha Carrera

Sasha's a seasoned stage actress and has appeared in several films including "Worth", "Forfeit of Grace", "Mr. Hopewell's Remedy" and the soon to be released "Prodigal". 

 

 

 

Matthew Bowerman

Matthew was a cast member of the Off Broadway hit "Awesome 80s Prom" and an original member of the Md. company.  His many film and television credits include "Veep", "House of Cards", "The Night Watchmen" and "One Penny." As a writer, he received an Emmy for Best Educational Short. 

 

 

 

 

Bart Debicki

Bart's work includes several Shakespeare productions as well as the National Geographic Channel's "Killing Kennedy" and "The World Wars" on the History Channel.

 

 


 

 

Claire Schoonover

 Claire is originally from Oldham England, she’s been in DC area since 2013 appearing on several local stages and is currently playing Ma at Olney Theatre. Claire has her MFA in classical acting from GWU. 

 

 

 

 

Bill Weeden

Bill Weeden plays Assistant Principal Leslie Klemmer in the go90 high school comedy series "Mr. Student Body President," for which he won a 2017 Streamy award as part of the "Best Ensemble." Weeden is a Broadway songwriter, a multi-award-winning cabaret performer, and a purveyor of corporate entertainment who has been profiled on NBC's "Today" and the front page of The Wall Street Journal. He is prominently featured on several successful comedy videos from Upright Citizens Brigade and Lorne Michaels's Above Average. Weeden played Hucklebee, the boy's father, in the final cast of "The Fantasticks" at the Sullivan Street Playhouse. He has done Shakespeare, Chekhov, Aeschylus, Shepard, Miller, Guare, Ibsen, the two "horror" musicals ("Little Shop" and "Rocky"), and many other stage ventures both straight and musical. He stars in the Troma cult film classic "Sgt. Kabukiman N.Y.P.D."  He is the co-creator (with David Finkle and Sally Fay) of "Move It and It's Yours," a musical which has received acclaim and awards in regional theater. For Theatreworks/USA he composed and co-wrote (also with Finkle and Fay) a 1996 musical based on the Babar stories.


 

Susan Lynskey

Susan is an actress known for National Treasure: Book of Secrets (2007), Homicide: Life on the Street (1993) and Crazy Like a Fox (2004).  She has a master's in acting from the University of Iowa.  

 

 

 

 

 

 

Chris Walker

Christopher Crutchfield Walker is an actor known for The Wire, Veep, House of Cards, NBC's Enemy Within and the upcoming Netflix series Living with Yourself starring Paul Rudd.  He is also an accomplished voice over and stage performer.

 

 

 

 

 

If you've had the opportunity to watch season one then we hope you're hooked on the series and dying to see more.  If so, this is how we do it.  While we would love a major studio like Amazon or Netflix to finance the show, the realities of the industry make that possibility a real long shot.  Rather than wait, we just want to get the work done ourselves and tell the story we're dying to tell. We hope that after you watch the trailer you'll see that the stuff we've shot so far  for season two is pretty darn incredible.   Some of the most highly regarded crew in the region have offered us their time and equipment at a fraction of their normal rate and, of course, the cast is spectacular and everyone works hard because we're all in love with the characters and thrilled by the response from our growing audience.   We plan to deliver another 8 episode season that's extremely funny, poignant and keeps you wanting to watch more.  It's Baltimore's own BINGE show and we hope you can help us make it happen.  

Every dollar we receive goes directly into the production and, to complete all eight episodes, we're looking at about a 30 day shoot.  So to get to the finish line, we expect to spend around $1000 a day- twice last year's daily budget. Because of our growing reputation as a quality show with high production values,  experienced crew have offered their services at a greatly reduced rate.  Still, they have to make something, right?  Working on a film crew is tough.  A lot of lifting, a lot of sweating and a lot of planning.   The $30,000 we're looking for will allow us to dramatically up our production game and give us access to a much higher quality camera (Canon C300 mkii for you gear heads) than anything we used last season, Zeiss prime lenses, improved sound equipment (we'll actually have TWO lavaliers! Maybe more... yay!) and a state of the art monitor so we can actually see what's happening in front of the camera.  Pretty exciting.

Without the seriously "thank you so much, guys" financial break we've been offered by cast, crew and equipment rental company, this number could easily be around A HUNDRED GRAND. So to be able to deliver what we plan to for $30,000 is amazing and will go a long way towards showing the world that truly great tv shows and films can originate and be produced in smaller markets like Baltimore, DC and Virginia.  We didn't want to bore you with some arbitrary pie chart thing but here's EXACTLY where your contribution will go:

EQUIPMENT RENTAL.... This will likely cost us around $375 a day for camera, lenses and monitor (a crazy good bargain considering what we're getting) but we may occasionally want something a bit more exotic for a cool crane shot or a special light.

CREW PAYROLL...  Right now it looks like our crew is working for a total of around $350-450 a day... again, THANK YOU, THANK YOU, THANK  YOU.

FOOD...  We don't have the budget for a craft services spread  complete with omelette station but bagels and coffee in the morning and some decent sandwiches or salads for lunch are what we shoot for.  Oh, and lots of water and snacks throughout the day.  About $150 or so a day should do it.

MISCELLANEOUS- Hard to say... could be an actor travelling up from New York or, who knows? Tennessee, maybe?  Or props we need to buy or maybe a location we can't get for free.  Hard to budget for this but we'll definitely need some extra at some point.

So, as you can see,  trying to make this for $1000 a day is going to be tough but if we can get to $30,000+  we know we'll have the resources to get the show finished and released. AND EVERY DOLLAR HELPS!

Even if you're not able to make a financial contribution there are still many ways you can help!  Let your family and friends know about the project and send them this campaign using the Indiegogo share option.  Post it on Facebook, Twitter and anywhere else you can think of.  Or if you have access to an interesting, unique location maybe it's a place we can shoot.  Or maybe you just want to work as a production assistant on the project.  Whatever help you can offer would be immensely appreciated.

story:
Short Summary

Abraham Stern and Raquel Serebrenik are two Colombians who met at the Savannah College of Art and Design in 2012. It struck a nerve on them when they discussed how little exposure there is for artists and cultural initiatives, yet, they play a strong part in the economy of most countries: inspiring innovation and driving tourism.

'Revival Cities: The Series' is a platform for game-changing artists and cultural initiatives in emerging art-cities, contributing to the growth and rebirth of these metropolis. Our goal is to show why these places matter, and how all the new developing business opportunities available, are helping entire communities reach their full potential.

For our first season, we will travel to Bogota, Melbourne, Seoul, Mumbai and Johannesburg to discover the people and places at the center of the cultural boom in these areas.

To make it a reality we will need:

This is an ambitious project, with the goal to reach USD$120,000, We are looking to create the highest quality production possible, with the best resources available to give these Revival Cities, the platform they deserve.

Here is a breakdown of the resources distribution:

  • Equipment rental:  Two cameras, two microphones, lighting for inside and outside as well as memory space.
  • Travel expenses for a team of 4: flights, accommodations, insurance, transportation, food.
  • Production team salaries: Four staff members including a producer, a director, a camera operator, a sound person (and a translator when needed).
  • Post- production: Editing, sound design, motion graphics, and translation if needed.
  • Marketing and advertising: distribution, branding and promotion.

We are conscious that your kind contribution without benefits wouldn't be as fun. This is why we have created special perks to make this project meaningful for you, our supporter! From being credited in every episode, to owning a copy of 'The Series' and it's soundtrack, and having the chance to attend the special events Revival Cities organizes all over the world, and attending the big premiere. Get ready!

In case this campaign doesn't reach it's entire goal, we will work our best to adapt the series to the resources available, we believe this project is worth the hard work, and that it will have a powerful effect on thousands of cultural entrepreneurs and citizens all over the world.

 

The Impact

'The Series' is the starting point for Revival Cities. Our long term vision is to transform the world into a place where real growth opportunity can be found anywhere. From our personal experience, like many other young professionals, we grew the need to move to New York City. However, as we realized the immense potential Revival Cities have, we couldn’t help but wonder all the opportunities available that we were missing out on.

We want the “New York” effect to be available in more areas of the world and see how the uniqueness of each emerging art-capital can lead us into a better future.

 

Risks & Challenges

Like any dream, challenges are part of the journey. Nevertheless, we are ready to face them and learn from them. A few of the concerns that might arise are:

  • We didn’t achieve the budget goal: If this is the case, we will continue to fundraise and adjust to the available budget the best way possible.
  • ‘The Series’ doesn’t get picked up by a streaming service: We will use YouTube or YouTube Red as an alternative to showcase the production as well as participate on film and television festivals.

Other Ways You Can Help

Money plays a big part on creating 'Revival Cities: The Series', but it is not the only way to support the project, this is what you can do:

  • Help us make noise about this campaign and 'The Series'.
  • Talk to your friends and family about it.
  • Share the campaign on social media by clicking on the share buttons.
  • Watch the pilot episode on our youtube channel, and share it with the world.
  • Contact us on our website if you have any great ideas about it.

The Leaders

Raquel Serebrenik

Born in Bogotá, Colombia, Raquel Serebrenik Sultan is a professional in Arts and Cultural Project Management, Development and Innovation. Serebrenik has worked with cultural institutions around the world such as MAMBO, The Guggenheim Museum and The National Gallery of Art to promote art history, as well as modern and contemporary art.

As Co-Founder and Executive Director of Revival Cities, Raquel has become key on connecting art markets from all over the world and in the development of new and exciting ideas that are bringing awareness to emerging art cities.

Abi Stern

Abraham (Abi) Stern Hirschberg is a Colombian Motion Designer, Video Creator and Music Maker. He is a business minded artist who engages in projects around the world for the music, fashion and advertising industries.

As Co-Founder of Revival Cities and Director of the Media Division, Abi leads a team of talented creators that work together to develop 'The Series', and new marketing solutions to connect emerging art cities and give them a spotlight.

 

Thank you for your attention and help!
We are beyond grateful.

For more information on the team and the project, go to our website: www.revivalcities.com
story_txt:
Short Summary
Abraham Stern and Raquel Serebrenik are two Colombians who met at the Savannah College of Art and Design in 2012. It struck a nerve on them when they discussed how little exposure there is for artists and cultural initiatives, yet, they play a strong part in the economy of most countries: inspiring innovation and driving tourism.
'Revival Cities: The Series' is a platform for game-changing artists and cultural initiatives in emerging art-cities, contributing to the growth and rebirth of these metropolis. Our goal is to show why these places matter, and how all the new developing business opportunities available, are helping entire communities reach their full potential.
For our first season, we will travel to Bogota, Melbourne, Seoul, Mumbai and Johannesburg to discover the people and places at the center of the cultural boom in these areas.

To make it a reality we will need:
This is an ambitious project, with the goal to reach USD$120,000, We are looking to create the highest quality production possible, with the best resources available to give these Revival Cities, the platform they deserve.
Here is a breakdown of the resources distribution:



Equipment rental:  Two cameras, two microphones, lighting for inside and outside as well as memory space.

Travel expenses for a team of 4: flights, accommodations, insurance, transportation, food.

Production team salaries: Four staff members including a producer, a director, a camera operator, a sound person (and a translator when needed).

Post- production: Editing, sound design, motion graphics, and translation if needed.

Marketing and advertising: distribution, branding and promotion.

We are conscious that your kind contribution without benefits wouldn't be as fun. This is why we have created special perks to make this project meaningful for you, our supporter! From being credited in every episode, to owning a copy of 'The Series' and it's soundtrack, and having the chance to attend the special events Revival Cities organizes all over the world, and attending the big premiere. Get ready!
In case this campaign doesn't reach it's entire goal, we will work our best to adapt the series to the resources available, we believe this project is worth the hard work, and that it will have a powerful effect on thousands of cultural entrepreneurs and citizens all over the world.
 

The Impact
'The Series' is the starting point for Revival Cities. Our long term vision is to transform the world into a place where real growth opportunity can be found anywhere. From our personal experience, like many other young professionals, we grew the need to move to New York City. However, as we realized the immense potential Revival Cities have, we couldn’t help but wonder all the opportunities available that we were missing out on.
We want the “New York” effect to be available in more areas of the world and see how the uniqueness of each emerging art-capital can lead us into a better future.

We didn’t achieve the budget goal: If this is the case, we will continue to fundraise and adjust to the available budget the best way possible.

story:
SoCal Wanderer takes you to Southern California’s hidden gems and wonders, exploring the rich history, culture and landscape of the region

Over the last five years, we’ve taken you off the beaten path with fun and insightful guides and videos, revealing the true essence of our region in ways that can’t be captured in a traditional guidebook. We’ve explored everything from Joshua Tree’s lesser-known hikes to Downtown LA’s most historic hotels.

With your support, SoCal Wanderer will produce a digital episode and interactive guide that showcases the hidden beauty of the LA River

New York has the High Line. San Antonio has its River Walk. Every major city has found a way to reclaim a forgotten urban space, turning it into a welcome paradise for its residents. Now, Los Angeles is on its way to doing the same, transforming its signature waterway, the Los Angeles River, into a 51-mile continuous waterway that would connect the neighborhoods of Los Angeles from the San Fernando Valley all the way to Long Beach.

Join host Rosey Alvero on her latest SoCal adventure!

Here’s what we have planned for the LA River digital episode:

We start the day at a riverside bicycle café. SoCal Wanderer host Rosey Alvero meets up with a river advocate to learn about the river’s history and future.

We wade into the water and learn the art of fly fishing with a local enthusiast.

Rosey visits a local restaurant and gets to take a look behind the counter. We meet with a local artist to learn about the rich arts culture along the river.

Finally we tour the river’s bridges, old and new, and learn from a city planner about their preservation and future.

See a Los Angeles you never knew existed with our interactive guide

SoCal Wanderer’s interactive LA River guide will be a multi-part series exploring the many aspects of the city’s historic waterway, from the best food along the River to the unusual wildlife experiences on the water. Make the most of Los Angeles life by getting to know this integral part of the city’s urban landscape.

We can't do this project without your participation

KCET is a nonprofit. We have a lot of experience with delivering great quality on a tight budget. Your support will go a long way with SoCal Wanderer. The money we raise here will go toward:

  • Hiring a Director of Photography and Sound Recordist for the episode
  • Post-production
  • Developing the interactive guide

We're offering unique perks, like Rosey's vintage motorcycle sidecar tour of Venice and a set of iconic LA buttons

All of the experience perks are limited in number and the gear is exclusive to this campaign and features original artwork. Every tier comes with early access to the episode and guide.

$15 "The Mojave Freeway" - Early access to the episode and guide.

$22 "The Garden Grove Freeway" - SoCal Wanderer's exclusive Great Blue Heron enamel pin + early access.

$39 "Beach Boulevard" - Set of 5 colorful buttons featuring original artwork of iconic LA landmarks + all of the above perks.

$66 "Route 66" - SoCal Wanderer's LA River T-shirt featuring original artwork + all of the above perks.

$101 "The Hollywood Freeway" - A guided walking tour of historical Downtown LA for two people, provided by Nobody Walks in LA. Led by a CSULB professor, this unique walking tour provides a link between local history and community. You also get the T-shirt, the buttons, the enamel pin and early access. (Limit 8)

$110 "The Harbor Freeway" - Discover Los Angeles like nobody else, cruising with a friend in a vintage motorcycle sidecar updated with the latest tech for a safe and comfortable ride. Rosey's own company, CoPilot Rides, is offering this personally curated 2-hour tour from Mar Vista to Marina Del Rey and Venice, ending at a scenic overlook only true locals know about! You also get the T-shirt, the buttons, the enamel pin and early access. (Limit 5)

$210 "The Foothill Freeway" - Meet Rosey at Escondido Falls in the Santa Monica Mountains as you and a friend are invited to join a half-day hiking excursion with SoCal Wanderer's host as your guide. You also get the T-shirt, the buttons, the enamel pin and early access. (Limit 10)

$405 "The San Diego Freeway" - A special kayaking trip for two people from LA River Kayak Safari, which includes a bike ride, river lore and a downstream paddle that is fun, challenging and resplendent with wildlife. You also get the T-shirt, the buttons, the enamel pin and early access. (Limit 10)

$500 "The Golden State Freeway" - Your name will be in the credits of the SoCal Wanderer LA River digital episode. You also get the T-shirt, the buttons, the enamel pin and early access. (Limit 4)

About Rosey Alvero

Rosey is always the curious adventurer up for any quest and seeks to learn from and empower those she meets on her travels. Growing up between San Francisco and Manila, she has since lived all over the world and thus developed a traveler’s intuition and sense of curiosity. She is a co-founder of Cache Cache, a female-driven culinary and moving image centered experiential concept, a result of her belief that food and travel can bring people together. Over the past decade, she has taken her skills to professional kitchens across the globe with extended stays in New York, Paris, Brussels, Manila, and San Francisco. She is thrilled to explore the Los Angeles region as the face of SoCal Wanderer for KCET.

    Check out our first episode, Anacapa to Ojai to see where Rosey’s SoCal adventures began

    In SoCal Wanderer’s Anacapa to Ojai, Rosey takes a ferry to Anacapa Island and learns about the fascinating history and ecology of Channel Islands National Park. She then visits the Ventura Harbor before biking into Ojai for dinner and finishes the night stargazing at Thatcher Observatory.

    You can explore some of SoCal Wanderer’s other guides and articles here. We’ve covered everything from coastal hikes and California dunes to fast food and historical landmarks.

    Please contribute to our project to help SoCal Wanderer explore and highlight the revitalized LA River 

    KCET has played an important role in the educational and cultural enrichment of Southern and Central California for over 50 years. We’re a nonprofit with a proven track record serving the public. SoCal Wanderer’s River project has the potential to share a lot of positive developments taking place around the LA River and to make a difference in our community.

    Thank you for your support!

    Please spread the word and share the campaign with your friends and family.

Please contribute to our project to help SoCal Wanderer explore and highlight the revitalized LA River 
KCET has played an important role in the educational and cultural enrichment of Southern and Central California for over 50 years. We’re a nonprofit with a proven track record serving the public. Thank you for your support!
Please spread the word and share the campaign with your friends and family.

story:
PROJECT VISION.

The pandemic before us has brought new meaning to the slogan, “We’re number one!” As the U.S. claims the world's highest COVID-19 death toll, America is top in all the wrong categories. This public health emergency has shined a harsh light on the longstanding systemic disparities that have made some individuals more vulnerable to the consequences of this virus than others. 

Believers in the myth of “American exceptionalism” embrace the virtues of liberty and justice for all — except for some. It’s a perspective that says it’s not me or anyone I know so I don’t care — a should-have-been moral imperative substituted with a shield of afflicted pride. Or, in other cases, complete unadulterated ignorance. But the disproportionate suffering of our fellow Americans is real no matter how tight we squeeze our eyes shut. 

This crisis compels each of us to use our talents and abilities to fight for good and that’s why I’m asking for your help to get this documentary series off the ground. American Exceptionalism will capture the stories of the pandemic that aren’t getting the attention they deserve and amplify the voices of those who have been hardest hit by COVID-19 due to enduring inequality.

The series will document sorrows and struggles — yes — but also the joys and perseverance of people who are really going through it right now. Stories have incredible power to cultivate empathy through acquired relatability. Contingent upon the resources made available by this campaign, here are a few episode issues I’d love to address:

  • Restricted access to health care for individuals who are transgender or non-binary;
  • Impacts of tribal casino closures on the livelihood of Native American communities;
  • Challenges of remote learning faced by students with disabilities and their families;
  • Exacerbation of the Black maternal health and mortality crisis; 
  • Plight of migrant farm workers sacrificing their lives for their livelihoods;
  • Struggles of domestic workers who are unemployed and underemployed, lacking health care, and vulnerable to exposure;
  • Racist aggression faced by Asian Americans;
  • Toll on gig economy workers with little access to unemployment benefits, health insurance, and paid sick leave.
  • As a documentary-style video producer, I’m granted the opportunity to learn first-hand from people who aren’t afforded the same privilege as I am and are generous enough to share their lived experience with not just me, but the world. I feel passionately about my craft because it enables me to honor the perspectives I seek to elevate in the most honest and clear manner possible. My ultimate intent is to raise awareness of the issues that are causing deep harm to many of our fellow Americans and to inspire real and meaningful change for those who’ve been hardest hit. 

 

SAFETY PRECAUTIONS. 

Production will adhere to a strict set of guidelines designed to ensure the safety of video producers, crew, and subjects:

  • Travel will be limited to sites that can be reached by car to avoid planes and other forms of transportation that increase exposure to a greater number of humans;
  • Production technique will make use of zoom lenses, boom mics, and gear that enables as much social distance as possible;
  • Masks and gloves will be utilized by producers and crew 100% — no exceptions;
  • Where subjects are being filmed without a mask, a plexiglass barrier will act as a physical shield between producer and subject;
  • Barbicide, which is EPA approved for efficacy against COVID-19 will be applied to all production tools before and after shooting. 

 

ABOUT THE PRODUCER.

Hi, Kat here. I’m a video producer who gives a damn about our country and making it a better place for all, for generations to come. I’ve spent the majority of my career in politics helping to amplify the work of leaders and organizations full of big brains and big hearts who sincerely care about people — Beto O'Rourke’s presidential campaign, the Democratic National Committee, Speaker Nancy Pelosi, and the Democratic Caucus among others. A few years ago I followed my love of storytelling and opened my own video shop. I’ve always hated those candidate commercials with scripted lines, cheesy backdrops, and fake actors … which is why I’ve worked to defy the traditional look and feel of campaign ads — utilizing documentary storytelling to capture the lives of real people where they live, work, and pray with the intent to inform, inspire empathy, and provoke a drive to fight for change. 

And now? With your help, I intend to tackle this new project with everything I’ve got. My ultimate intent is to raise awareness of the issues that are causing deep harm to many of our fellow Americans and to inspire real and meaningful change for those who’ve been hardest hit. 

So, please donate if you can and — this is important — share this IndieGoGo campaign with all of your friends and family on social media. I can’t do this without you and am beyond grateful for your support. 

 

Kat Skiles, CEO & Producer, Narrative Creative Agency:

  • Create & Cultivate's 7 Boss Female Hill Staffers
  • National Journal’s 20 Most Powerful Women Staffers on Capitol Hill 
  • Washington Blade’s Best LGBT Hill Staffer 
  • Washington City Paper’s Best Gay Activist
  • Washingtonian's 100 Most Powerful Women in DC

Dear Friends, Family, acquaintances and complete strangers,

My name is Elena Lockleis and I am the writer/director of "Almost."

So far, the Pilot script has placed as a finalist in two competitions and is currently a finalist in a 3rd.

The teaser trailer has won 4 best trailer awards and 1 award of recognition. It also screened last month during the Golden State Film Festival held at the TCL Chinese Theatres and has just been accepted to screen at another festival in September.

It's exciting that both the script and the teaser trailer are being seen and enjoyed.

Then I read an interview with a Showrunner who created a shortened version of a pilot she wrote and it helped open up doors and got the show off the ground.

Extra inspired by that, here we are. I have a female led team of talented and enthusiastic cast and crew that believe in this story and are ready to bring it to life.

Whatever amount you are able to contribute, we will forever be grateful for your support.

Series Logline:

After a sorority legacy named Jenn unexpectedly loses her mother, her dream of just getting through the rest of college is derailed when one of her sorority sisters says she’s stuck between heaven and hell and needs her help to complete the Young Dead Acceptance Program so she can move on.

Short Summary:

On the outside, the Beta Kappa Theta sorority is picture perfect. Shelby Caldwell, the president of the sorority, makes sure of that. But within, contracts swear members to secrecy, rule-breaking is met with dire consequences and hazing rituals turn life threatening.

Against the sorority rule book, Shelby started a relationship with a pledge named Kenzie and during an argument about going public, things accidentally turn fatal.

Kenzie is now a member of the Young Dead Support Group (YDSG). Separated by age, this is the one for young adults. It’s where souls get placed if  “the light” decides they’re not ready to fully experience the afterlife. The group is dedicated to helping them figure out what they need to do in order to move on and keep them on track.

Not everyone stuck in limbo has someone on Earth they can still talk to. But Kenzie's able to still have a voice through Jenn.

Kenzie convinces Jenn to help right her biggest regrets and in return promises to become Jenn's "guardian angel."

But the deeper Jenn dives, the more she feels like someone is watching her every move. And when her life only gets more complicated, she questions if letting Kenzie in was the right choice and how to get out of it.

There are some real horror stories about living in the Greek Life world and college doesn’t end up being the best for everyone. It would be interesting to take a dark spin; being able to dive deep and spark conversation.

This series aims to dive into to topics such as loss, grief, sexuality, peer pressure and different aspects of mental health while also exploring what it means to love, heal, and live with hope at the forefront.

Ultimately, I envision "Almost" to be an 8-10 episode Mini Series.

Also, even in this condensed version of the pilot, you will get to meet more of the recurring characters.

What we need:

We are looking to raise $24,000 to help fund a broadcast quality pilot presentation. All funds raised will go directly to production and post production expenses.

  • Expenses:
    • Cast and Crew
    • Production: Locations,  Equipment, Set Decor, Catering.
    • Post Production: Editing, Sound Design, Score
  • Anything we raise over $24,000 will go towards making this an even stronger piece. Whether that's upgrading equipment, an extra helping hand on set, or even getting to build another custom set to explore in, every cent will be put to good use.

Perks:

We have a variety of perk packages to offer as a thank you for your contribution. Exclusive "Almost" items start from just $10.

You can also donate any amount by clicking "Back it",  located above the first perk.

All backers, no matter the contribution size, will receive an early access link to the finished project.

Stay tuned for updates as we keep moving forward! Including the official designs for some of the perk items :)

Feel free to reach out with any questions and thank you again for your support!

Including the official designs for some of the perk items :)Feel free to reach out with any questions and thank you again for your support!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Craig McFarlane and I'm someone who likes to go outside their comfort zone. I didn't just want to be all talk either, I wanted to show people and encourage them to try something new. So for "Craig Tries", I am getting the opportunity to experience lifelong dreams of playing drums and learning magic, to see how I would do as a boxer and as a model. I'll be baking and eating things I've never tried before. 

Is There A Pilot?

Yes we've released the first episode already so you have an idea of what we're doing:

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

It costs money to try things and to have someone there to film it. That's why we need your assistance in helping cover the costs of the fantastic director, Brandon Wilson, as he films and edits it all. We also need the help with advertisement and certain experiences. As it's a documentary series, we don't have much to offer prop wise or set, but we've come up with a few fun perks. These include socks from Calgary based company, Plainsbreaker Apparel, as well as hoodies. And just for contributing, we will be giving you lots of love on our social media!

The Impact

Why this series? Why now? Well "Craig Tries" is something I've had in my back pocket for a few years. I lost my mom to cancer when I was 10 and she was 40. Now turning 30 this past year in the middle of a pandemic, I was reminded how quickly our lives can go by. I wanted to do all those things I've always wanted to try, such as boxing or an insane burger challenge. I may not be good or able to complete it, but I'm going to try! This was my chance to go outside my comfort zone and let others see how easy it can be to try something new. Not only that, "Craig Tries" gives businesses and performers a chance to showcase their work and how we can go about doing things in a safe way.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

This has been a tough year. I get it. Maybe it doesn't make sense for you to donate to a web series where a guy can make a fool of himself. So other ways you can help is SHARE, SHARE, SHARE! Let your friends and family know about "Craig Tries" and maybe somebody can contribute. Watch our pilot "Craig Tries: Drumming". And of course, share with Cher. She would love this show and I'm sure she'd like to contribute.

story:
Pro Wrestling's Paradigm Shift

Since 2017, Paradigm Pro Wrestling has produced professional wrestling content that focuses on a variety of different styles and showcases a talented and diverse roster. The COVID-19 pandemic has made it difficult to impossible to produce shows with fans in attendance, so we are shifting to episodic content filmed in an empty arena in order to keep our talent working. 

  • Paradigm Pro Wrestling is a truly independent operation with no outside funding. 95% of our revenue is traditionally generated through ticket sales, so we're exploring alternative methods of raising funds in order to keep our our roster working. 
  • All episodes filmed will be aired on IndependentWrestling.TV - we are creating additional content for our "No Hook" and "UWFi Contenders" series of programming. 
  • All proceeds generated from this campaign will go towards the locker room, helping talented wrestlers generate income during a time which their work has largely dried up.

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are looking to raise $2,000 to $5,000 to fund these tapings. All proceeds generated will go towards paying our locker-room a fair rate for their time and efforts.
  • Our management staff is volunteering their time for these tapings, and Paradigm Pro is covering all other overhead expenses such as production and venue rental fees. 
  • We will be filming new episodes of "PPW No Hook" - an experimental blend of hip-hop culture and professional wrestling that pushes the boundaries of how pro wrestling is presented.
  • We will be filming new episodes of "PPW UWFi Rules Contenders" - a unique sports-centric format that highlights Japanese-inspired shoot-style professional wrestling.
  • In return for your contributions, we can offer a unique and exciting set of "Perks" including exclusive content, credits in the show, tickets to future events (when we can have fans agains), sponsorships, and more. 

 

The Impact

Here's how your contribution will help us:

  • Allows us to provide income to a workforce that has been hurt by the COVID-19 pandemic.
  • Allows us to spotlight a diverse roster - including minority and LGBTQ wrestlers who have often been unfairly overlooked by mainstream professional wrestling. 
  • Allows us to continue innovating and create new professional wrestling content.  

 

Risks & Challenges

  • Filming during the COVID-19 Pandemic is difficult. We have an extensive safety plan and protocols in places to provide a safe space for our talent to excel. 
  • Cards and advertised match-ups are subject to change (even more so than normal in professional wrestling) as COVID-19 protocols often force us to make 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't contribute - we would still love your help! 

  • Share this campaign on Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter.
  • Watch our archival content on IndependentWrestling.TV.
  • Pick up a t-shirt at WhataManeuver.net

story:
Summary

PRIMECom Corporation is a Canadian Radio-Television Telecommunication Commission (CRTC) certified production , media and advertising company based in Saskatoon, Saskatchewan, Canada. We produced content for OMNI TV (a Rogers Company), Shaw Spotlights (formerly Shaw Community TV) and Filipino TV (FTV) for several years already. Our production team is composed of Filipino-Canadians who are entrepreneurs and also practicing professionals in Engineering, Health and Real Estate and Media Industry.

In our desire to create more content and fill up the time slots offered to us by our TV network affiliates, we contacted Dante Nico Garcia, a Filipino filmmaker whose first film, Ploning, became the entry the Philippines for the 81st Oscar Awards. Dante has been an advocate of films and content that promote the beauty of the Philippines and the talent of the Filipinos, waiting for the perfect partners to help him produce all the film and television show concepts he has developed through the years. We feel that this is the best time for Filipinos and people who care for the Filipinos, to come together and not only create content that entertain and educate, but also support good causes with every season produced. 

What We Need & What You Get

The funds that we are raising will be used to jumpstart production and create pitch videos so that we can start selling our shows lined-up for 2021 to brands and organizations.

As our valued supporters, we offer the following perks based on the amount that you contribute.

Gold Category: CAD$ 1000 (reduced from $1500)   Qty: 3(max)

  • Co-Producer credit in one season of TV Series.
  • Producer credit in one season of a YouTube show.
  • Solo ‘Thank you’ post in our Facebook Page.
  • Greetings by one of our puppets within a YouTube Video.
  • Greetings by one of our puppets within a Facebook Live session.
  • ‘Thank you’ post in our Instagram Stories

Silver Category: CAD$ 750 (reduced from $1000) Qty: 6 (max)

  • Co-Producer credit in one season of TV Series
  • Producer credit in one of our YouTube Videos.
  • Solo ‘Thank you’ post in our Facebook Page.
  • Greetings by one of our puppets within a YouTube Video.
  • Greetings by one of our puppets within a Facebook Live session.
  • ‘Thank you’ post in our Instagram Stories.

Bronze Category: CAD$ 500 (reduced from $750) Qty: 12 (max)

  • Co-Producer credit in one episode of TV Series
  • Co-Producer credit in one of our YouTube Videos.
  • Solo ‘Thank you’ post in our Facebook Page.
  • Greetings by one of our puppets within a YouTube Video.
  • Greetings by one of our puppets within a Facebook Live session.
  • ‘Thank you’ post in our Instagram Stories.

CAD$ 150

  • Co-Producer credit in one of our YouTube Videos.
  • Solo ‘Thank you’ post in our Facebook Page.
  • Greetings by one of our puppets within a YouTube Video.
  • Greetings by one of our puppets within a Facebook Live session.
  • ‘Thank you’ post in our Instagram Stories.

CAD$ 100 

  • Solo ‘Thank you’ post in our Facebook Page.
  • Greetings by one of our puppets within a YouTube Video.
  • Greetings by one of our puppets within a Facebook Live session.
  • ‘Thank you’ post in our Instagram Stories.

CAD$ 70

  • Greetings by one of our puppets within a YouTube Video.
  • Greetings by one of our puppets within a Facebook Live session.
  • Thank you’ post in our Facebook Page.
  • ‘Thank you’ post in our Instagram Stories

CAD$ 30

  • Greetings by one of our puppets within a Facebook Live session.
  • Thank you’ post in our Facebook Page.
  • ‘Thank you’ post in our Instagram Stories

CAD$ 15

  • ‘Thank you’ post in our Facebook Page.
  • ‘Thank you’ post in our Instagram Stories.

CAD$ 7

  • ‘Thank you’ post in our Instagram Stories.

The Impact

If the FilipiNow brand of content becomes a staple in Filipino homes all over the world, parents need not worry anymore about their children losing their Filipino identity.

Risks & Challenges

The risk is more on the idea that if we don't pursue this advocacy, today's children that are born and raised away from the Philippines, and the ones quarantined indefinitely in their homes, will develop identities according to the content they consume.

How to sustain the quality of the content produced in connection to the demand to make every content relevant to every Filipino anywhere in the world will be the biggest challenge once this advocacy has started.

story:
Short Summary

  • Hi, we're Thomas Dagnino and Michael Sidisin Jr creators of the revolutionary web series Lil' Bobby and the Juice. We've been working together for over 25 years producing film, music and television.
  • This campaign is extremely important to us because it's our most ambitious project to date and it enables us to express the full spectrum of our creativity. 
  • We firmly believe we have an original, one of a kind supershow and with this campaign we hope to grow and nurture our brand while bringing you epic content in a more timely fashion.

What We Need & What You Get

We're looking for 20K for studio rental, audio, audio mix, lighting, stages, set pieces, VO talent, cameras, action figures, 3D printing, merchandising, marketing, advertising and most importantly fuel for Lil' Bobby And The Juice Season II / Lil'Bobby And The Juice After Show / Lil'Bobby And The Juice Podcast / Lil' Bobby And The Juice Record / Lil' Bobby And The Juice Comic Book and our Lil' Bobby And The Juice Full Length Feature Film. 

  • Some of the Perks we've implemented are for fans and aspiring creatives to get their work out there in the public sphere for tastemakers and influencers to see. If you're a writer, voice actor, musician, designer,  etc... we're offering you a vehicle to get noticed.
  •  This is a flexible campaign so all the money raised will be used to further grow the Lil' Bobby And The Juice Brand.  

The Impact

  • Lil' Bobby And The Juice is a blueprint for aspiring creatives and the first show of its kind to offer this level of fan collaboration and participation. 
  • We already have (3) successful episodes airing on Youtube as we speak. The proof is in the pudding. This show keeps getting better and with your help it'll go down in history as one of the greatest web series ever created!

Risks & Challenges

  • Where there's risk there's always great reward!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Financial restrictions can hamstring the best of us. All we ask is if you love the show to please spread the word. Subscribe to the Youtube channel and tell all of your friends about this campaign. 
  • Thank you for watching!

story:
Short Summary

Southport is a project created by Chris Hollenbeck, Arthur Payne, & Luke Kenin. We are students in our last semesters at Columbia College Chicago. Southport is a Web Series concept about a group of young adults on the North Side of Chicago and the struggles they go through on a day to day basis in order to get by. The idea is based on real life experiences and anecdotes about our experiences in Chicago. As all of us are phasing out of our college years, we're using this project to reflect on where we've been and how we've felt and want to share it with all of you, and by reaching our goal we can make that possible! If you support the arts and young people achieving their dreams, we'd love your help!

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal of $2200 will be going towards:

  • Permitting Locations
  • Providing food for hard working Cast & Crew
  • Equipment Rental 
  • Application fees for Festivals and Distribution 

What your Donation can get you:

  • $5 - Early viewing copy
  • $10 - Signed Photo, Thank you letter, & early viewing copy
  • $30 - Signed Script, invitation to viewing party, & all previous tiers
  • $75 - Signed Prop & all previous tiers
  • $150 - Associate Producer credit & all previous tiers
  • $300 - Executive Producer Credit, & tiers 1-4

We appreciate any & all that you can give!

The Impact

  • Helping Creative people jumpstart their careers and achieve their goals
  • Spreads a story that puts light on real struggles that young post-graduates face today both financially & emotionally
  • Spreads a Chicago story, that people who live here or have lived here will understand
  • The project even has the correct specs to potentially be on Netflix

Risks & Challenges

  • Our biggest challenge will be funding, and using that in the best way to create the best show we can
  • Another challenge we'll face is time constraints, the project will need to be completed this semester, but we have a team of student filmmaking experts who are willing to do whatever it takes to achieve this!
  •  Getting attention upon release is another challenge of independent filmmaking, but we're going to use all our sharing power and connections to draw people's attention..

Other Ways You Can Help

Understandably not everyone who sees this can donate money, but that's okay! Some other things you can do to help us out are:

  • Sharing this page on Social Media
  • telling friends or sharing the project upon its actual release

No matter what your contribution, we want to thank you for helping us get where we want to go!

story:
We invite you to: Time Travel with us to an Alternative History.

My name is Tom Howell and I'm the creator and star of Steampunked Stories.

I've been a filmmaker for over forty years with a Masters degree in film & video. I passionately believe in the power of my Facebook stories to make social media fun again.

I will reveal the amazing connections between steampunk themes and major events in history, finding a year's worth of captivating stories to tell.

But, if you’re like me, you find most history documentaries to be a bit dull. So I utilized my background of working on documentaries and web sites to make a Facebook series that entertains, while it educates.

My characters are Victorian and futuristic and their adventures race across the stage of world history, meeting Nostradamus, Tesla, magicians from Aliester Crowley to the high priests of ancient Atlantis. My crew and I travel aboard the Flying Capricorn, a cosmically equipped dirigiggle that serves as our home base.  My project is labor-intensive, involving many hours of altering my original photos using Adobe Photoshop.

We are so passionate about this series, we’ve already produced an animated pilot episode with limited funds. 

Watch the Pilot Episode here.

We've created storyboards on 4 more episodes. We also appreciate that through Indiegogo our audience is our producer. You will give us the support and creative freedom to create a steampunk series that is unique.


Here is our timeline for photographing the new episodes.


Your support will fund the production of Steampunked Stories. We’ve set our initial funding goal for four brand new episodes. We will also be doing some animation using Adobe AfterEffects software on the pilot episode. 
Our goal is to be able to produce four more episodes for a total of 12!

We’ll begin photography on episodes starting in June 2018, and will immediately start post-production with the goal of releasing an episode once per month during the 2019 season.

Our Pie Chart shows what percentage of funds raised will be spent on each episode.

Your support will fund the production of Steampunked Stories. We’ve set our initial funding goal for four brand new episodes. We will also be doing some animation using Adobe AfterEffects software on the pilot episode. Our goal is to be able to produce four more episodes for a total of 12!

We’ll begin photography on episodes starting in June 2018, and will immediately start post-production with the goal of releasing a episode once a month during the 2019 season.

  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

We've created storyboards on 4 more episodes. We also appreciate that through Indiegogo our audience is our producer. You will give us the support and creative freedom to create a steampunk series that is unique.

Here is our timeline for photographing the new episodes.
Your support will fund the production of Steampunked Stories. We’ve set our initial funding goal for four brand new episodes. We will also be doing some animation using Adobe AfterEffects software on the pilot episode. Our goal is to be able to produce four more episodes for a total of 12!
We’ll begin photography on episodes starting in June 2018, and will immediately start post-production with the goal of releasing an episode once per month during the 2019 season.

Our Pie Chart shows what percentage of funds raised will be spent on each episode.

Your support will fund the production of Steampunked Stories. We’ve set our initial funding goal for four brand new episodes. We will also be doing some animation using Adobe AfterEffects software on the pilot episode. Our goal is to be able to produce four more episodes for a total of 12!
We’ll begin photography on episodes starting in June 2018, and will immediately start post-production with the goal of releasing a episode once a month during the 2019 season.

Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
From “Sferomachia” of Ancient Greece to “Harpastum” of the Roman Empire, Calcio Storico Fiorentino is as connected to ancient florentine culture today as is the legacy of the Medici family, Leonardo Da Vinci and Europe’s renaissance period.

I present to you an explorative six-month web series created to understand the individuals that partake in this raw and unrestricted 50 minute battle of city districts.

To grow and take form, my project needs a little help because my intentions are to dig deep and answer questions like these:

  • Just how deep in heritage and tradition does this culture extend for these men, families and citizens to repeat this each year?
  • What are their roles in society and what is Florence’s perception of them?

PROJECT DESCRIPTION: 

As a culture curious Film Maker, I’m intrigued by certain individuals, in particular with people who master a physical art form by dedicating immense time, effort and passion towards it.

Calcio Storico Fiorentino is a physical art form like no other. In the context of limitless combat with no rules of engagement it combines rugby, american & australian football, verbal taunting and warlike strategy. But my intrigue with this sport, culture and tradition goes further than just the tournament. It extends to the individuals that partake in it on a yearly basis and how they deal with everything that surrounds them and their world. 

This documentary web series is the tool that I’ve chosen to explore the realities behind all this over the course of six months and answer further questions like these: 

  • Do they feel fear before entering the arena and how do they deal with it? 
  • Are they slaves to violence or national heroes?
  • How has this birthright shaped these mens world’s in the present day?

I’ve always believed there are two sides to every story. Nothing is purely black or white. We’ve seen so much on this sport’s brutality, action and glorified battles. Now, I’m going to take you on a journey to the other side.

            

The project will be named: The Bravest of Florence, and the souls behind the armour and will be distributed through the independent online platform:

-The View Spot-

Yes folks.

You won’t have to wait months for it to be released in an unknown cinema only to find it on DVD another 3 years later.

It will be online.

You will be notified.

And it will be beautiful.

HOW WILL THIS BE ACHIEVED? 

I have provisionally arranged the core team but with your help I will be able to confirm it and it will consist of me, (as Producer/Director), a Cinematographer and Assistant, an Editor, a Sound Technician and a Digital marketer.  We’re going to make sure you’re notified, hyped up and that it’s easy for you to watch while on the go, during your lunch break or after a long day while winding down on the couch.

Calcio Storico Fiorentino fever starts off with a preliminary game in February 2019 to kick things off and ends with the final match on the 24th June 2019 as in the schedule below. 

Throughout this period we are going to shoot and release episodes on a monthly basis from Florence, Italy. The team, schedule, workflow and budget has been structured to allow us to do this at an award winning standard. 

This series must therefore be shot and episodes released during this period for maximum emotional impact.

WHERE TO WATCH IT?

Watch the series directly on the homepage.

Check it out!

www.theviewspot.com

The average length of an episode will range from 10 – 20 minutes so as to easily be watched at any point in the day.

In order to keep things insightful but also entertaining I’d like to have a good mixture of the below shooting perspectives:

  • Accessing certain players of each team and represent each of their points of view and processes throughout the period.
  • Accessing certain players and each team’s training camps and understanding what they do to prepare for the battle. 
  • Covering the full spectrum of the sport, its culture, and the individuals, which represent the teams and support the players.

The challenge in doing this is that the rivalry between the teams can be fierce and to capture this type of content as outsiders without damaging relations is a delicate balance between us, the players and the association.

So unfortunately, because of this I’ll only be able to give a concrete shooting plan and episodes schedule closer to shooting.

But luckily this is where our digital marketer will come in, keeping all our viewers informed and up to date while we shoot! Woohoo!

Eventually, after an exciting journey with these guys in their preparations and life challenges what could be better than to view the "Calcio Fiorentino 2019" game LIVE?

Yes folks.

That will be our grand finale and brought straight to you!  

              
 

After the game, depending on our funding results, I’d like to screen some episodes of what happens after final and season are over. The more support from you, the more we can show you! 

FUNDING & REWARDS:

Keeping in mind that this project aims to be operated over the course of six months on a semi "LIVE" basis, the budget will cover the following: 

  • Hiring of the crew: cinematographer / editor / sound technician / digital marketer.
  • Shooting equipment and consumables.
  • Fees to shoot the players.
  • A fee to shoot the main tournament in June paid to the association. 
  • Accommodation & travel expenses.
  • Daily production & general expenses. 
  • Marketing and distribution expenses.
  • Musical rights. 
  • Insurance.

This first phase of funding allows the production to commence and complete the production half way. The next phase's goal will cover the remainder of the show as well as the finale. There is always the risk that the campaign won't hit it's goal. Should this happen I will evaluate what can be created with the funds raised and if that would be something engaging and of high quality. Alternatively if that's not possible, I will hold onto the funds, evaluate what can be improved and launch another campaign till I hit the target. 

As a financial participant in the show, I have provided a list of rewards, structured in a way to guarantee delivery even in the event of the worst unexpected scenarios as a gesture of gratitude for your participation! These rewards are of high value based on the exclusive access that will be gained through this show to a culture not always open to the public. 

Does this sound exciting or what??!

MOODBOARD:

 

 

A VERY BRIEF HISTORY ON THE SPORT AND CULTURE:   

As mentioned in the beginning, CALCIO STORICO FIORENTINO’S origins come from Ancient Greece in the form of the so called Sferomachia which the Romans eventually adopted and transformed into a new version called Harpastum.

Renowned personalities like Julius Caesar and his legionnaires played this game regularly as practice for battle and it was implemented as regular training of all Roman soldiers throughout the Roman Empire.

Eventually, the colony of Florentia was established by the same Roman legionnaires that practiced it regularly. This game then became an essential part of the Florentine culture and its name was changed to Calcio Fiorentino.

Most of this history can be found online and in the spirit of keeping things brief, please refer to the FAQ section for more historical information.

 

TOP 5 FUN FACTS OF THE GAME!

 

 

TEAMS

  • Four teams represent the four principle districts of Florence. Each district and team is named after the main cathedral and wears the representative color as follows: Santo Spirito (Whites) / Santa Maria Novella (Reds) / Santa Croce (Blues) / San Giovanni (Greens).

PLAYERS

  • Every year, each district has a camp of 50 competitors of which only 27 of the most skilled, strongest and bravest make it to the tournament. Not for the faint hearted. 

SUBSTITUTIONS

  • No substitutions are allowed at any time including if a player is so injured that he has to stop playing.

PRIZE MONEY

  • The only prize awarded is a sponsored dinner to the winning team that they enjoy battered and bruised after the game. Other than that it’s all honor and passion.

3 PROTECTIVE RULES (THE ONLY ONES)

These rules were created only recently to prevent malicious injury which used to happen in high frequency in previous years:

  • No striking an opponent from behind (striking refers to punches, kicks and similar tactics; rugby-style tackles are still permitted).
  • No striking an opponent who is already on the ground. You may pin somebody down, however.
  • No ganging up. If an opponent is already physically engaged with one of your teammates, you may not touch him unless he is carrying the ball.

 

WHO AM I AND WHAT HAS INSPIRED THIS PROJECT?

My name is Marcelo Miller and I am a South African Film Maker/Producer based in Berlin, Germany. I’m committed to cultural exploration with the hope that I can create entertainment that promotes understanding between otherwise polarized sub cultures.  

  

My other passion is MARTIAL ARTS and COMBAT SPORTS, which has been part of my life for 16 years now. I know that it takes an immense amount of motivation and control to reach the kind of level that these individuals commit themselves to every year. 

But I also know there’s another side to this.

It’s a side that we don’t see.

To achieve these levels of skill and greatness, one has to confront many aspects within, the biggest one being your own self.  

I find this topic fascinating and one can find it in various forms of physically enduring practices.

This is what led me to start THE VIEW SPOT, a media production company dedicated to this form of exploration. 

But hey, if you still don’t believe I’m a real person, check me out:

Personal website: www.marcelomiller.com

Company website: www.theviewspot.com

My Linkedin profile: https://www.linkedin.com/in/marcelo-miller-5a08a656

 

THE VIEW SPOT AND ITS MISSION

Since I’m result-driven, I’ll give you a brief introduction and then show you the results in the projects to come.

Sound good?

“The View Spot” is a film journal platform for internet explorers of the world to take a journey into the lives of some of the most passionate and dedicated human beings that have achieved some of the highest quality forms of physical and mental achievement, through martial, combat, performance arts and various other forms of physicality we can find.

Through exploring these individuals, we also uncover the traditional arts that these aspects of physicality connect to and how these ancient traditions are navigating in today’s modern world.

We strive to achieve this by exploring the individual in question and how what they do shapes their own existence.

***Website***

www.theviewspot.com

***Instagram***

https://www.instagram.com/theviewspot/

***Youtube***

https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCpUPB4xwvPmY89FxaSu1qIQ

Sound exciting?

Great!

Now let’s get to work!

And by the way: Don’t forget to back the project!

story:
Short Summary

Jordan O'Neal, life-long gamer, actor, and filmmaker fell in love with The Wolf Among Us during a time when many actors, like himself, were hungry for work telling stories they were passionate about. So he decided to create something himself. It's been 4 years since the first drafts of Fabletown were written and the Fabletown Pilot has received high praise from fans since its release last year. There will never be a Season 2 of The Wolf Among Us due to the abrupt shutdown of Telltale Games in 2018, but Fabletown is determined to be the best second-choice for old and new fans alike. Now we just need your help to get us over the finish line!

Fabletown EPISODE ONE [Our Town]

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

The entire team put their sweat, blood and tears into the production of the Pilot and the rest of Season One. Writer/Director/Producer Jordan O'Neal didn't make a penny off of bringing his vision to life, and, in fact, invested his own money to make sure filming was completed and every single member of the cast and crew were paid. He will not receive any of the funds donated here as profit for his work. Now it's up to the "Fabletown Faithful" to make sure the rest of this story is told properly.

We'll also be posting bonus videos including trailers, behind-the-scenes, cast interviews, and more!

Post-Production Budget Breakdown:

  • $3,000.00 will pay for the original score composed by award-winning Composer Brian Satterwhite known for his work on numerous documentaries, the Fabletown Pilot, and the soundtrack for Disney's The Lone Ranger.
  • $1,500.00 will pay for editing/assembly from our Editor Kory Hill who's most recent work on the short film Leecher earned several accolades from multiple film festivals.
  • $1,750.00 will pay for our Post-Sound Mixing from audio wizard Morgan Honaker who's work gave us great moments like the blood-curdling scream, mere moments into the Pilot.
  • Approximately $400.00 - $500.00 will go towards all the Visual Effects across the remaining 5 episodes being meticulously created by Justin R. Durban. When fantasy characters battle in the real, mundane world, magic and bullets are sure to fly.
  • The remaining $750.00 - $1000.00 will be put towards one day of shooting with a very cool scene that we can't give away due to spoilers, but will undoubtedly make fans go crazy!
  • If we reach our stretch goal of $10,000.00 then a previously cut sequence spread out across the entirety of Season One will have the funds to be shot, edited and put back into the story.

In exchange for your donations, you'll be rewarded with anything from a social media shoutout from a cast member, your name in the credits, signed copies of the Shooting Script, t-shirts, signed original artwork, and more!

The Impact

Fabletown is a story about the family you choose, about redemption, and about how the line that separates heroes and villains exists only through our actions and the choices we make. Our world isn't black-and-white, and neither are these characters.

Most of us grew up learning valuable lessons from fairytales and other stories. Whether it was through the books our parents read to us, the Disney animated film classics, or seeing the stories play out live before our eyes on a stage, everyone has a favorite among these timeless tales.

We've had people from all around the world reach out to us asking when they can see the next episode(s) of Fabletown. That power now rests in your hands. What will you do with it?

Risks & Challenges

Every member of our Post-Production team is working at a lower rate and all while managing their day-jobs simultaneously. They joined the team because they believe in the story we're telling, and they deserve to be compensated to literally bring magic to life.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're unable to help financially, you can do the following:

  • Share this campaign on Facebook and Like the Facebook page!
  • Subscribe to us on YouTube and share & watch the Pilot episode!
  • Follow us on Instagram and Twitter
  • Tell your parents, grandparents, cousins, roommates, and everyone else!

story:
In a Nutshell

On July 16th 2019, St. Louis director Cami Thomas and the FTCTV team are launching an Indigogo campaign to raise $10,000, with a stretch goal of $27,000. The funds will allow for the filming and editing of the third installment of the Smoke City docuseries, Smoke City: Ultimo, which will be a full-length film, as well as the production costs for Mexico-based documentary titled "Buenos Dias Tijuana".

What is Smoke City and Smoke City: Ultimo?

The Smoke City documentary series, by St. Louis director Cami Thomas, is a nationally-acclaimed deep-dive into St. Louis. The project covers life in St. Louis after the Ferguson uprising, as the city still struggles to have the conversations that has led to its repeated explosive socio-political moments. In the context of the United States in 2019, the series addresses St. Louis’, and society’s, hesitance to come to terms with its troubled past, through the lens of captivating interviews from St. Louis’ most misunderstood residents.

The ultimate goal, and result, of the Smoke City documentary series is to bring together the many corners of St. Louis, uplift our commonalities instead of our differences, and set the stage for a prosperous and more inclusive St. Louis experience, for every resident of any demographic.​

What's Unique About Smoke City: Ultimo?

Smoke City: Ultimo is the third, and final, installment of the Smoke City series. While Seasons 1 and 2 were broken up into episodes, Smoke City: Ultimo will be Cami Thomas’ first ever full-length feature, as a full-scale 120 minute documentary. Preceding wide-scale national distribution, there will be over a dozen live screenings and Q&A sessions across St. Louis. Screenings will be held in middle school, high school, and college campuses in the city, as well as select organizations that would like to bring the screening, and attached lesson plan/training, to their offices.

​

Screenings and increased guerrilla marketing throughout St. Louis City and St. Louis county will spread local reach to 3x compared to Season 2, at an estimated 10k unique viewers via live city screenings, an estimated additional 5k unique viewers through the local and national film festival circuit, and estimated additional 2k viewers in the international film festival circuit, and estimated 20k unique online viewers via FTCTVofficial.com. Coupled with the content rollout, will also be a robust guerrilla and web marketing campaign, with a three phase street team/postering strategy, an estimated 200k St. Louis area web impressions from social media ad campaign, display ads, and PPC web advertising. Smoke City has already been covered in national and local media.

What will my contributions be used for?

Contributions will go towards:
Public programming, educational programming to run in conjunction with the documentary (middle schools, high schools, youth programs, work/office settings) to teach about implicit biases and how to challenge your own, to make for a more inclusive city.
Film festival submission fees
Production gear and costs
Closed captioning file cost (to have captions in English and Spanish)
Artist fees for film scoring (done by an STL producer)
Additional FTCTV programming

 

Who are we?

FTCTV is spearheaded by St. Louis director and producer Cami Thomas. In addition to creating documentary content (featured in Teen Vogue, NPR, ALIVE Magazine, St. Louis Mag and more), Thomas also touts a robust formal business background. Following internships at The World Trade Center New Orleans and ALIVE Magazine, Thomas has gone on to work in marketing and sales for Tesla Motors, and most recently as the Field Marketing Specialist and Culture Marketing Specialist for Red Bull North America.

​

Calvin Tigre has been an integral eye for FTCTV productions, including acting as Assistant Director for both seasons of the Smoke City documentary series. Calvin is the leader of the Ursa Major musical duo, freelance videographer, and long-time St. Louis advocate and resident. 

 

Alexena Lopez is a User Experience Designer with an eye for building more inclusive, empathy-based solutions for companies in the St. Louis area. She currently serves as the youngest board member of Saint Louis User Experience Group, where she works to bring software design to a younger generation.

 

Caroline Fan is a consultant who has helped arts organizations and startups with crowdfunding campaigns. She previously served as Program Director for a film festival in New York and produced a short documentary.
story_txt: In a NutshellOn July 16th 2019, St. Louis director Cami Thomas and the FTCTV team are launching an Indigogo campaign to raise $10,000, with a stretch goal of $27,000. The funds will allow for the filming and editing of the third installment of the Smoke City docuseries, Smoke City: Ultimo, which will be a full-length film, as well as the production costs for Mexico-based documentary titled "Buenos Dias Tijuana".What is Smoke City and Smoke City: Ultimo?The Smoke City documentary series, by St. Louis director Cami Thomas, is a nationally-acclaimed deep-dive into St. Louis. The project covers life in St. Louis after the Ferguson uprising, as the city still struggles to have the conversations that has led to its repeated explosive socio-political moments. In the context of the United States in 2019, the series addresses St. Louis’, and society’s, hesitance to come to terms with its troubled past, through the lens of captivating interviews from St. Louis’ most misunderstood residents.The ultimate goal, and result, of the Smoke City documentary series is to bring together the many corners of St. Louis, uplift our commonalities instead of our differences, and set the stage for a prosperous and more inclusive St. Louis experience, for every resident of any demographic.​What's Unique About Smoke City: Ultimo?Smoke City: Ultimo is the third, and final, installment of the Smoke City series. While Seasons 1 and 2 were broken up into episodes, Smoke City: Ultimo will be Cami Thomas’ first ever full-length feature, as a full-scale 120 minute documentary. Preceding wide-scale national distribution, there will be over a dozen live screenings and Q&A sessions across St. Louis. Screenings will be held in middle school, high school, and college campuses in the city, as well as select organizations that would like to bring the screening, and attached lesson plan/training, to their offices.​Screenings and increased guerrilla marketing throughout St. Louis City and St. Louis county will spread local reach to 3x compared to Season 2, at an estimated 10k unique viewers via live city screenings, an estimated additional 5k unique viewers through the local and national film festival circuit, and estimated additional 2k viewers in the international film festival circuit, and estimated 20k unique online viewers via FTCTVofficial.com. Coupled with the content rollout, will also be a robust guerrilla and web marketing campaign, with a three phase street team/postering strategy, an estimated 200k St. Louis area web impressions from social media ad campaign, display ads, and PPC web advertising. Smoke City has already been covered in national and local media.What will my contributions be used for?Contributions will go towards:Public programming, educational programming to run in conjunction with the documentary (middle schools, high schools, youth programs, work/office settings) to teach about implicit biases and how to challenge your own, to make for a more inclusive city.Film festival submission feesProduction gear and costsClosed captioning file cost (to have captions in English and Spanish)Artist fees for film scoring (done by an STL producer)Additional FTCTV programming Who are we?FTCTV is spearheaded by St. Louis director and producer Cami Thomas. In addition to creating documentary content (featured in Teen Vogue, NPR, ALIVE Magazine, St. Louis Mag and more), Thomas also touts a robust formal business background. Following internships at The World Trade Center New Orleans and ALIVE Magazine, Thomas has gone on to work in marketing and sales for Tesla Motors, and most recently as the Field Marketing Specialist and Culture Marketing Specialist for Red Bull North America.​Calvin Tigre has been an integral eye for FTCTV productions, including acting as Assistant Director for both seasons of the Smoke City documentary series. Calvin is the leader of the Ursa Major musical duo, freelance videographer, and long-time St. Louis advocate and resident.  Alexena Lopez is a User Experience Designer with an eye for building more inclusive, empathy-based solutions for companies in the St. Louis area. She currently serves as the youngest board member of Saint Louis User Experience Group, where she works to bring software design to a younger generation. Caroline Fan is a consultant who has helped arts organizations and startups with crowdfunding campaigns. She previously served as Program Director for a film festival in New York and produced a short documentary.

story:
Why support "Hunt"?

"Hunt" has been an incredible opportunity for our cast and crew to explore a genre most of us have never gotten to work with before. It has been a huge learning opportunity and drives many of us to think outside the box and problem solve. By supporting "Hunt", there is a whole cast and crew that is getting to experience new moments on set and new lessons in film and TV!

What We Need & What You Get

Our fundraising goal is $650. These funds will go towards props, lighting equipment, and traveling expenses. Our goal is to film outside of Boston for our season two finale, so most of our fundraising will be dedicated toward this trip.

We want you to be a part of "Hunt", so check out what you can get if you donate!

  • $10 donation- Invitation to be an extra in one of our scenes and get free pizza (location & date will be available in September)
  • $25 donation- Special thanks in credits and a Hunt bottle cap button 
  • $50 donation- Special thanks, bottle cap button, and a hand made Hunt themed thank you letter
  • $100 donation- Producer credit
  • $200 donation- Producer credit and poster

Risks & Challenges

As with any project, there are always bumps in the road and plans that change. However, we can assure you that our team has been planning diligently for our next season. Things may change, but we have been organizing and working for three months in order for our next round of shooting to go as smoothly as possible. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to donate, don't worry! Here's how you can help:

  • Follow us on Facebook (HUNT) and Instagram (hunt.series)
  • Share our Indiegogo page on social media
  • Tell all your friends about "Hunt"!

Thank you in advance for all your help. We appreciate it more than you know. Thank you for joining the "Hunt"!
