story:
Summary:

"The Revenge Club" is a brand new Scottish teen drama series set in the fictional rural town - Bellswood.

~The Revenge Club intends to be an eight-hour limited series teen mystery drama.

Set in the present day within the fictional Scottish town of Bellswood.

It focuses around the murder of a teenage girl, and the lengths her family and friends will go to seek justice for her death.

Inspired by admiration for crime television dramas and coming of age teen dramas.

~”As Beth Latimer runs up the beach and realising that her son is dead by identifying his shoes…the shocking revelation for the Pretty Little Liars as their tormenter ‘A’ is unmasked…The bond of five teenagers from different school cliques who must spend time together in detention…the discovery of Laura Palmer’s body in the town of Twin Peaks.”

An emotional, visceral and character driven rollercoaster, The Revenge Club is a teenage drama you have never seen before. It is a mixture of a coming of age drama, sexual awakening, teenage angst, and the horror of a murder that turns a small-town upside down. ~

MEET THE WRITER/CREATOR:

Inspiration from writer G.R GREER:

"The Revenge Club originated from my anger towards how teenagers are portrayed in television and film – overly sexualised and not authentic in any way.

I wrote the first draft of this episode and created the treatment with the series’ trajectory in 2019. Since then, I have sent it to a major production company in Liverpool – who gave me really supportive and kind feedback – and I have tried to take on their feedback to take the pilot episode to the next level. 

From friends suggesting to make a concept trailer for the series - I thought I had nothing to lose, so here we are."!

Cast and Crew updates can be seen here and on our twitter page @therevengeclub1

Artist Biography:

G.R Greer’s writing has been described as “powerful” and “heart-breaking”.

He  is a gay Scottish playwright, screenwriter and actor who resides in Glasgow.

G.R graduated from Queen Margaret University’s BA (Hons) Drama and Performance course with a First-Class Honours Degree in 2016. The same year he began his MLitt in Playwriting and Screenwriting at The University of St Andrews where he graduated in December 2017.

He likes to write in his mother tongue; Scots and likes to explore the darkest parts of the human psyche and experience by examining how society views taboo subjects.

Credits Include: Upcoming trio of short films based on Scottish fables - FOLKLORE (2021), Séance (Scottish Youth Theatre), Big Fat Gay (DGAF/PCS), The Senescence of a Leaf (In Motion Theatre Company/See Me), Undertakers (PCS/Wigtown Book Festival), Daffodils (1875 Theatre Collective).

 

MEET THE CAST OF THE REVENGE CLUB:

Jack Deeney as Graham Gray.

Megan Jarvie as Grace Gray 

Giga Gray as Michelle Gray 

Graham Mackay Bruce as Ian Dawson 

Lubna Kerr as Maisie Kerr

Matthew Jack as Louis Kerr

Tiana Milne Wilson as Becky Anderson 

Declyn Tracey as Sebastian Armstrong 

Cindy Awor as Tiffany Harris

Shannon Davidson as Camilla Watson

Kristian Lustre as Callum Thomson

What We Need & What You Get:

Reaching the target goal of £5,000 would allow us to pay the our small crew for their hard-work and cast some of the lead roles with diverse Scottish talent to portray the exciting characters for our concept trailer/sizzle reel to help pitch the series. 

The intention is to pay the cast and our small crew £100 per day for filming over a 2-4 day range. To secure and afford location costs, travel and accommodation for the cast and crew whilst filming the concept trailer.

The plan of action is to film in Dumfries and Galloway, which is G.R's home region to use the gorgeous rural landscapes of Galloway and Wigtownshire this autumn, as a backdrop for this dark and gritty drama. 

NEXT STEPS:

If everything goes smoothly with the concept trailer/sizzle reel - we will be aiming to work towards filming the pilot in the future.

We will be updating the campaign with fun perks for backers very soon - so keep your eyes peeled!

The Impact:

The impact of backing The Revenge Club will mean that Scottish actors and crew members will get paid work after the most difficult year for the creative community. 

Everyone has got through the pandemic by watching television, film, music - whatever creative art has helped you through a rough year and we want to be able send our concept trailer/sizzle reel to distributors and production companies to pitch it to become a binge-worthy drama!

Risks & Challenges

The major risk is not reaching the target and not being able to afford to pay the cast and crew a fee for their hard work. Hopefully this will not happen - but is the biggest risk for the project. 

If this happens, we will have to postpone the production of the trailer/reel until enough funds are raised. 

Filming during COVID-19 is also a major concern if restrictions are still in place or are put back in place by this autumn, but the cast and crew will adhere to social distancing measures and each location will be risk-assessed and protocols will be put in place e.g. hand-sanitisers/masks/latex gloves etc. 

Other Ways You Can Help:

- Please share our campaign on social media to all your family, friends and followers. 

- Give us a follow and interact with us! Always down for a chat!

Thanks, 

#TeamRevengeClub

story:
About Me

My name is Nichole Chimere. I have been acting for 10 years. I have become very comfortable in front of the camera, but not so much behind it. I recently decided to step out of my comfort zone and I'm liking it here. The pilot episode of Journey was a success. It was accepted into a film festival and also a screening. 

It's impossible for me to do what I love without people like who you contribute to my art. Your contribution would be greatly appreciated because it allows me to live my dreams. I'm not waiting on someone to cast me in my dream role. I'm creating it for myself and my friends.

 

What We Need & What You Get

I am asking for a contribution of $5,000. This will help pay for shoots that require specific locations and transporting the actors and cinematographer. The funds will also go towards the actors, funding promotional materials for the project as well as submitting to festivals and streaming sources.  It can be difficult to get a project off of the ground without the proper funding. I do not want to put something out that is not of the best quality. You can help me out with that. If we don't reach our goal, we will use what we do raise for towards the series. 

When you donate there are perks involved! Depending on what you donate you'll get:

  • Shout out in the credits
  • Thank you card
  • Instagram Shoutout 
  • Chi-Mere visor
  • Behind the scenes footage

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate financially, that's ok. You can still help by sharing the campaign! Get the word out about Journey! The pilot episode was a success and many said they wanted to know what was going to happen next. Soooo if you want to know what happens too, share, share, share!

story:
Click on the Image to go to our YouTube Channel

Short Summary

Think about it:  You have your favorite shows, each inhabiting a different “Universe”.  We seek to explore what might happen when the Characters in these unique worlds become aware of each other.  What would happen if the "Marvel Universe" became aware that there is a “Walking Dead” or “Game of Thrones” Universe happening concurrently?  What would happen if Captain America ever met Rick Grimes?  Our videos will show you what these exchanges might be like.

POP! Debates is a comedy show which pokes fun at the Fictional Characters from TV and Films we're passionate about.  With your help, we can't wait to bring you more exciting match ups! 

About Us

Hi, we’re Brian and Kyle.  We’re Video Producers, Pop Culture Addicts and big consumers of content.  We’re passionate about our favorite shows and we love to defend the merits of our favorite Characters to each other.  Sometimes, these discussions devolve into pretty heated debates!  After one particularly heated exchange, the idea struck us:  Why don’t we make a video series where the Characters argue for themselves!  

What We Need & What You Get

Producing these videos...while fun, is not cheap.  In order to find talented Actors who can believably portray these Characters, and to outfit them with realistic costumes and makeup costs money.  Sure, we could attempt to do it on the cheap with non-actors wearing cheap store bought Halloween costumes, but in the end, we don't think this would fly with our Audience.  We want these videos to look as good as they possibly can!

We estimate that the cost to finance each video is about $3,500.  This includes paying the Actors, Casting Director, buying/renting wardrobe and props.  None of this money goes into our pockets...it goes straight back into production.

The Impact

We figured the best way to energize support behind this concept was to show you exactly how a finished episode would look.  So we produced two!  We financed these two episodes ourselves, while finding great Actors who graciously agreed to defer their payment until our campaign ends!  Producing more episodes will be impossible without YOUR support!  Funds from this campaign will go to recouping our losses, paying the Actors and funding two more episodes while launching a Patreon page to build sustaining support.  

Risks & Challenges

Any money we make will go into paying our Actors for the first two episodes, and then financing future productions.  If we don't make our goal...we will still use the money to produce as many episodes as we can.

Other Ways You Can Help

Be sure to "Like" our social media sites and share this campaign with your friends.

story:
The Plot

The story follows Fletcher Fitzgerald, seeking to find out what happened to his Father who mysteriously died at Crowl Corporations 15 years before. However, when given a fatal diagnosis, Fletcher must fight against time as he learns the truth about his Father, The Soul Double Initiative and what it means to be truly human.

The Team

Matt Wright - Director/Writer

This is our very last production whilst at Ravensbourne University in London, and I know that I want it to go out with a bang! It's a story that I have been passionate about writing and I cannot wait to realise it to screen.  We really appreciate all the support towards our project. 

Rebecca Bardon - Producer

We are super excited to start working on Fletchers' journey with The Soul Double Initiative and any help that you can give to us will really help the potential of our work. Even if you are unable to donate, please share our link amongst friends and families so we can reach larger audiences! We cannot wait to share how the story unfolds with you all. 

Funding 

We are trying to raise £3000 to go towards our productions costs. This will enable us to hire locations, equipment and of course pay our amazing cast. Any progress we can make will really help the production of Soul Doubles. We have some great perks for those donating, which could even include you being involved in our episode! Have a look below on how we are planning to allocate the money we are raising...

Risks & Challenges

There are a few risks and challenges that we will have in our production that we can anticipate. All the challenges are positive in enhancing our learning experience. Here are some below that we are working hard to overcome:

  • Working with 11 cast members - Meticulous planning and preparation will need to be made before shooting to ensure cast members are on set when needed and for as little time as required.
  • Multiple Locations - Transporting equipment, crew and cast to multiple locations.
  • Insurance - Making sure we are insured on location for all crew, cast members and equipment.
  • Permissions - Ensuring we can secure permission to film in our locations.

 

Thank you for visiting our page and thank you for any support you have been able to offer to the project!

Any progress we can make will really help the production of Soul Doubles. We have some great perks for those donating, which could even include you being involved in our episode! Have a look below on how we are planning to allocate the money we are raising...


Risks & Challenges
There are a few risks and challenges that we will have in our production that we can anticipate. All the challenges are positive in enhancing our learning experience. Here are some below that we are working hard to overcome:

Working with 11 cast members - Meticulous planning and preparation will need to be made before shooting to ensure cast members are on set when needed and for as little time as required.
Multiple Locations - Transporting equipment, crew and cast to multiple locations.
Insurance - Making sure we are insured on location for all crew, cast members and equipment.
Permissions - Ensuring we can secure permission to film in our locations.

 
Thank you for visiting our page and thank you for any support you have been able to offer to the project!

story:
For the trio of MARTIAN, TERRA and CAPTAIN COURAGEOUS - the Mission couldn't be anymore dangerous: Escort Warship DARK EXECUTIONER to rendezvous point - THE BARLONS. Easier said then done for a vessel already attacked by a space dragon, and nearly stolen by space pirates. Luckily, the group receives a much needed helping hand. Dispatched on a hunch by Nymphalidean PRIME MINISTER ZARA to greet Warship DE at THE BARLONS, are - SFC - KREESA LIS and the BUTTERFLY BRIGADE. But when DARK EXECUTIONER comes under attack from deadly cyborg DATA MINER and a quartet of KILOBOTS, an all out fight for survival begins.

 

Featuring the voice talents of:
Ben Maclaine as Martian    
Deanna Meske as Terra    
Wally Wingert as Captain Courageous    
Paul Ganus as Kurn    
Nilsa Castro as Polix   

MARTIAN 2: WINNER: BEST SCI-FI
THE BEST FILM FEST 2016
http://bestfest.ml

FEATURED AT STAN LEE'S L.A. COMIC CON
http://www.stanleeslacomiccon.com/2016-programming
http://www.caotica.com/comikaze-2014-searchable...

ANIMATED SHORTS: TOP 500  IMDB (#5)
http://icheckmovies.com/lists/animated+shorts+t...

story:
Five College Strangers Break Down Barriers, Relationships, and Societal Stereotypes...one calamity at a time.

Can you image living with a group of people YOU DON'T KNOW?!! LIVING WITH STRANGERS is an unconventional comedy series centered around five strangers who, by various unforeseen circumstances, are forced to live together in New York City. Think Arrested Development and A Different World meets Broad City. 

The decision to live with strangers did not come easy, but since the rent in New York City is TOO DAMN HIGH Casey, Lynn, Nancy, Roger, and Nick decide it would be better than being homeless. However, its not all sunshine and roses as they are constantly on the brink of losing their apartment. How could they not know you could get evicted for destroying building property or sexual solicitation? 

Throughout the series, tensions build, various secrets are revealed, personal revelations come to light, and its discovered the idiotic choices these college strangers made that brought them together. Eventually they become friends...sort of?! 

It's not your typical comedy. Every character's story pushes boundaries making you laugh out loud or a little bit uncomfortable. Whether it be sex, money, PMS, questioning if someone is gay, or talking about race. ANYTHING GOES!! And nothing is off the table.

Living With Strangers is LOOSELY based on Tracy and Carissa's bizarre and crazy college experience at NYU. Tracy and Carissa wanted to work on a project together and were reminiscing about their "good old college days". They laughed about how Carissa burned her hair and the weirdos they encountered on the NYC subway. They then talked about how Tracy was able afford to live off-campus their senior year when she was so BROKE. Well, she found an old and dingy apartment, put several housing ads up, and spent her senior year actually living with strangers. And BAMM!!...a light bulb went off in their heads.

Why Living With Strangers?

Well, look what's going on in the world! Its crazy out there and in a time full of uncertainty and chaos we need more joy and laughter in our lives. We truly believe in the power of comedy and want to bring you something that will ring true to your experiences and portray characters who are otherwise marginalized and vastly underrepresented as MULTIFACETED, MULTIDIMENSIONAL, fully formed HUMAN BEINGS. Also we can all share in the laughs and nostalgia of the dumb mistakes we've made in college. 

Tracy Ofosuhene always had a strong affinity towards film and television, knowing at an early age she would pursue a career in the entertainment industry. She received her B.F.A from New York University's Tisch School of the Arts with a major in Film and TV, a minor in Producing, and minor in Business Entertainment, Media, and Technology from Stern's School of Business. Tracy has produced several short films and television projects including Other-side Picture's Spin. Tracy has also worked at some of the world's top entertainment companies like Gersh and AwesomenessTV as well as an executive producer's assistant on East Los High.

Carissa Lee Pinckney is a North Carolinian actress, singer, and one of the co-creators of Living With Strangers.  She graduated with from New York University's Tisch School of the Arts receiving her B.F.A. in theatre and B.A. in political science. Currently residing in Los Angeles, Carissa's various TV credits include Comedy Central's Key & Peele and web show UnAfraid.  She also recently performed in Alesha Harris' critically acclaimed stage play, What To Send Up When It Goes Down.

Bethany Koulias graduated Magnum Cum Laude from the University of California, Irvine with a BA in Drama. Since then, she has produced and starred in over a dozen independent films, pilots, webseries, and stage productions.

Roland Lazarte is a cinematographer based in New York City. His work has taken him to places such as the Philippines, Taiwan, and Scotland for shorts, music videos, and commercial spots. He has worked in the camera department of various films and television shows including Royal Pains and Awkwardness.

Roland is primarily focused on commercial and fashion films seeking to bring humanistic, authentic narrative elements to his images.

Cullie Poseria grew up in Ohio and moved to New York City to pursue film at NYU where she received her B.FA in Film and Television from Tisch School of the Arts. Upon graduating in May 2012, she worked on various television shows such as CSI:NY, Gossip Girl, Boardwalk Empire, and HBO critically acclaimed mini-series The Night Of as a shooting grip. She went on to work as an assistant camera on several feature film projects - Apolla Echino's A New York Love Story, Walter Strafford's KILIMANJARO, and Jeffrey Grellman's Mermaid Down.

Naleeka "Nelly" Dennis is a Long Island, NY native and recent California transplant. She graduated from New York University's Tisch School of the Arts with a BFA in Film and Television production. She is a current MFA Screenwriting student at Chapman University. Naleeka freelances as a Production Sound Mixer and dreams of becoming a screenwriter for film and television.

Evan Haigh is a filmmaker from Los Angeles. Some of the projects he has worked on are the feature film 13 Cameras, the Sundance Award winning short Thunder Road, and the music video Classic Male Pregame by Lil Dicky. While not working on various film projects, Evan has helped work on various web series and directed several of them. Having grown-up in Los Angeles, Evan has been interested in film since he was a teenager. After moving to the east coast when he was 15, he eventually went to NYU, where he majored in film and wrote and directed several short films. After graduation he has worked on a number of projects, and has continued to be part of the independent film community in Los Angeles.

 

A lot goes into making a tv web series and every dollar raised will go toward making this project. Here’s a literal pie chart of what your money will go towards: 

This show is a passion project for everyone involved. We all are making sure that this show is not only one that we would like to see, but one that we can be proud of. 

We understand that everyone has their own financial constraints and hope that you will check out our perks and give a donation. Even sharing this link on Facebook/Twitter/Instagram can help! We truly appreciate your support! 

 

 

THANK YOU!

Campaign video shot by Carolina Vasquez and Erin Ryan.

Edited by Aaron Ofosuhene

Poster photo taken by Rebecca Aranda

Enjoy The First Installment Below :-)

story:
"In all honesty, if I had my own network, THIS is the series I would place my bets on. There are a lot of shows on TV and Netflix today that don’t capture my attention past the pilot episode. It takes a lot for me to be engaged enough to ‘want more’ and this series, I predict, will go the distance in the right hands."                                

                                                                            - STARLIGHT MUSIC CHRONICLE   ( 11/10/17)

Hello people...it's Darren Keith here and I want to welcome you to the new INDIEGOGO campaign for my comedy series DK the gig, which is about a musician whose ego is much larger than the restaurant stage on which he performs. This is a true passion project...I created the show, wrote it, play the lead character "DK", composed all the music, am an executive producer, and even did some of the editing. I have been a professional drummer and singer/songwriter for most of my life and have played with countless local and national artists/bands, but creating DK the gig fulfilled a lifelong dream for me, which was to do something professionally with my sense of humor. Now, only a few years after officially starting this journey and writing my first script, I am about to shoot DK the gig's first season of episodes with all these incredible people that are involved.

THE AWESOME AND EXCITING NEWS!!!

                                         

(Left to Right: Kevin Bacon, BARRY MARKOWITZ, Billy Bob Thornton)

Legendary Cinematographer Barry Markowitz (who has filmed such acclaimed movies as Oscar-winner Crazy Heart, Sling Blade, All The Pretty Horses, The Apostle, as well as Rob Reiner's last 3 movies) is filming DK the gig's new episodes!!! Barry loved the DK the gig Pilot episode and said he wanted to be involved with the project moving forward and shoot it's FIRST SEASON of episodes, which is incredible. 

OUR AMAZING NEW CAST!!!

We are so lucky to have these incredibly talented actors, actresses and musicians (and we're not even done! More will be coming on board in the next few months) for the new episodes:

CHARLENE AMOIA (How I Met Your Mother, Glee, Dexter, House, Bones, NCIS, The Young And The Restless) 

STEPHEN GRAYBILL (HBO's Big Little Lies, Law And Order, All My Children, As The World Turns)

BROOKE TOTMAN (MADtv, The Benefits Of Gusbandry, King Of Queens)

JOSEPH ARTHUR (Grammy Nominated Singer/Songwriter)

PETE DONNELLY (The Figgs, NRBQ, Shelby Lynne)

FRED BERMAN (Amos Lee)

And I have a wonderful new producer, Jill Gould, who is helping me make this show as good as we all know it can be. 

OUR GOAL:

We are going to film DK the gig's "FIRST SEASON" of episodes, and to do that we need your help. Some incredible things have happened since my first INDIEGOGO campaign that have made this production much bigger and significantly more expensive than it previously was, which is why we are here once again. It's been estimated that this will cost over $70,000 or $80,000, and with your help, our hope is to raise at least $30,000 of it here on INDIEGOGO. As soon as we reach our goal, we can begin the work, which includes pre-production (scheduling, rehearsals, recording the music, etc), shooting the episodes, post-production(editing, sound, etc), PR, and then releasing the episodes online for everyone to see.

HOW YOU CAN HELP

So here's the part where you come in. It is so difficult and expensive to do what we're doing without a major network financing it. It will cost a FORTUNE...and as I said earlier, well over $70,000 or 80,000, which has to pay for the cast, flights and hotels for the cast, location fees, equipment rentals, post-production (editing, sound, etc.), production insurance, hard drives, recording sessions...the list goes on and on. So many people think that DK the gig has a very bright future and will eventually get picked up by someone like HBO, Amazon, Netflix, etc., so it's extremely important to me that everything is done right and we present the show in the best possible way to make sure that happens. You can help us accomplish that right now by making a donation, however large or small, because EVERY DOLLAR COUNTS. And please don't forget to help spread the word about this INDIEGOGO campaign. 

THANK YOU SO MUCH....WE CANNOT WAIT FOR YOU TO SEE THE NEW EPISODES!!!

Darren Keith

 

ABOUT ME

My name is Darren Keith. Before creating DK the gig, I was a professional drummer and singer/songwriter for most of my life and have played with countless local and national artists and bands. DK the gig was inspired by the 25-plus-year dream I had (while being a musician) to do something professionally with my sense of humor. It was something that gnawed at me for well over 2 decades, so to be at this exciting stage right now is very profound for me. This is the epitome of a passion project....I created DK the gig, wrote it, play the lead character DK, composed all of the music, am the executive producer, and even did some of the editing.

HERE'S WHAT THEY HAD TO SAY:

HERE'S WHAT THEY HAD TO SAY:

story:
The Dealy Yo

Hi! My name is Kaili Turner and I'm a New York Actor, Producer and Writer that is a huge fan of Sex in the City. Watching those episodes was like hanging out with my best girlfriends every meet up. The only thing missing, were the women of color and the realer than life situations that can occur. I would be remiss if I didn't mention how comedy shapes everything around me.

I'm truly a lover of laughter and joy with some raunchy comedy thrown in. 90's television also helped to shape what I saw as the vision for this web series. Martin punchlines with Living Single woman power, and thus I created Fk'd Up & Fabulous, a web series that follows 5 crazy women, dealing with real life, love and relationships in 2017 gentrified Brooklyn.

Fk'd Up & Fabulous also came out of some of the Fk'd up, yet fabulous situations my sister and co-writer Fari and I often found and still do find ourselves in whenever we get together. This series is based on some of the craziest real life situations, that one would think it was all artistic license. It's important to have stories told that we can all relate to, and Fk'd Up & Fabulous is just that for the melanated woman 30 and up (Jay-Z did say it's the new 20)!!! 

The Fabulous Message

Fk'd Up & Fabulous is truly a passion project, but the only way to bring this dream to fruition and to a screen near you, is through your awesome donations! 

****We are looking to raise $16,000 to complete this project!!!****

Here is what we'll use the funds for:

Pre-Production:

  • Acquire insurance to make sure everyone is safe on set.
  • Edit Official web series images
  • Securing Locations and associated fees

Production:

  • Pay our cast and crew
  • Feed our cast and crew
  • Technical Equipment: including camera, lighting and sound
  • Props, wardrobe and set design

Post-Production:

  • Video and Sound Editing in HD
  • Music composition

Here are some of the amazing perks we are providing!!

  • Social Media Shout out
  • Official web series poster
  • Meet and Greet with Cast 
  • Day with the creator
  • 1/2 hour LifeStyle Photo Shoot with Martin 
  • 1 hour Consultation with MUA 
  • Tix to Premiere
  • VIP Tix to Premiere & Swag Bag

The Break Down

We need $16,000 to cover the usual expenditures for producing quality content.  Even if we don't reach our intended goal, your funds will help us to get started and be able to seek grants that offer match funding or to even request a business loan if we have to.  At the end of the day, we need to show there is interest in our content, and your donation would go a long way.  We also need people to share our campaign.  So however you choose to support us, we would greatly appreciate it.  If you tell 20 friends and they donate, send us a note and we will give you a very special shout out on our SM platform.

Risks & Challenges

Creating is always risky.  Taking an idea from the page to the stage or screen is scary and expensive.  In order to be successful, one needs a talented team and strong drive. I have been fortunate enough to have both of these. Unfortunately, living, working  and trying to create in New York City is hard.  Living and working most places is hard work, but I'm taking the risk and putting my baby (this web series) out into the world.  It's important to have a show that can show women over the age of 30 as full women that are still sexy, still figuring this life shit out and can give face while doing it. It's equally, if not more important, to show women of color as fully colorful beings and not just Black, but Latina, Native American and Asian. We are more than the quirky friend next door, or the sassy sidekick (although we can be those things too), we embody all of it and hold each other down in the process.

In Total

We understand that not everyone is able to give a monetary donation, so we would be equally as grateful if you use the Indiegogo share tools to like, subscribe, follow, and share our campaign. And if you can get 20 friends to share or donate, hit us up on IG and we'll give you a special shout out!!!

Cast & Crew

Meet the incredibly talented cast and crew working on this amazing project:

Kaili Y. Turner is a Nipmuc Native American. Some of her credits include: The HBO award winning short film “The Cycle”, “Broken” a one woman show by George Cameron Grant. Kaili is also a writer/Actor for the sketch troupe American Candy, Co-Founder of Colors of Community, as well as, an alum of UCB.

Martin Balaguer is an actor and director from Argentina. In New York, he has recently performed in the Emmy Award winning web series "Tough Love", and acted in a short film for the 2017 48 Hour Film Project, where he won best acting. He performed as a lead in a play for the NY International Fringe Festival 2015.

Michele Baldwin is an American, multi-platform creative artist: Actor, Award Winning Producer, Filmmaker and an overall Inspirer with over a decade of experience in executing strategy for independent films, stage plays, television productions and client-based digital media.  Her experience encompasses all aspects of the Entertainment field: Film, TV, Theater and the Internet.  AS CEO of Michele Baldwin Enterprises, she works with many other collaborators and partners, Eddie Harris of EBH Productions, recently Corwin Moore, former SNL Writer on an upcoming new series, and was recently named Lead Project Manager at Sounds of Tomorrow, a Youth Development Organization, in partnership with three time Grammy Award winner, Jerry Wonda. www.michelebaldwin.com

Alexis Braxton is an actress from Harrisburg, PA. She is a member of the sketch comedy troupe American Candy, and has also taken classes in both improv and stand-up. Alexis recently performed at the Duke on 42nd Street and Symphony Space. Recent credits include Nilene Cooper in You Wouldn't Expect, performed the D.C. Black Theater & Arts Festival. Alexis has also been cast in another web series shooting this fall.

Fari is a cultural anthropologist, and has been living in New Orleans since 2009. In addition to nursing her literary aspirations, Fari is an emerging curator and an Adjunct Professor at Bard Early College in New Orleans where she teaches a course on contemporary visual art; and is co-founder of the Color BLOC, an information and resource-sharing platform for the professional advancement of New Orleans-based artists and arts professionals of color.

Evan Joseph is an NYC based music composer, sound designer and performer. As part owner and supervising sound editor of Trytone Sound, Evan provides sound and music for film, TV, commercials, web series and more. In addition, Evan is the composer in residence for the NYC based MJM Dance Company.

Gretchen Knapp is an actor and visual artist among many other things. She regularly performs with the Brooklyn-based sketch comedy troupe, "American Candy". She started My Fair Heathen Productions in 2001, is a working voice over performer and has appeared in theater festivals, short films and touring bands for the last 20 years in Boston, NYC and Europe. She is currently developing her own original episodic TV show. Stay tuned!

Katie Mack

Katie Mack is a well-versed actor and graduate of William Esper Sudio who writes, produces and directs her own content under her KMackBrand umbrella, most recently winning an award for Best Director in New York for her latest short film, Missing You. Mack is also the creator and co-host of the podcast, The Lady Kickback – an ode to living and moving through life as a creative and is currently working on several short and feature films.​

Arlene A. McGruder (SAG-AFTRA)

Film credits: Manhattan Night; An Englishman in New York; Scenes From the Underground(2018);Theatre-partial list: The Werewolf of Washington Heights; Faith Under Fire; Kingfish, Amos & Andy. Nominated Best Actress in the 2014 Venus/Adonis Theatre Festival. New York City Black Comedy Award Nominee (1995)–Best New Jack Female Comedienne www.arlenemcgruder.com

 

Javana Mundy

Javana Mundy graduated with her MFA at the Actors Studio Drama School at Pace University in 2015. She is currently in development of her filmed monologue series The Passed Down Project and multimedia one woman show Mama's 19 from which an excerpt was showcased at the Labyrinth Theatre, NY.  Find out more about her at www.JAVANAMUNDY.com. 

 

Kim Rios Lin (SAG-AFTRA)

TV:                             NBC’s THE BLACKLIST REDEMPTION, NETFLIX’s BROWN NATION

FILM/ WEB:         MGM’s WARGAMES, currently shooting Lead in film by Creator of David Bowie’s UNBOUND,

THEATER:  Leads in Award Winning/ Nominated NYC Theatre Festival, FRIGID, FRINGE; LABYRINTH Intensive Ensemble 

TRAINING:            UCB, MFA Actors Studio Drama School

www.KimRiosLin.com 

Godfrey Taylor Jr. was born and raised in Queens, New York. He studied Meisner technique at The Acting School and Video/Film production New England School of Communications.

He’s been cast in numerous productions including “Tough love” and Arian Foster’s poetic adaptation “Where We Dwell”.

Esswaan Tillery is a African American Panamanian. Brooklyn born from a town called Bedford Stuyvesant. He received education from George Westinghouse. Esswaan is a writer, producer, and recording artist. He is currently working on a clothing line named "Heavy Lies The Crown" and also recording music.

Tomike Ogugua (SAG-AFTRA)

New York based actor that can be currently seen in the recurring role of Marshal Macedon on Starz hit “Power” alongside Omari Hardwick and Joseph Sikora. Other recent credits include CBS hit “Blue Bloods”.

Ogugua has also been seen Off Broadway in “Julius Caesar” with Royal Shakespeare Company and “Henry IV” starring Harriet Walter with Donmar Warehouse under the Direction of Tony Award winner Phyllida Lloyd.

Maurice W (Cinematographer)

His journey has taken him from the publishing industry, to the music industry, to the movie industry.   He has worked as a script consultant on TV shows including Law and Order SVU and Forever as well as sold scripts to Paramount and Warner Bros.

Maurice is also the founder of W MediaWorks, the company behind the films "Broken Strings" and "Candle In The Wind" - both of which he wrote, produced, directed and filmed.  He is also the Founder and CEO of The ON Channel, a channel which features the films, series, fan films and original content of Independent creators from around the world.

JayNemar Smith- Multi-Creative Entrepreneur, is CEO of NEAT LEGACY Productions & CFOO
of INVISIONI Studios where he has been the Producer/Director for several Music Video. JayNemar took on his first narrative as an Executive Producer of what is now a Multi-Award
Winning Musical called “Something Like A Fairytale” from The Hudson Guild Theatre Festival
‘16 and Performed the following year at the National Black Theatre Festival ‘17. Pushing his
passion further JayNemar stepped from Theatre into Film/TV in July 2017. JayNemar has since
been on the Production end of Features: “Still Waters”, “Confetti,” & “Clinton Road”, Shorts:
“Love Boom Bap”, “US of Paranoia”, & “The Jar”, and three Web-Series. He's currently inProduction with three additional short films and one additional web-series all set to release in
2018!

Michael Bell is first an Actor that is also good at designing and operating lighting systems. My love for theater is to be a part of making the magic happen.
story_txt:
The Dealy YoHi! My name is Kaili Turner and I'm a New York Actor, Producer and Writer that is a huge fan of Sex in the City. Watching those episodes was like hanging out with my best girlfriends every meet up. The only thing missing, were the women of color and the realer than life situations that can occur. I would be remiss if I didn't mention how comedy shapes everything around me.I'm truly a lover of laughter and joy with some raunchy comedy thrown in. 90's television also helped to shape what I saw as the vision for this web series. Martin punchlines with Living Single woman power, and thus I created Fk'd Up & Fabulous, a web series that follows 5 crazy women, dealing with real life, love and relationships in 2017 gentrified Brooklyn.Fk'd Up & Fabulous also came out of some of the Fk'd up, yet fabulous situations my sister and co-writer Fari and I often found and still do find ourselves in whenever we get together. This series is based on some of the craziest real life situations, that one would think it was all artistic license. It's important to have stories told that we can all relate to, and Fk'd Up & Fabulous is just that for the melanated woman 30 and up (Jay-Z did say it's the new 20)!!! The Fabulous MessageFk'd Up & Fabulous is truly a passion project, but the only way to bring this dream to fruition and to a screen near you, is through your awesome donations! ****We are looking to raise $16,000 to complete this project!!!****Here is what we'll use the funds for:Pre-Production:
Acquire insurance to make sure everyone is safe on set.
Edit Official web series images
Securing Locations and associated fees
Production:
Pay our cast and crew
Feed our cast and crew
Technical Equipment: including camera, lighting and sound
Props, wardrobe and set design
Post-Production:
Video and Sound Editing in HD
Music composition
Here are some of the amazing perks we are providing!!
Social Media Shout out
Official web series poster
Meet and Greet with Cast 
Day with the creator
1/2 hour LifeStyle Photo Shoot with Martin 
1 hour Consultation with MUA 
Tix to Premiere
VIP Tix to Premiere & Swag Bag
The Break DownWe need $16,000 to cover the usual expenditures for producing quality content.  Even if we don't reach our intended goal, your funds will help us to get started and be able to seek grants that offer match funding or to even request a business loan if we have to.  At the end of the day, we need to show there is interest in our content, and your donation would go a long way.  We also need people to share our campaign.  So however you choose to support us, we would greatly appreciate it.  If you tell 20 friends and they donate, send us a note and we will give you a very special shout out on our SM platform.Risks & ChallengesCreating is always risky.  Taking an idea from the page to the stage or screen is scary and expensive.  In order to be successful, one needs a talented team and strong drive. I have been fortunate enough to have both of these. Unfortunately, living, working  and trying to create in New York City is hard.  Living and working most places is hard work, but I'm taking the risk and putting my baby (this web series) out into the world.  It's important to have a show that can show women over the age of 30 as full women that are still sexy, still figuring this life shit out and can give face while doing it. It's equally, if not more important, to show women of color as fully colorful beings and not just Black, but Latina, Native American and Asian. We are more than the quirky friend next door, or the sassy sidekick (although we can be those things too), we embody all of it and hold each other down in the process.In TotalWe understand that not everyone is able to give a monetary donation, so we would be equally as grateful if you use the Indiegogo share tools to like, subscribe, follow, and share our campaign. And if you can get 20 friends to share or donate, hit us up on IG and we'll give you a special shout out!!!Cast & CrewMeet the incredibly talented cast and crew working on this amazing project:Kaili Y. story:
Our Story – How We Got Here

Award-winning screenwriter Joan Macbeth met Vancouver actress Stevie Jackson at a film industry networking group founded by writer-director Michelle Muldoon. You’re kidding, right?  Industry networking? Ugh.

But this group is different.

We want to inspire artists to get stuff done. Sometimes you need to push yourself out of your comfort zone to pursue your creative dreams. Stevie, who did not consider herself a writer, had a short, funny script she’d written to cheer up a friend who was nervous about job hunting. Joan knows a writer when she reads one, and offered to help Stevie gussy up the script. And suddenly, collaboration and hyphenation started to happen. Sarah, another member of the group, was an editor who was doing a Masters program in directing. Michelle offered production assistance; Jane handled casting. Honestly Charlotte – the award-winning short film – was shot over one weekend in March 2016 with an all-female cast and crew. It's now making its way into international film festivals.

After we shot the film, friends who saw it started asking if we would be making it into a series. We felt that Charlotte might indeed have more to say on the matter of artists who were trapped in corporate cubicles. Now we’ve written a six-episode web series, which is heading into production. It's a much bigger endeavour, but we know we can do it because we've already done it. This time, we're just doing it six times bigger.

Our short film took about $2,000 to make, on a bare-bones budget, plus another $1,500 or so for incidental business expenses and film festival submissions. Estimating about $2,500 per episode for the series, we’d like to raise $10,000 of the $15,000 budget with our Indiegogo campaign.  But we’re going to start with $8,000, and hope for a push goal, because we’re bashful about asking for money. Outside our comfort zone.

Like Charlotte, maybe that's a little too honest.

 

Your Story – What We Need & What You Get

Your financial assistance will help fund our shoot of six new episodes, including paying half a dozen actors and about twice as many crew. Even a small shoot requires a director, camera operators, lighting and sound technicians, continuity, set decorators, make-up, craft services, transportation, equipment rentals, and insurance. Post production expenses include an editor, soundtrack music, sound mixing, colour grading and titles. We’ll be producing under the UBCP Ultra-Low Budget Program. Our budget may be shoestring, but we do things right.

Our people believe in this project – they are, for the most part, artists with day jobs. A project like this, one way or another, is a step along the road to fulfilling their creative dreams.

And what do you get? Well, besides the satisfaction of helping artists, we offer some exciting perks and our undying gratitude.

Are YOU an artist working in a corporate cubicle? Secretly writing that screenplay in your spare moments, as you toil at the day job? Or moonlighting on the weekends, putting that art degree to good use? Let us make you comfortable outside your comfort zone when you join us at the $200, $300 or $350 contribution levels. Work on set, be an actor for a day, or for $750 you can even be an associate producer.

Is that a little out of your price range? How about a copy of the series, complete with exclusive special features? A cool t-shirt that proclaims your support? A signed poster? We've got you covered. A contribution at any level will get you a sneak preview of Honestly Charlotte: The Series – prior to its release to the public!

Remember, art of all kinds is an important aspect of civilization. The world needs you!

Our plan is in place, scripts are polished, the cast is excited, and so are we. We are good to go and all we need is the rest of the funding.

And if you cannot contribute financially, you can still help by telling your friends and sharing on social media. Help us spread the word, and you get that undying gratitude we mentioned.

Any amount helps. Seriously. Anything.

Thank you!

 

Cast & Crew Stories

 

Joan Macbeth – Writer, Director, Executive Producer

“The need to make a living in my twenties forced me to abandon my artistic dreams entirely. But one job led to another, to another; and when I started my own business, I felt that, in a way, it was a creative outlet. I wasn’t creating art, but I was creating something.” Joan’s success in the business world led to a windfall that enabled her to retire at the age of 42. Since then she has pursued her life-long goal of being a writer. A few years in, she discovered screenwriting and hasn’t looked back. “Every once in awhile, I even get paid to write something."

 

Stevie Jackson – Writer, Executive Producer, "Charlotte Chandler"

"The first time I got paid to act, it was right out of school. It was an original show for a fringe festival, and we all walked away with $50 each for four months' work. You do not want to break that down by the hour, but it was very exciting. I still have a photocopy of the cheque." Stevie knows intimately the balancing act that is pursuing a professional creative career while also paying the bills with a day job - something she's been doing for years. "As creatives, we accept that often most our money has to come from another source for quite a long time, but the feeling of getting paid to do what you love? There's just nothing like it."

 

Pam Kearns – "Louise Lassiter"

Pam’s love of acting began during her girlhood in Montreal. At age 17 she enrolled in full-time theatre school, playing lead roles in both classical and modern dramas. She was thrilled to book a part in a Hollywood film her final year of theatre school. Next she planned a move to Toronto to join the bustling film community there, but love intervened. “Or as they say, ‘Life is what happens when you’re busy making other plans!’” She met her husband John, and life and love put Pam’s acting career on hold. While raising their two children, Pam found a creative outlet as a professional chef. “I always knew I would return to acting,” Pam says. “The love of the art fuels me, and I am committed to my craft. Getting paid for it is like gravy – delicious gravy!”

 

Jane Avery – "Gabe Griffin"

“I think the ultimate goal for any actor or artist is to earn their living solely on their art, but I've yet to see it in my community. And I doubt I ever will. I've made my peace with that 100%.” Jane has been involved in the Vancouver acting community since 2007. “It's almost like a dirty secret that we have to have day jobs to make ends meet while pursuing our creative path. Even top-shelf local actors don't really talk about it, but I think we should because how else will the newbies get a grip on reality when they graduate? And how else will we begin to stop feeling bad about ourselves that we need these joe-jobs? But I'm happy to be here. We support each other, creating our own content, not waiting for the phone to ring.”

 

Mirella Gibeau – "Marigold"

As the eldest child of immigrant parents, Mirella felt a duty to pursue a “professional” career, even though her passion was in the arts. She became a teacher. “I loved teaching and it was an honour to nurture creativity, and witness some brilliant young artists find their voices. But my own artistic growth was shelved.” When she retired, Mirella relocated to Vancouver to revisit her love of acting. “Although this is a creative field, it is also a business. I am grateful I have a pension because it's super competitive and I'm up against women in my age demographic who've been in the industry for forty years. It takes money to invest in headshots, classes, media presence and networking. It's not easy. But it makes me feel more alive than I've felt in years!”

 

Shelley Janzé – "Head of Accounting"

Shelley began acting later in life, as her kids prepared to go off and build their own lives, and the empty nest was looming. With the support of her husband, she thought it would be fun to be in a commercial or two. One class led to another, which led to student and indie films, headshots, an agent, and, before she knew it, Shelley was hooked on acting. No empty nest syndrome for her. “Being financially secure, I’m fortunate that I don’t have to rely on making a living to pursue acting. Any paid gigs are icing on the cake.”

 

Sarah Hedar – Associate Producer

“I once read a quote on a fridge magnet that said ‘Speak the truth, but leave immediately after,’ but what if you have spoken this truth to someone who has the power to hire you for a job - one that you need to make ends meet?” Sarah directed the original film Honestly Charlotte, and joins the team now as Associate Producer. “I was reminded of some of my own experiences juggling 'real' jobs while pursuing my own artistic endeavours. As Charlotte negotiates her need for work against her desire for a life as an artist, her perspective of the day-to-day grind struck a chord with me, and will perhaps also ring true for anyone else who has ever worked in an office.”

 

Risks and Challenges

We won't lie - honestly! Production and post-production delays sometimes happen and there's a possibility that we'll encounter unforeseen challenges that are beyond our control. We'll do everything we can to avoid that, but if it should happen, we promise to keep you updated the whole way.

 

Frequently Asked Questions:

Q. I see you are fundraising in Canadian dollars. Can I contribute from another country?
A. Yes! Your credit card will be charged in your currency and we’ll receive Canadian dollars. In some cases, this means your money might go further. For instance, if you’re American and you donate $100 CAD, it will cost you about $75 USD.

Q. What does a “flexible” goal mean?
A. It means that the campaign isn’t all or nothing. If we don’t make our goal, we’ll still receive your contribution and it will go towards making the show.

Q. What happens if you don’t make your goal? Will you still make the show? Will I still get my perk?
A. Yes and yes, but it will all take us longer, because we’ll need to raise the rest of our budget. If that happens, we’ll keep you informed of our adjusted timelines.

Q. What happens if you exceed your goal?
A. First of all, we will be SO EXCITED. All “extra” funds will go toward making the highest quality show possible (better/more equipment, a bigger crew, etc.).

Q. I want to help but I can’t contribute financially. Is there anything else I can do?
A. First of all, we totally understand, and we so appreciate your support. The most helpful non-financial thing you can do is to help promote the campaign so it reaches more people. Thank you!

Do you have a question we missed? Get in touch with us via the “ask a question” link above!

Thanks again! We look forward to sharing Honestly Charlotte's journey with you.

Work on set, be an actor for a day, or for $750 you can even be an associate producer.Is that a little out of your price range? How about a copy of the series, complete with exclusive special features? A cool t-shirt that proclaims your support? A signed poster? We've got you covered. A contribution at any level will get you a sneak preview of Honestly Charlotte: The Series – prior to its release to the public!Remember, art of all kinds is an important aspect of civilization. The world needs you!Our plan is in place, scripts are polished, the cast is excited, and so are we. We are good to go and all we need is the rest of the funding.And if you cannot contribute financially, you can still help by telling your friends and sharing on social media. Help us spread the word, and you get that undying gratitude we mentioned.Any amount helps. Seriously. Anything.Thank you! 
Cast & Crew Stories
 

Joan Macbeth – Writer, Director, Executive Producer
“The need to make a living in my twenties forced me to abandon my artistic dreams entirely. But one job led to another, to another; and when I started my own business, I felt that, in a way, it was a creative outlet. I wasn’t creating art, but I was creating something.” Joan’s success in the business world led to a windfall that enabled her to retire at the age of 42. Since then she has pursued her life-long goal of being a writer. A few years in, she discovered screenwriting and hasn’t looked back. “Every once in awhile, I even get paid to write something."
 


Stevie Jackson – Writer, Executive Producer, "Charlotte Chandler"
"The first time I got paid to act, it was right out of school. It was an original show for a fringe festival, and we all walked away with $50 each for four months' work. You do not want to break that down by the hour, but it was very exciting. I still have a photocopy of the cheque." Stevie knows intimately the balancing act that is pursuing a professional creative career while also paying the bills with a day job - something she's been doing for years. "As creatives, we accept that often most our money has to come from another source for quite a long time, but the feeling of getting paid to do what you love? There's just nothing like it."
 

Pam Kearns – "Louise Lassiter"
Pam’s love of acting began during her girlhood in Montreal. At age 17 she enrolled in full-time theatre school, playing lead roles in both classical and modern dramas. She was thrilled to book a part in a Hollywood film her final year of theatre school. Next she planned a move to Toronto to join the bustling film community there, but love intervened. “Or as they say, ‘Life is what happens when you’re busy making other plans!’” She met her husband John, and life and love put Pam’s acting career on hold. While raising their two children, Pam found a creative outlet as a professional chef. “I always knew I would return to acting,” Pam says. “The love of the art fuels me, and I am committed to my craft. Getting paid for it is like gravy – delicious gravy!”
 

Jane Avery – "Gabe Griffin"
“I think the ultimate goal for any actor or artist is to earn their living solely on their art, but I've yet to see it in my community. And I doubt I ever will. I've made my peace with that 100%.” Jane has been involved in the Vancouver acting community since 2007. “It's almost like a dirty secret that we have to have day jobs to make ends meet while pursuing our creative path. Even top-shelf local actors don't really talk about it, but I think we should because how else will the newbies get a grip on reality when they graduate? And how else will we begin to stop feeling bad about ourselves that we need these joe-jobs? But I'm happy to be here. We support each other, creating our own content, not waiting for the phone to ring.”
 

Mirella Gibeau – "Marigold"
As the eldest child of immigrant parents, Mirella felt a duty to pursue a “professional” career, even though her passion was in the arts. She became a teacher. “I loved teaching and it was an honour to nurture creativity, and witness some brilliant young artists find their voices. But my own artistic growth was shelved.” When she retired, Mirella relocated to Vancouver to revisit her love of acting. “Although this is a creative field, it is also a business. I am grateful I have a pension because it's super competitive and I'm up against women in my age demographic who've been in the industry for forty years. It takes money to invest in headshots, classes, media presence and networking. It's not easy. But it makes me feel more alive than I've felt in years!”
 

Shelley Janzé – "Head of Accounting"
Shelley began acting later in life, as her kids prepared to go off and build their own lives, and the empty nest was looming. With the support of her husband, she thought it would be fun to be in a commercial or two. One class led to another, which led to student and indie films, headshots, an agent, and, before she knew it, Shelley was hooked on acting. No empty nest syndrome for her. “Being financially secure, I’m fortunate that I don’t have to rely on making a living to pursue acting. Any paid gigs are icing on the cake.”
 
Sarah Hedar – Associate Producer“I once read a quote on a fridge magnet that said ‘Speak the truth, but leave immediately after,’ but what if you have spoken this truth to someone who has the power to hire you for a job - one that you need to make ends meet?” Sarah directed the original film Honestly Charlotte, and joins the team now as Associate Producer. “I was reminded of some of my own experiences juggling 'real' jobs while pursuing my own artistic endeavours. As Charlotte negotiates her need for work against her desire for a life as an artist, her perspective of the day-to-day grind struck a chord with me, and will perhaps also ring true for anyone else who has ever worked in an office.” Risks and ChallengesWe won't lie - honestly! Production and post-production delays sometimes happen and there's a possibility that we'll encounter unforeseen challenges that are beyond our control. We'll do everything we can to avoid that, but if it should happen, we promise to keep you updated the whole way. Frequently Asked Questions:Q. I see you are fundraising in Canadian dollars. Can I contribute from another country?A. Yes! Your credit card will be charged in your currency and we’ll receive Canadian dollars. In some cases, this means your money might go further. For instance, if you’re American and you donate $100 CAD, it will cost you about $75 USD.Q. What does a “flexible” goal mean?A. It means that the campaign isn’t all or nothing. If we don’t make our goal, we’ll still receive your contribution and it will go towards making the show.Q. What happens if you don’t make your goal? Will you still make the show? Will I still get my perk?A. Yes and yes, but it will all take us longer, because we’ll need to raise the rest of our budget. If that happens, we’ll keep you informed of our adjusted timelines.Q. What happens if you exceed your goal?A. First of all, we will be SO EXCITED. All “extra” funds will go toward making the highest quality show possible (better/more equipment, a bigger crew, etc.).Q. I want to help but I can’t contribute financially. Is there anything else I can do?A. First of all, we totally understand, and we so appreciate your support. The most helpful non-financial thing you can do is to help promote the campaign so it reaches more people. Thank you!Do you have a question we missed? Get in touch with us via the “ask a question” link above!Thanks again! We look forward to sharing Honestly Charlotte's journey with you.

story:
Become a Part of Skeleton Crew...

In December 2014, the first draft of a play called Skeleton Crew was completed. From the first read thru of this piece, it was clear the potential was there for something more. Since that time, thousands of people have tuned in to watch the adventures of Anthony, Hunter, and the rest of the characters in Skeleton Crew. The series has become a platform for people and ideas on the fringes of society, and will continue to do so as long as the series exists. Produced by SideKick Productions, whose mission is promoting size-blind casting whenever appropriate and possible, Skeleton Crew has connected with audiences in ways I never imagined. We have been fortunate enough to work with talent from all levels of the industry, including founder of Troma Studios and father of the Toxic Avenger, Lloyd Kaufman, who makes a cameo in Season One. We focus on LGBTQ themes heavily, and our connection with the bear community has brought us in contact with Bear World Media this past year. Bear World Media has licensed our series and we now appear on Revry.tv as well as YouTube.

 

Season Three

For Season Three, we are attempting to go bigger in scope. Skeleton Crew has been self-funded for the first two seasons, but doing so going forward and accomplishing all of our plans for Season Three will be difficult without outside assistance. Any donation we receive will go towards making this happen, including:

  • Rental of The WayStation, the fabulous bar which serves as our home away from home, MoneyShot$
  • Rental of studio space
  • Costumes
  • Set pieces 
  • Potential special FX
  • Potential short animation segment for Episode 9

Risks & Challenges

Season Three of Skeleton Crew has been completely written and is in pre-production. No matter what happens, we will be producing this season of the series. Therefore there are no risks involved, and the only challenges are on the production team figuring out how best to navigate the budget.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Tell your friends about the series. This is huge--the more people who watch Skeleton Crew on Revry.tv or YouTube, the more potential we have for sharing our wacky, zany, melodramatic-tragicomic view of the world!
  • Share our fund-raising efforts
  • Write to us and let us know what you think about the series. The cast and crew love to hear fan reactions, and your support means the world to us!

story:
Tired of saying, "There's nothing on TV?" Help make a genuine, thrilling Hollywood TV series pilot happen and you can get your name on the screen and imdb.com as an Associate Producer! We have begun the creation of a sleek series pilot, "Wolf's Curse" (working title). We find a young man living in the middle of a 9-year curse, forced to roam from town to town, periodically transforming into a fearsome wolf man--fleeing his family and friends for their own protection until the curse runs its course. This is a thriller, sci-fi, horror, fantasy series, with some good humor.

  • Tom Madigan is a writer, director and producer from the Midwest living and working in Los Angeles. Paula Swiatko is an actor and producer returning from radio to the screen for this project.
  • We are seeking to create a genuinely intriguing and entertaining TV pilot without studio support. It is important for us to produce the series pilot with the same people who would enjoy watching it, rather than force feed an audience.
  • Contributors can make their first mark in Hollywood as an associate producer, or simply contribute to making a high quality TV series pilot on a simple and straightforward budget.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are seeking $4,500 to cover the basic production costs such as: renting proper locations, feeding the cast and crew, hiring professionals to assist in sound recording, hair and make-up, and our basic transportation needs. These funds will truly help employ freelance artists in Los Angeles while creating your TV series pilot.
  • We are most excited to offer an Associate Producer screen credit and professional imdb.com credit to backers who contribute $200. An "Executive Producer" credit (screen and imdb) will be granted to those offering $2000 or more (we will limit these credits to 4). We are also offering a "financial backers" screen credit (without imdb credit) for those who offer $100. For those who would rather have a "thank you" or "special thank you" in the credits, we would love to out your name on screen with your donation of $25.
  • All funds will be directed to the project regardless if we reach our financial backing goal, because we are dedicated to making this series pilot come to life even if it has to come out of our own pockets.

The Impact

  • It's very important to keep art for the people, funded by the people.
  • Tom Madigan has produced/directed and completed dozens of independent films and series episodes, and has over 70 professional credits on imdb.com. Paula Swiatko is a successful radio host and actor in several Hollywood productions, studio and independent.
  • We are dedicated to bringing this show to you.

Risks & Challenges

We're not offering trinkets or autographs, or other things like that. We are offering (1) A real opportunity to help create a TV series pilot without studio support and (2) Legitimate producer credit that is seen as professional in the Hollywood industry. We are so grateful to have folks who support independent artists! We are happy to co-produce this TV pilot with you.

  • Tom Madigan is not only a writer, director, producer, and actor, but also a casting director, professional camera man and editor---and has made several movies with little or no crew. He has the ability to create and complete from start to finish, without studio support or an expensive post production facility. That is HUGE!

Other Ways You Can Help

You can also help us by spreading the word on social media and email!

  • Get the word out and make some noise about this show!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

Thank you so much in advance!

story:
“I want to give kids what I didn’t have a chance to experience growing up — never give up, it’s okay to be yourself, you don’t have to feel like an outcast just because how you act makes you different from everyone else. Ballooonieville is just that place where kids can go and escape for a moment in the day.”

—Louis Lucas, aka Louie Balloonie

 

With your investment, we will create a magical animated balloon utopia where negative experiences are transformed into mind-changing, attitude-shifting, toe-tapping, and spirit-lifting scenarios. This 6-part 3D animated video series will feature Louie Balloonie, our upbeat wizard; Mr. Needles, the sour villain; and a host of balloon creatures, unlike any creatures you’ve ever seen — a “never give up” dog, “a girl power” elephant, a “be yourself” panda, a “bravery” lion, and a “kindness” Giraffe.

Here’s how we’ll use the video series:

  • Grow our audience organically on YouTube and social media
  • Create lesson plans for early educators that will feature the videos and be focused on behavioral and experiential learning for young children
  • Seek a partnership with a streaming service like Netflix or a television network to spread our message to as many kids as possible!

Where Will The Funds Go?

  • Indiegogo Fees & Financial Transaction Fees 6.82%
  • Animation 16.51%
  • Music 7.44%
  • Choreography 3.46%
  • Project Consultation 23.07%
  • Marketing 9.40%
  • Curriculum Design and Development 4.08%
  • Cinematography 8.15%
  • Voiceover 7.34%
  • Sound Engineering 4.08%
  • Indiegogo Perks 9.66%

The Balloonieville series is hosted by Louis Lucas aka the Balloon Wizard “Louie Balloonie”. He created the Balloonieville series out of an intense desire to make the world a better place.

Louis' Story

Louis is determined, fearless, and passionate about creating a magical world where kids can escape troubled circumstances and feel true acceptance and love. Balloonieville and the desire to create it has intensely personal roots. At a young age, Louis found himself on a journey that would last several years and include homelessness, mental abuse, a suicide attempt, and brief confinement in a mental hospital.

Through sheer will and the kindness of others, Louis got a job at a school and started college. It was hard, but two things happened during this time that would shape Louis’ life purpose — one, he worked with children who had experienced difficulties like his and worse, who lived in poor areas where teachers funded anything glamorous or fabulous themselves; and two, he began to research business ideas where he could use his ample imagination. He discovered the extravagant world of balloon art being practiced around the globe and started a business.

As he practiced and learned balloon artistry, a character emerged who embodied everything Louis wanted to express — love, light, magic, acceptance. The Balloon Wizard Louie Balloonie was born!

In Balloonieville, we know how to change minds, hearts and spirits because we’ve Done, Done Did It before!

With our music videos and balloon entertainment, we have seen children come alive with enthusiasm. Our signature blend of balloons, imagination, and music is a proven vehicle to promote self love, equality, perseverance, girl power, and good old fashioned kindness.

“Done, Done Did It!” (above) is set in Balloonieville and provides a taste of the unique vision, exuberant visuals, and character’s stories that you can expect to see in the animated series. We’ve already invested in the “Done, Done Did It!” video, and we ask that you invest in yourself and your community by continuing to spread the message of equality and kindness through our animated series.

Balloonieville showcases an animated cast of fun and visually stunning characters made of balloons that represent the following:

Never Give Up & Believe In Yourself

Sonnie the Dog is a Balloon Alien that encourages kids and adults to never give up and never give in. If you believe in yourself. You can win! He uses his trusty bone to cast away bad aliens that try to invade and do bad things in the world.

  
 

Girl Power

Bella the Elephant is a Balloon Alien that inspires GIRL POWER! She uses her heart wand to cast away negative emotions and encourages girls to be the best they can be.

It’s Cool to Be Yourself

Poochie The Panda is a Hip-Hop Alien that spreads the important message of the best way to be cool is to be YOURSELF. You don’t have to follow the crowd. Stand up for what you believe in and most importantly, lead by example.

  
 

Be Brave & Conquer Obstacles in Life

Gonzo The Lion is a Balloon Alien that teaches you to be brave in everything you do. In order to conquer obstacles in your life, you must be brave. This will allow you to make it through any problems that are thrown your way!

Be Kind to Others

Sweetie the Giraffe is a Balloon Alien that demonstrates good old fashion kindness. She shows kids that kindness always beats out negativity and getting angry or upset right away. Take a deep breath, use kindness and you will always come out on TOP!

  
 

Lift Spirits

Louie Balloonie is a Balloon Wizard and the creator of Balloonieville. Out of his imagination, came every alien that lives in the city. He is the Godfather of all creatures and uses his magical staff to lift up everyone’s spirits.

Be Teachable

Mr. Needles is a bad Balloon Alien who always tries to sneak into Balloonieville and cause a ruckus amongst the people of Balloonieville. Mr. Needles and his sidekick, Peer Pressure, create misunderstandings and confusion that make others feel excluded. Peer Pressure is always teachable!

  

Louis Lucas

Louie specializes in a variety of balloon disciplines including life-sized installations that have been featured throughout the Greater Houston region. He created the Balloonieville series out of his experiences working with children.

Neil & Suzie Israel

Suzie and Neil, along with their team, transform the Balloonieville characters from still 2D illustrations to 3D animations. They are co-founders of the the e-Learning animation company, Sketchology.

Mia Hall

Mia is a trained dancer in all genres of dance. Along with dance, and being Louie’s Jr. Prop Master, she aspires to help and inspire others through art, whether it be in dance or balloons! Mia is also the marketing specialist for Balloonieville.

Yuki Llantero

Yuki collaborated with Louis to design the Balloonieville characters. A gifted illustrator and graphic designer, Yuki is a Fiverr Entrepreneur and holds a degree in Multimedia Arts and Design.

Masaya Tamegai

Masaya is a film maker from Oakland, California. He has worked closely with Ratatouille writer Jim Capobinaco, running animation workshops during the Bay Area International Children's Film Festival. He is best known for his music video work with Opie Hendrix, Boots Riley, and Tom Foti.

Dr. Roslynn Almas

Dr. Almas is a leadership coach and educational consultant who primarily works with female and minority entrepreneurs and business leaders. Dr. Almas is the creator of Growing Up With Pria and Eli, a childrens’ series that encourages learning, inquiry, diversity and inclusion. Dr. Almas is working with the Balloonieville team to design curriculum and lesson plans that will be integrated in the animated series.

Balloonieville Subjects Include:

  • Self Love
  • Courage
  • Kindness
  • Girl Power
  • Happiness
  • Inclusion
  • Anti-Bullying
  • Positivity
  

Who Balloonieville Is For:

  • Children Ages 3 - 9
  • Parents
  • Grandparents
  • Remote Educators
  • Classroom Educators
  • Schools
  • Religous Organizations
  • After School Programs

You Can Still Help In a Big Way!

If you have been touched by Balloonieville but can’t financially back us at this time, please take the time to share with your network on your social media pages and use hashtag #balloonieville. It would really help us out. You can reach more people than you think. If you know anyone that would like to watch Balloonieville, please let them know.
