Mr. Needles and his sidekick, Peer Pressure, create misunderstandings and confusion that make others feel excluded. Peer Pressure is always teachable!

 










Louis Lucas
Louie specializes in a variety of balloon disciplines including life-sized installations that have been featured throughout the Greater Houston region. He created the Balloonieville series out of his experiences working with children.



Neil & Suzie Israel
Suzie and Neil, along with their team, transform the Balloonieville characters from still 2D illustrations to 3D animations. They are co-founders of the the e-Learning animation company, Sketchology.





Mia Hall
Mia is a trained dancer in all genres of dance. Along with dance, and being Louie’s Jr. Prop Master, she aspires to help and inspire others through art, whether it be in dance or balloons! Mia is also the marketing specialist for Balloonieville.



Yuki Llantero
Yuki collaborated with Louis to design the Balloonieville characters. A gifted illustrator and graphic designer, Yuki is a Fiverr Entrepreneur and holds a degree in Multimedia Arts and Design.





Masaya Tamegai
Masaya is a film maker from Oakland, California. He has worked closely with Ratatouille writer Jim Capobinaco, running animation workshops during the Bay Area International Children's Film Festival. He is best known for his music video work with Opie Hendrix, Boots Riley, and Tom Foti.



Dr. Roslynn Almas
Dr. Almas is a leadership coach and educational consultant who primarily works with female and minority entrepreneurs and business leaders. Dr. Almas is the creator of Growing Up With Pria and Eli, a childrens’ series that encourages learning, inquiry, diversity and inclusion. Dr. Almas is working with the Balloonieville team to design curriculum and lesson plans that will be integrated in the animated series.




Balloonieville Subjects Include:

Self Love
Courage
Kindness
Girl Power
Happiness
Inclusion
Anti-Bullying
Positivity


 

Who Balloonieville Is For:

Children Ages 3 - 9
Parents
Grandparents
Remote Educators
Classroom Educators
Schools
Religous Organizations
After School Programs


You Can Still Help In a Big Way!If you have been touched by Balloonieville but can’t financially back us at this time, please take the time to share with your network on your social media pages and use hashtag #balloonieville. It would really help us out. You can reach more people than you think. If you know anyone that would like to watch Balloonieville, please let them know.

story:
Why Goodbye Friendly Buddy?

My name is Morgan Wright and I study film production at Emerson College with a focus in animation. I am in my Junior year and have had my work play on MTV and at the Cannes Short Film Corner. By contributing to this project, you will help our friendly buddies come alive in a tactile world and have their experiences reach audiences young and old. This project is my most ambitious yet and I have a talented cast and crew helping me bring this unique world to life.

Goodbye Friendly Buddy is a children's series I am directing as my thesis to earn my Bachelor's of Fine Arts degree from Emerson College. This project is deeply personal and very important to me. The series takes place in a world where the imaginary world and real world exist as one. It discusses issues of figuring out who you are and ideas behind gender fluidity. As I move into the "real" world after college, I wanted to make a series that analyzed how we perceive each other, often times solely based on our appearance. I want this series to acknowledge the discrimination that people may face because of how they identify or how they look. I truly hope that I am able to offer a  voice for children who feel like they sometimes don't belong in the world they live in. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need $2000 to help pay for fabrication tools and supplies. It takes more than a lot of hot glue and paints to build a whole series.
  • The cast and crew are volunteering a lot of their time to help on this project, so we would like to be able to feed them while they work. 

Where would the $2000 go?

Pre-production: $550

  • This would include the construction of props, supplies, and food for the crew. This is the most lengthy process of creating a stop-motion and we want to be able to purchase tools to help our crew be able to build props and sets in a more productive way.

Production: $250

  • We will be filming the stop-motion, buying the software for animating, purchasing green-screens and extra hard drives to store the films. 

Post-Production: $150

  • We will be editing the final product in this stage.

Marketing: $250

  • This includes creating and distributing merchandise like posters, stickers, and anything else that we can do to get GFB out to the general public. 

Film Festival Fees: $450 

  • After this film is made, we want to send it out to different festivals to let this series be seen by more people! 

Contingency: $350

  • We need to set aside money in case of any emergencies!

By donating money, we can offer you original artwork from our creative team and some customizable miniatures as well. We will also be giving away signed copies of the scripts and limited edition stickers. Original props used in the production will be available as well.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help! We would love for you to share this page with all of your friends, family, and anyone that may be interested in this project. Please like us on Facebook and Instagram! We appreciate you all so much. 

https://www.facebook.com/goodbyefriendlybuddy/

https://www.instagram.com/goodbyefriendlybuddy/

story:
Christina Faith noticed a severe lack of material featuring the African American demographic ages 18-34. It seemed that most of the "Black Shows" were either for an older audience or reality driven. The intent was to fill that void by being extremely intentional about not using heavy profanity or nudity.​

We've been featured in Ebony Magazines, Shadow and Act, Black Talent Tv and more. 

We have three goals with Single and Anxious.

  1. Produce a digital series that is 100% independently  produced with an inclusive  crew.

  2. Display characters that are incredibly relatable where each viewer can connect instantly with at least one character.
  3. Introduce the show to a wider audience in the U.S. and Internationally.

What we will use the money for?

Principal Photography May-July 2018.

Post Production  August- October 2018.

Premiere Screening - December 2018.

Mass Marketing- December- February 2019.

Release-  February 2019.

Your support is extremely important. We've done all we can do with the resources we've had at our disposal and now we’d love for you to partner with us”!

Thank you so much for your support!

story:
Project Summary

Buckle up! Chacha is ready to take your kids to a fascinating world of Bengali folklore, mythical creatures and breathtaking adventures. We are working on creating the first ever 3d animated series in Bangla, that will help children develop critical thinking, empathy and an appreciation for the rich heritage of Bengali culture.

What We Need & How We'll Use It

The campaign goal is to raise funds which will allow us to produce 3 episodes of roughly 10 minutes each.

  • $60,000 covers cost of producing 3 full episodes. The funds will be used to cover the cost of the animation team, overheads, production team and post-production expenses.
  • In case of partial funding, the budget will be used to produce the number of episodes for which costs are covered.
  • After the launch of the 3-episode mini series, we will launch the full first season through sponsorship.

What You Get

Many of us often say - there needs to be quality Bangla content, especially for children. We grew up exploring fantastic worlds of folklore crafted by the likes of Dakshinaranjan, Upendrakishore, Sukumar and countless others. Yet as the new generation explores a brand new world of remarkable animation and stunning visuals, there is a big dearth of world class Bangla content that carries the rich heritage of Bengali culture.

This is your chance to make a difference yourself. This is the moment when you have a direct say in whether such content is created or not. Why should you participate?

  • To be the part of a historic project which a whole generation of children will cherish for years to come
  • To get exclusive access to the full episodes before they are released in public.
  • To have your name or your child's name included in the episodes.
  • A whole bunch of other benefits - see perks section to get all the details.

How Will It Benefit the Kids?

As you can see from the trailer, this will be the first of its kind 3d animated series. We are building this with children in mind, fine-tuning the script based on children's reaction to the videos. Our objectives are:

  • Help children grasp the rich heritage of Bengali folklore and literature
  • Develop critical reasoning skills when faced with challenges
  • Nurture a sense of empathy when dealing with individuals with different values
  • Enhance their power of imagination

Future Plans

After launching a full first season, our ambition is to reach out to global content platforms such as Netflix, Amazon Prime, BBC Kids, etc. and launch multilingual versions of our series across the world. This can create a fantastic platform for showcasing Bengali culture to a global audience.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you would like to contribute via local channels, or simply share some of your suggestions, don't hesitate to give us a shout at hello@mvrk.tv

story:
Short Summary

Roddy Aloha!!!

  • Emmy Collins and Jason White have been working in film and TV for more decades than they'd like to admit.
  • We want to bring our favorite character Roddy Aloha to life as a TV or Web Series.
  • Your contributions will enable us to film a pilot/sizzle we can use to market our show.

What We Need & What You Get

Breakin' it down:

  • We need $7500 to shoot our 15 minute pilot/sizzle that will be used to pay local cast and crew as well as for equipment rental and post-production.
  • We have several levels of unique, Hawaiian and Roddy Aloha-themed perks!
  • If we don't reach our maximum goal we still intend to film the pilot with whatever budget we can, but the $7500 would ensure we get the best possible result.

The Impact

Here's the difference your contribution will make:

  • Our project is important because the world needs more comedy, especially Hawaiian comedy.
  • Emmy and Jason have been making people laugh (intentionally and unintentionally) for many years!

Risks & Challenges

  • Film and TV are admittedly high risk ventures, but with high risk comes high reward.
  • We will use our years of experience as well as a stellar cast and crew to make the best short video possible.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Share our campaign with all you family and friends, and be sure to post on all your social media!!!
  • If you're cast or crew in the Hilo area, we may need your talents!!!

story:
Welcome,

On behalf of Julito McCullum and the team over at 20seven Productions we thank you for visiting this Indiegogo Campaign!

This Indiegogo Campaign is to fund the Pilot episode of our TV series "Change". We will be shooting mid December to have it ready to pitch to cable networks and streaming services during 2018's pilot season which is Jan-March.

This TV series follows three friends on a journey to be on the A-list in the entertainment industry, but first they must overcome the struggles of their day to day life. 

Julito McCullum has been an actor for over 14 years, he's most known for his lead roles in TV series such as HBO's "The Wire", The N's "Miracles Boys" (directed by Spike Lee), "Law and Order", "Blue Bloods", as well as films such as "Akeelah and the bee", "The Inevitable defeat of Mister and Pete",  "Brotherly Love", as well as many other projects. He is now stepping into the creator side of the business in creating his own TV series where he is the writer, producer and actor on the project. He's brought on an amazing director, Michael "boogie" Pinckney, who is Spike Lee's protege, who's been in the business for over 20 years, and a brilliant new writer Victoria D. Sharpe to create the series "Change".

As an actor for over a decade Julito decided it was time to share his story, as well as others and create a series that shows what artist REALLY go through in the entertainment industry.

 

The team of "Change"

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise $20,000 in 20 days! #20for20

We've included some really awesome perks for your donations! Such as an autographed copy of season four of "The wire", 1 on 1 acting lessons with Julito, production T-shirts, personal thank you videos, and producer credits, among other items

 

 

The Impact

In a time where there is a resurgence of stories from people of color on TV, with shows like, "Atlanta", "Insecure", & "This Is Us", we believe there is a great place for "Change" to thrive on a Television Network such as HBO, Showtime, Starz, etc, or even on a streaming network such as, Netflix, Amazon, & Hulu.

 

 

Why do we need the money?

By donating you will be supporting us with the overall production of the Pilot episode.

Any dollar amount plays a huge part in the success of the Television series in a whole.

We are independently financing this project, and we are making sure the quality is one of a major television series even before we actually began pitching to networks. That means, shooting with the best cameras in the business, making sure the cast/crew is well taken cared of, and making sure we have the insurance needed for locations, and equipment, hair/makeup, wardrobe, catering, and post production (editing).

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, that's okay! You can still help us get the word out!

Follow the "Change: The TV Series" social media handles.

Instagram: @ChangeTheTVSeries

Facebook: @ChangeTheTVSeries

Share this Indiegogo link to your friends & family.

Thank you all so much! with Love. - 20seven Productions.

#ChangeTheTVSeries

story:
We're All Just Trying to Catch Breaks In Life Aren't We?
 

In This Series We See Raw And Real Content Of The Everyday Life Hustle As Well As The Trials That Come Along While On The Pursuit Of One’s Dreams & Goals. This Project Allows its viewers To See The Transparency Of A Single Mother Exposing Her Fears And Insecurities, While Balancing Work, Life, Friends And A Relationship. It Is Sure To Tug On The Hearts Of All Dreamers And Go-Getters Who Don’t Let Trials And Tribulation Determine Their Destiny.

In Season 1 We Introduce:

Atiyyah, A Single Mother Who Recently Relocated From Miami, Florida With Hopes Of Becoming An Actress.

Puma, A Young Mother Who’s Set On Getting Rid Of The Dysfunctional Cycle Of Her Family By Starting A New Path.

Chivas, A Young Woman Whose Sole Purpose Is To Help Her Child’s Father Become A Legal Resident.

Sandy, A Woman WhoTends to Run From Reality But Realizes That Her Race May Soon Be Over .

Rosa , An Older Woman Who Is Determined To Fake It Until She Makes It.​This Campaign Is For the Production Of A Compelling, Heartfelt and Diverse New series Titled Catching Breaks. This 8 Part Saga Interweaves 5 Characters Who Work In The Same Emergency Room In Compton, California. We See As the Story Unravels That they All Share The Commonality Of Hoping to Catch a..You guessed it, Break While on the Pursuit of Survival in Los Angeles. We invite you to take a further look at our Campaign and Become a part of The Catching Breaks Family

Help us Catch our Break!

The 5,000 we raise for Catching Breaks will go towards all the goodies that are needed to make our dream into a reality such as,  permits, insurance, hospital sets, Director of photography, sound (mixer, boom set), gaffer and lights, craft services, hair and make-up, props, scoring, editing, publicity & distribution and closed captioning. If we do not meet our goal (which hopefully with your help) We Will! But no matter this project will go on and we hope you can be part of this journey too

Not only does your contribution help us but we have some Dope perks for you too!

Perks Inlcude:

                        Thank You Email                   

                        Social Media Shoutout

                        Sneak Peek Of Season 1

                        Skype Call With Creators

                        Special Thanks Credit

                        Private Meet & Greet With the Stars

                        Paint & Sip With the Stars

                       Travel To Set

                       Executive Producer Imdb Credit & Autographed Poster

                       Dinner & Dancing With The Stars

The Impact

Due to the demand of living here in Los Angeles and being a single mother, I am afraid that without your assistance we will not be able to get this amazing series online.

Risks & Challenges

Some of the challenges we face include getting permits for the hospital sets and securing locations that are withing our budget. Sharing one's art with the world is always risky however we have such faith in Cathcing breaks and hold high hopes that people will love and connect with our project

…In the words of Erykah Badu “Now keep in mind that we’re artists and we’re sensitive about our Sh*t”.

Broke, but like what we're about?

We know times are tough and we are all working hard for that money. If you are finding yourself short on funds but like what you see there's still plenty you can do to help! Follow us on Social Media and help us spread the word! Tell your friends, family and everyone you know!

Risks & Challenges
Some of the challenges we face include getting permits for the hospital sets and securing locations that are withing our budget. Sharing one's art with the world is always risky however we have such faith in Cathcing breaks and hold high hopes that people will love and connect with our project
…In the words of Erykah Badu “Now keep in mind that we’re artists and we’re sensitive about our Sh*t”.

Broke, but like what we're about?
We know times are tough and we are all working hard for that money. If you are finding yourself short on funds but like what you see there's still plenty you can do to help! Follow us on Social Media and help us spread the word! Tell your friends, family and everyone you know!

story:
Hey everyone, Banner's Predicament is back with our second episode!  Our first episode was an absolute success thanks to help from you, and after 10 sci-fi conventions and screenings around the country, we're revved up to do it again!! 

Here's a blurb from our first episode's fundraiser:

"Our team includes veteran filmmakers and actors as well as scientists and programmers, who grew up watching the re-runs of the 1978-1983 TV show 'The Incredible Hulk' and absolutely loved it.  In fact, it inspired many of us to pursue the careers we've chosen.  We are producing (a second!) episode continuing the sophistication and spirit of the show.

Many of us have joined this project to honor the memory or give tribute to Actors Bill Bixby, Lou Ferrigno, and Jack Colvin, as well as the original show's Executive Producer Ken Johnson and amazing Composer Joe Harnell; to familiarize cutting edge science in a fictional fun setting; and simply for the celebration of this fantastical world!"

Check out the opening title sequence to the first episode:

 

Whereas David's last experience took us to the secret desert laboratories of the southwest, this episode takes us to the music scene in the back streets of Baltimore.  (Yet we still sneak some techy stuff into the plot!)

We're honored to be featuring the talent of professional musician Josh Christina. 

 

This episode has more ACTION scenes and STUNTS with the Creature...

 

delves deeper into the endearing yet afflicted character of David Banner...

 

and also gives us more of the tenacious, but graceful, Jack McGee...

 

 

Our budget of $7500 includes set rental, post production, musical composition, actors' expenses, meals, props, and make-up.  All funds raised will go completely to the production of the show.

We're stepping things up in this episode with:

1) additional state of the art camera, lighting, and sound equipment

2) an assistant director to help sequence and manage Roll B shots

3) an expanded editing team

4) more stunts

and...

5) a professional band

We're very efficient and feel the amount we're raising is reasonable considering the resources required and the professional, sophisticated production that will be delivered. 

We also thank those many people who are volunteering their time and resources.   

 

This is a non-profit project.  All funds raised will be used for the production of the show.  All screening and viewings will be for free.  We will not sell it, nor sell ads over it, nor charge at all to view it. We state that we do not own any rights to The Incredible Hulk and we are not affiliated with Disney or Marvel Entertainment.   We do not use the name or phrase "Hulk" for the show (except to mention this is a fan film inspired thereby).

story:
Let's face it - we need Ed the Sock now more than ever!

The world's gone crazy! Fake news, alternative facts, alt.right, RadLeft, safe spaces, micro-aggressions, privilege, cultural appropriation, tiki torches, insane loud  voices on the Left and Right shouting at each other and nobody to tell them all to SHUT THE HELL UP - but with humour, not anger, so we can go back to laughing again!

Ed the Sock has always been the one to call bullsh*t, fearlessly speaking truth to power, bringing celebrities down to our level, cutting through the spin and saying what we think, but out loud.

Ed the Sock has returned and FUN - The FU_Network is his home base! An online channel that revives the free-wheeling spirit of classic Muchmusic with honest, unpredictable, surprising and FUN content!

Politics, music, pop culture, current affairs, comedy, video gaming & tech, viral videos that speak to us and for us, just like Ed.

Yes, this means the return of Fromage in a weekly series called The Cheesy History of Music Videos and an updated Speakers Corner called Speakers Bureau, a new game show in the vein of the classic Test Pattern series and more returning favourites and faces, like Rick Campanelli and Rainbow Sun Francks, and expect Strombo to drop by too.

But FU_Network uses the past as fuel for the future, and we have a slate of brand-new content with fresh new faces that are building their careers in front of our eyes. You can find a listing of some of the new shows at funetwork.tv.

Shooting the Sh*t, the world's first celebrity talk show from a public bathroom; Brew Wizards Beer Quest mixes craft beer & comedy; Mensplaining is men talking to men about being men with a strong dose of humour; Lady Bits is video games meets women's issues; Is This Racist? looks at modern race issues with a sharp satirical edge; FU_Politics is a pundit-free zone talking about issues with humour & common sense; Hey Ladies is women talking to women the way women really talk, aided by a shared bottle of wine. These are the tip of the iceberg, there is much more to come, including Ed the Sock's Fromage spin-off series, No BS Biographies.

The FU_Network is more than an online channel, it's an attitude, an energy, a spirit that's been absent in Canadian media since the end of Muchmusic. We all miss it, we all need it back and we're going to join together to make it so.

Become a backer of the future of Canadian media by Canadians, for Canadians, that the rest of the world can share in too. Your support will go to buying us cameras and livestream equipment that doesn't constantly break down, microphones without duct tape holding them together, locations we can do our shoots from and some cash to keep our staff eating and Ed supplied with cheap cigars.

Join the campaign - It's time to see media stop throwing fits and start throwing Christmas trees off roofs.

story:
HELLO, YOU CHUBBY LITTLE BASTARDS!

Powered By Ice Cream is a show about Eric. Eric loves ice cream and junk food. Like the great explorers before him, Eric relentlessly scours the aisles of grocery stores looking for the newest, most intriguing flavors of junk so you don’t have to. He’s like a white trash Magellan.

But Eric’s penchant for junk food almost ruined his life. Eric struggled with Binge Eating Disorder for many years. The very food that brought him so much joy destroyed his physical and mental health.

With therapy and the support of his family, Eric made peace with food and found a way to keep his savory and sweet treats. Now, his mission in life is to promote a positive body image and tell you about his latest confectionary conquest.  Eric is living proof that you can have your ice cream cake and eat it, too.

WARNING! WHAT YOU ARE ABOUT TO SEE IS BORDERLINE PORNOGRAPHIC

Gobs of hot fudge, the thickest chocolate chunks you’ve ever seen, freshly sugar-coated nuts…this is going to get graphic.

Sure, you’ve heard of the #foodporn trend, but Eric takes it to the next level. He’s going to show you EVERYTHING. Your eyes will not be able to unsee caramelized pretzels, potato chips, and buttery Ritz crackers entangled with M&Ms and whole Peanut Butter Cups--all loving swirled into vanilla bean ice cream.  

If you’ve never been attracted to a bowl of ice cream, soon you will be. 

YOU ARE THE COOL RANCH TO OUR DORITOS LOCOS TACOS

The Powered By Ice Cream pilot is already shot, but we need your help.  We know that giving up your hard earned money is a big deal, particularly when you could use it to buy something with the word "nougat" on the wrapper. 

When you support this campaign, you will help us finish the editing process, complete sound design, and finalize post production.  Most importantly, you will also help us bring this show to everyone. We're almost there!  Upon completion, we will begin meeting with interested parties about the details of launch which will result in Eric turning into the globes most recognizable consumer of baked goods.  Powered By Ice Cream is something the world needs.  It’s unapologetic. It’s brutally honest. It’s going to make you hungry. Here is your opportunity to be a part of a show that is totally unique and focuses on humanity’s life source: Hydrogenated Oil--and other yummy un-pronounceable stuff.

GET YER PERKS!

This is ‘Merica and we don’t believe in getting somethin’ for nutin’!  Besides the bragging rights that go along with contributing to the Powered By Ice Cream pilot, you’ll also be rewarded deliciously.

YOU NEED THIS IN YOUR LIFE!

Can't help financially right now? Spread the word about Powered By Ice Cream like it's Cheetos cheese dust (That sh!t gets everywhere!).  Use those social media accounts and deliver the good news about a show that is actually worth watching.

story:
"HIDE" 

Will be a web series written, produced and directed by Jennifer Nash (me !) After acting for over 25 years in TV series like Star Trek Next Gen, Full House, Coach, Home Improvement, Sliders, and a bunch more - I've decided it's my turn to tell a story. 

"Hide" is a web series that is my absolute passion project. It's a sci-fi series that lends itself to social justice messages as all of the amazing Star Trek series have always done. But it's nothing like Star Trek. The first ten minute episode was filmed in the Pittsburgh area and cost $2,500 to get "in the can". Now, I hope to raise enough money to finish editing episode 1 and continue on with the next seven episodes.

If you contribute funding to this project, you may be part of something very big - and certainly something very cool. I'm creating a NON PROFIT production company to produce this series that will be the first of it's kind in the United States of America. And I think it's about time. The FIRST production company (that I've been able to find anyway) that will offer EQUAL PAY FOR EQUAL WORK across the board in the U.S. Including actors. Including everyone.  Anyone who knows the entertainment industry knows that women tend to make much less than men across the board. If one looks at  actors' salaries, the contrast is staggering. 

The two other Golden Rule tenets this production company will hold itself to are:

No sexual or emotional harassment of anyone. EVER. NO toxic work environment.

Environmental responsibility INSISTED on by all at our Non Profit, including all vendors.

 

Help us make a kick ass web series that you will LOVE and help us change the world for the better by doing so. I'm tired of words and broken promises. I want to DO, BUILD, CREATE, CHANGE.

Contributors of $100 or more will receive some sweet "Hide" swag. 

Contributors of $1000 or more get some sweet swag and an Associate Producer Credit .

Contributors of $5,000 or more will receive some sweet swag, Associate Producer credit and a "billboard" at the end of an episode.

Contributors of of $10,000 or  more will get all of the above and an Executive Producer Credit - which comes with a stake in the game and a walk on part written JUST for THEM (or your daughter or nephew - anyone you choose to give it to!) 

Contributors at ANY level will receive my undying gratitude and personal thanks!

I know making any kind of content like this sounds risky, but I've been plugging away and learning from the best for an awful long time.  Eight 10 minute episodes at $5,000 a piece is entirely doable with all the passionate actors and film makers I've met in the Pittsburgh area who are more than willing to work for low or no pay - that brings us to $40,000.  But since I HAVE been learning from the best - I'm asking for $50,000 to cover all that can and will go wrong plus MARKETING money! 

My intention is to sell this series to one of the BIG ones after we have our total proof of concept and a built in audience! Come in at the beginning and share the ride. It's going to exciting!

If you can't spare any cash right now, please help us by sharing the word, high and low! Social media, old fashioned talking, smoke signals, share the You Tube trailer!!!! 

If you're in Pittsburgh or close - reach out to me during Hiatus of MINDHUNTER and volunteer to make breakfast on the set, or hold a boom - any and all help is appreciated and welcome SOOO SOOO much!!! If you want to audition for the series or help in other ways, find Hide on FaceBook and message us! @Hidetheseries

THANKS MILLION and THANKS for SHARING!!!

Jennifer

story:
Hello!

My name is Meg Calcaterra, and I'm a working artist originally hailing from Bayonne, NJ. I grew up in an Italian-American, and Irish-American household. When I was younger I was lucky enough to have a great-grandmother who sailed from Ireland to come to America to achieve the "American Dream". This series that I have created is a love letter to my family. It is based on "the Children of Lir", and other Irish fairy-tales I was told as a kid. Our series, "Darling Child", is about friendship, loyalty, and falling in love with a perfect stranger. There's some magic, some drama, and of course, some humor. By donating to our campaign, you will be apart of something as magical as the story. We have a predominately female cast,  a female show-runner, a female creator, and a queer writer. Everything is about acceptance, and creating content that we don't see everyday. 

What the heck is this even about?

Darling Child, is about Alannah, a college drop out, that starts to have mysterious dreams that come true. She sets out on an adventure with her best friend, and her co-worker, to discover what exactly is going on with her. Along her journey, she discovers what her families history is, and falls in love with a perfect stranger. 

What can I do to help?

Easy answer, tell everyone you know about our campaign! If you can't donate, don't worry! We want people to know that we are looking for help. If you're an artist, and want to help with the project, shoot me an email. If you want to donate, please do! Anything you can give is helpful, and will hopefully bring us to our goal. 

The funding is going towards renting equipment, renting spaces, and giving back to those who have helped us already. No one is getting paid to work on this project. All of the cast and crew are volunteers. We are involved in the project, because we believe in it, and love the story we are telling. If we cannot reach our goal, we will using all of the money that we raised to create the best possible piece of art as possible.

All of our perks are going to be given to people who give money. If you can only give 1 dollar, we will give you a shout out, and a thank you message. If you give us all of our money, we will be forever grateful, and we will give you everything that we are offering to people. Our perks are specialized, and we want to make everything as special as possible for our backers. 

Thank you for reading this message! My team, and I are excited to start to work on our project!

story:
Short Summary

my name is Jonathan Gibson and I am the creator of, what I hope will become a reality not just online but on your television also. so a little about my self. I am a 35 year old father of three living in Midland Michigan. recently I had to deal with the unthinkable, which was losing my wife suddenly.  The pain never leaves, but I am starting to smile at our memories together. One of the things that has helped me through this was writing the first episode to 'MI Crime S.V, doing this helped me to keep my mind on something positive.  My wife was a huge fan of shows like this and I know she would love it if she were here with us.  I hope raise this money so that I can put my idea into a reality. With episode one already written, I feel that it has potential. 

The aim through this campaign is to raise enough revenue to be able to create the pilot episode and get in on streaming and possibly even local broadcasting stations.  as you can imagine this is not a cheap project and we need a lot of input to make this work. 

If you contribute to this project you will be helping me turn my idea into a reality. This project has helped me focus on what is true and not to go down the wrong path.  I also feel it will bring a show to an audience that normally would not watch a crime show. 

What We Need & What You Get

We are in need of funds to cover: 

Travel Expenses for Cast/Crew

Housing Expenses for Cast/Crew 

Advertising and post marketing. 

Equipment, (Top of the line film equipment)

Promotional products. 

Risks & Challenges

With any project there are risks, this is no exception, however, we will strive to follow though with this project, and will only stop if we have no other choice. any money that can be returned, will be returned

Other Ways You Can Help

SHARE THIS WITH FRIENDS AND FAMILY. If you cant donate, purchase our Official T Shirt. Most Importantly PRAY THAT GODS WILL BE DONE.

my name is Jonathan Gibson and I am the creator of, what I hope will become a reality not just online but on your television also. so a little about my self. I am a 35 year old father of three living in Midland Michigan. recently I had to deal with the unthinkable, which was losing my wife suddenly.  The pain never leaves, but I am starting to smile at our memories together. One of the things that has helped me through this was writing the first episode to 'MI Crime S.V, doing this helped me to keep my mind on something positive.  My wife was a huge fan of shows like this and I know she would love it if she were here with us.  I hope raise this money so that I can put my idea into a reality. With episode one already written, I feel that it has potential. 
The aim through this campaign is to raise enough revenue to be able to create the pilot episode and get in on streaming and possibly even local broadcasting stations.  as you can imagine this is not a cheap project and we need a lot of input to make this work. 
If you contribute to this project you will be helping me turn my idea into a reality. This project has helped me focus on what is true and not to go down the wrong path.  I also feel it will bring a show to an audience that normally would not watch a crime show. 

What We Need & What You Get
We are in need of funds to cover: 
Travel Expenses for Cast/Crew
Housing Expenses for Cast/Crew 
Advertising and post marketing. 
Equipment, (Top of the line film equipment)
Promotional products. 

Risks & Challenges
With any project there are risks, this is no exception, however, we will strive to follow though with this project, and will only stop if we have no other choice. any money that can be returned, will be returned

Other Ways You Can Help
SHARE THIS WITH FRIENDS AND FAMILY. If you cant donate, purchase our Official T Shirt. Most Importantly PRAY THAT GODS WILL BE DONE.

story:
THE WORLD IS ADRIFT, 
SEARCHING FOR DIRECTION!

In an era where information is literally at the tips of our fingers, we witness an ever present longing in the hearts of our friends and neighbors around us.  People searching for meaning; searching for contentment; searching for fulfilment; searching for answers; searching for truth; searching for love; searching for guidance.  
LighthouseTV Online intends to be a beacon of light in these blind times - a resource to illuminate the path to the redeeming love of God, who supplies all of our needs and quenches the longings in our hearts.

 

WHAT 'S THE PLAN?

Just as The Message translates Matthew 5:14-16, we're going public! We want to take the faith to a whole new level, using the medium of the day - video.  We're creating LighthouseTV Online, a web series, for publication via the most widely used social media platforms (currently): Facebook and YouTube.

 

THE IMPACT!

With your promotional and financial help, we will become a beacon of light for the billions of active daily users watching on these social media platforms. 

 

HOW WILL YOUR MONEY HELP?

From providing a yummy latte to our guests to funding the audio and visual equipment below, your contributions will help take this mission to a greater level of excellence.

  • Dual Lavalier Microphones
  • VideoMicro Compact On-Camera Microphone
  • Portable Digital Recorder
  • 160 LED Video Photo Light for Digital DSLR
  • Set of Two 7 feet Photography Light Stands
  • PANASONIC LUMIX GH4 Body 4K Mirrorless Camera
  • Apple Compressor

 

SO STAY WITH US...

Through this process, we'd love if you'd continue to pray with and for us, send in your prayer requests and praise reports, and check in for updates as shooting beings. 

Reach us by email: connect@lighthouseTV.online

story:
#WeLiveHeritage is an innovative 7-format pilot webseries to creatively explore all of the critical & conscious issues inside of the Latinx/@/a/o community. Created by the dynamic host, Maximo, in order to stimulate minds around social justice dialogue as an alterative to the "junk food" most are exposed to online.

The Problem

  • Ultimately, people want to be entertained. They are attracted to talent; they want to laugh. We have to use this train of thought to make them think.
  • We have to implement and try some new strategies to create positive, social change
  • Latino community isn't taken seriously; jokes; still seen as a minority; issues are not acted on, etc
  • Representation-wise, if all of our people see us as stereotypes (thugs, drug-dealers, cholas, hoodrats, etc.) in the mainstream media, this is all we will be
  • Very few Latinx/@/a/o intellectuals are being pushed in the mainstream markets 
  • We have no place to come together, find common ground; no venue to discuss our issues with ways to draw-in new followers and retain our own (most opportunities we have remain for "elite")

We Need Our Own Platform

Bring "conference feel" with entertainment-spin to the people; the people who need it in, a variety of formats

  1. Late Night - Think Arsenio Hall meets Stephen Colbert 
  2. Pod Blast - Podcast to interview and synthesize Latinx/@/a/o issues 
  3. Night Live - Saturday Night Live with all Latino cast and woke content
  4. Max Talk - TedTalks for Latino intellectuals
  5. Dinner Talks - Food unites and the dinner table is court/church!
  6. View Points -  Panel of engaging rockstars to cross-reference viewpoints 
  7. Field Flow - In the field, going to our people and highlighting humanity

What Will Make It Different?

  • Live audiences exposed to critical content
  • First of its kind variety show to highlight Latino issues, with respect to our African, Indigenous, and European roots
  • Different formats, in order to reach different audiences
  • Viewership as championing the cause of social justice
  • Part of multicultural & inclusive movement for equality, justice, and fairness
  • Less gossip that distracts and prevents progress
  • Production value
  • Establishes San Antonio as a progressive yet still cultural destination location 

Issues to Discuss

Discussing all of the hot button, cutting edge items & current events that our people should be hearing:

  • Colorism
  • Classism 
  • Mental Health
  • Economic Empowerment & Equality
  • Education
  • Politics
  • Race
  • The Arts
  • Sports

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share
  • Donate
  • Spread the word

 

Contact Founder & Creator Maximo Anguiano today for inquiries and questions at maximo.anguiano@gmail.com

story:
THE WHY

America has an addiction. It affects 43 million people and 36.5% of households. And that drug…is dogs. Frequent “regulars” at our local dog park, we discovered that dog parks are like bars, unique places where people from different backgrounds, religions, races, and creeds all come together under one unifying blanket: instead of hooch, it’s pooches. You may not know where they're from or what they do (and you definitely only know them by their dog’s name), but in the moments where your fur babies are playing with each other, for an hour you guys are connected. However, did you ever wonder who these people really are when they leave the park?

THE SERIES
With High Maintenance’s anthology format and Christopher Guest’s comedic tone, The Dog Park tells individual stories of people who all attend the same dog park. Each episode will follow one character home or to work or to a different aspect of their life and then comedically explore the contrast between who they are at the park and who they are in real life. For example, somebody who is dominant at the park may be submissive at home. Or someone who is “park popular” may in reality live a lonely life. Each episode thereby acts like its very own short film except (surprise!) our cast of actors will also rotate characters, playing different people in each episode à la Documentary Now.

MEET THE PACK

HONORA TALBOTT (aka Ms. Jackson's Mom) - Producer, Director, Writer, Actor

Honora is an actor, writer, and director and yep, the H is silent. She hails from Northern Virginia and graduated from Amherst College. Her satirical sketches have gone viral and been written up many times in top blogs (like Huffington Post, US Weekly, Bustle, The AV Club, Entertainment Weekly and many more). As a writer, her TV Spec Script won GRAND PRIZE in the Hollywood Screenplay Contest and she was named a Quarterfinalist in Screencraft's Comedy Screenplay Contest and the Creative World Awards. She recently directed and starred in her first short film We Know Where You Live, a comedic thriller about gentrification.

BILL POSLEY (aka Ms. Jackson's Dad) - Producer, Director, Writer, Actor

Bill actually served as a soldier in the United States Army. Shortly after basic training, he was sent to Iraq. After serving 15 months overseas, he accumulated all the footage he had taken during his tour and made a short documentary about his time over in the middle east. The documentary got him into film school.  As a comedian, he is an alumni from UCB, I.O. and Second City. Fun Fact: he was also on “Survivor.” Recently he was in the 2017 CBS Diversity Showcase, was a 2017 JFL New Face: Characters and just got off this Season of MacGyver. Upcoming credits include Netflix's Glow and Fox's 9-1-1.

BENTE ENGELSTOFT (aka Charlie’s Mom) - Producer, Writer, Actor

Bente is a Los Angeles based actor, writer and Chicago transplant. While in the windy city, Bente wrote and performed for the stages of iO Chicago, Second City and The Annoyance Theatre. Since moving to Los Angeles, Bente has participated in the CBS Diversity Showcase as a writer in 2016 and as a performer in 2017.

JONATHAN COLOMB (aka Charlie’s Dad) - Producer, Writer

Jon is a comedy writer and director in Los Angeles, CA. His comedy career started  at the iO Chicago theater, where he quickly learned that he was so much better on the page than on the stage Jonathan moved to Los Angeles where he has continued to write, produce, and direct digital content including the digital series Stakeout which he directed and produced with Bente Engelstoft.

HOW YOUR BONES WILL BE BUDGETED

10% of all donations will go to Best Friends Animal Society, a national animal welfare organization dedicated to ending the killing of dogs and cats in America’s shelters. Learn more at https://bestfriends.org. The rest will be allocated as follows...

Thank you for making it this far! Woof. You're already a champion in our books. If you dig the project, but can't contribute financially, we'd still be thrilled if you liked our Facebook Page and shared with a friend!

story:
"Set entirely in their one-bedroom apartment in Los Angeles, CA, Slightly Crowded follows three girls with different jobs, lifestyles and sleeping habits all sharing the same closet, among other things. As they individually try to forge their own paths and find their own way, they discover that the only possible way to succeed is if they're in it together... And sometimes even then, they still fail."

Hello! My name is Tessa Rao, and I'm a recent acting graduate currently in LA. After living for a year with 6 girls in a crowded 2 bedroom apartment, I started to realise the ups, downs and endless humour that came with it. I began writing a script, and cut to a few months later, we are in the process of filming the Pilot Episode of "Slightly Crowded"!

But we need your help. 

This project has so much potential, but with a great project comes the great need for funding. "Slightly Crowded" fills a space in today's market that our team believes needs to be filled. Anyone who has left home has most likely experienced a similar living situation, and anyone who hasn't, probably will - crowded, messy, sometimes conflicted, but ultimately an experience that helps you grow and teaches you who you can lean on. 

We plan to film the Pilot mid October, but before that, we need the means to make it happen! We are looking to raise $2000, to be used for props, filming equipment, meals and Craft Services. Any donation, big or small, would be extremely helpful and appreciated. We have some really cool perks too, including the chance to watch an early release of the Pilot, come to a private screening party, or get a limited edition poster, signed by the cast!

Finally, if you cant contribute, that doesn't mean you cant still help! If you're passionate about this project like we are, you can use the Indiegogo share tools to get the word out, and make some noise about the campaign! The more help we get, the more you give us the ability to succeed and do what we do best: tell stories and make you laugh! 

For more information on the project, flick a message to emailme@tessarao.com. And keep an eye out for the beginning promo - coming very soon!

story:
What We Need & What You Get!

We are currently looking for $5,000 for the full filming and post production of season two of SOUND BOOTH. This money will go towards:

  • Equipment Rental
  • Location/insurance costs
  • Costuming and Props
  • Any extra funds will go towards future seasons and shows!

We understand that your dollar is valuable, so we've come up with some great perks for different tiers of donations!

TIER ONE: GROUPIE

Get access to our VIP SOUND BOOTH facebook page! Stay up to date with the project and be the first to know what's going on!

TIER TWO: ROADIE

Get the perks from tier one as well as a special SOUND BOOTH guitar pick. Also, a Rene Collin's CD! Rene is one of the actors and creators of this project who has a phenomenal musical talent; you're sure to love his music!

TIER THREE: FAN

Get the perks from tiers one and two as well as a SOUND BOOTH poster signed by the entire cast!

TIER FOUR: SUPER FAN

Get the perks from all lower tiers as well as early access to season one of SOUND BOOTH. Also, get a "Special Thanks" credit both on screen and on IMDB for season two!

TIER FIVE: BAND MEMBER

Get the perks from all lower tiers as well as early access to BOTH seasons of SOUND BOOTH. Also, get promoted from "Special Thanks" to co-producer!

TIER SIX: ROCKSTAR

Get the perks from all lower tiers as well as a signed, hard-copy blooper and extras reel. Also, get promoted from co-producer to producer!

TIER SEVEN: LEGEND

Get the perks from all lower tiers as well as an on-set experience. We will write a speaking role in for you in a future season of SOUND BOOTH or one of our other shows currently in development. Also, get promoted from producer to co-executive producer!

THANKS & MORE

Thank you so much for your contribution! Feel free to share our campaign on social media, and check out SOUND BOOTH on IMDB here!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Carlton Thompson and I am a Detroit based filmmaker. I have been in the industry since 2010, but have been a story teller my whole life. I wanted to tell stories that touched people's lives and make them look at life in a different perspective. I love the collaboration and networking aspect of the industry. People coming together and bringing a story from paper to life has always been fascinating to me. This series is very personal to me because in 2015 my dad was diagnosed with kidney failure. His kidneys were damaged due to him having high blood pressure. Creating a series that can bring awareness to issues that people struggle with became a passion project of mine.

I truly believe that if people understood one another, then we would be closer to peace. This series has the potential to change the world in many positive ways. It all starts with connecting people. We as human beings need to look out for each other. It doesn’t matter what race, country, religion, and background we come from; we all feel emotion. It's time to let it out and talk it out. It takes more courage to reveal what you're experiencing than it is to hide it, but we all need to understand that there is healing in revealing. Helping each other heal is the purpose of this series. 

The Circle is a support group where people come together from different backgrounds, experiences, addictions, personal issues, and struggles to discuss what they are going through, what they may have overcome, and how to get through it. It is about giving people the courage to speak up, reveal, and heal. We also want to bring awareness to many issues that go on in the world. Not only will this series be personal to me, it will be for our viewers as well. 

What We Need & What You Get

If we reach our goal of $10,000, that will allow us to pay for each episode. This includes our production crew, actors, and production cost. It will also allow us to market and shop the series on the festival circuit to bring more attention to the series. The cost per episode will be $1,000, with 7 episodes, and $3,000 for marketing and the festival circuit. If we were to raise anything beyond our goal, the extra money will roll over into Season 2. You're getting a series that will connect with almost anyone and hopefully change many lives in the world. If we are unable to reach our goal,  then any money raised will go strictly into production for the first season.

We have unique perks for all who donate to our campaign. Please review each perk in detail to the right.

The Impact

This series is about connecting and helping people. Martin Luther King Jr. said, "You can't leave the house without depending on more than half the world." This series can educate people, build communities, change lives, break barriers, and change opinions and perspectives. At the end of the day we are all humans that need to help each other. This will bring us closer to peace.

    Risks & Challenges 

     Not reaching our goal would be an obstacle, however, I truly believe we will because anyone can relate to this series. This series connects to everyone and is about everyone. In reaching the goal of this series, we can help put an end to depression, long suffering, and past regrets. We have to learn how to move forward and know we are not alone in any direction we take. 

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Please LIKE, INVITE, and SHARE our Facebook, The Circle TV Series, and Instagram, The Circle Series. Have all your friends and family to do the same. This series is for you and everyone you know. This is a movement that we are steadily growing. We hope that through people believing in what we are trying accomplish, we can change the world for the better. It starts with changing lives.

My name is Carlton Thompson and I am a Detroit based filmmaker. I have been in the industry since 2010, but have been a story teller my whole life. I wanted to tell stories that touched people's lives and make them look at life in a different perspective. I love the collaboration and networking aspect of the industry. People coming together and bringing a story from paper to life has always been fascinating to me. This series is very personal to me because in 2015 my dad was diagnosed with kidney failure. His kidneys were damaged due to him having high blood pressure. Creating a series that can bring awareness to issues that people struggle with became a passion project of mine.
I truly believe that if people understood one another, then we would be closer to peace. This series has the potential to change the world in many positive ways. It all starts with connecting people. We as human beings need to look out for each other. It doesn’t matter what race, country, religion, and background we come from; we all feel emotion. It's time to let it out and talk it out. It takes more courage to reveal what you're experiencing than it is to hide it, but we all need to understand that there is healing in revealing. Helping each other heal is the purpose of this series. 
The Circle is a support group where people come together from different backgrounds, experiences, addictions, personal issues, and struggles to discuss what they are going through, what they may have overcome, and how to get through it. It is about giving people the courage to speak up, reveal, and heal. We also want to bring awareness to many issues that go on in the world. Not only will this series be personal to me, it will be for our viewers as well. 

What We Need & What You Get
If we reach our goal of $10,000, that will allow us to pay for each episode. This includes our production crew, actors, and production cost. It will also allow us to market and shop the series on the festival circuit to bring more attention to the series. The cost per episode will be $1,000, with 7 episodes, and $3,000 for marketing and the festival circuit. If we were to raise anything beyond our goal, the extra money will roll over into Season 2. You're getting a series that will connect with almost anyone and hopefully change many lives in the world. If we are unable to reach our goal,  then any money raised will go strictly into production for the first season.
We have unique perks for all who donate to our campaign. Please review each perk in detail to the right.

The Impact
This series is about connecting and helping people. Martin Luther King Jr. said, "You can't leave the house without depending on more than half the world." This series can educate people, build communities, change lives, break barriers, and change opinions and perspectives. At the end of the day we are all humans that need to help each other. This will bring us closer to peace.


Risks & Challenges 
 Not reaching our goal would be an obstacle, however, I truly believe we will because anyone can relate to this series. This series connects to everyone and is about everyone. In reaching the goal of this series, we can help put an end to depression, long suffering, and past regrets. We have to learn how to move forward and know we are not alone in any direction we take. 

Other Ways You Can Help
Please LIKE, INVITE, and SHARE our Facebook, The Circle TV Series, and Instagram, The Circle Series. Have all your friends and family to do the same. This series is for you and everyone you know. This is a movement that we are steadily growing. We hope that through people believing in what we are trying accomplish, we can change the world for the better. It starts with changing lives.

story:
What Is Wizazon?

Wizazon is a magical scripted podcast that's accessible to anyone and everyone. No mooching off someone's Netflix account, all episodes are going to be completely free!

We welcome everyone to participate by listening, liking, and sharing our content. And if you want to be even more involved with this magical world, we welcome your donations!

The episodes are free but the work that goes into this project is not free. Everyone deserves compensation for their work, and while we might be starving artists who created a cool show, we don't want our actors, editors, and designers to go hungry. 

What We Need 

A lot of productions need funding for equipment and props, but our first priority is investing in people. Our second priority is equipment--we have decent recording equipment, but with a larger budget we'd like to rent a professional studio. 

  • Each episode costs roughly $1,000 to make because we are paying actors, sound editors, and EVERYONE who helps make the magic happen.
     
  • Recording studios in NYC cost from $60-$150 per hour. It would probably take about 3-5 hours to record one episode. 
     
  • Your donations aren't just supporting our show, you also get cool perks--you could even become PART of the show! 
     
  • If we don't reach our funding goal, we're still going to pay our collaborators as promised, but the bottom line is, the more support we have, the better the show will be. There's only 24 hours in a day, and all of us have survival jobs that we do in addition to our art. The more we can focus on our art, and the more our collaborators can focus on theirs, the better this show will be. 

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

As starving artists ourselves, we understand if you can't make a donation just yet. No problem! Please feel free to engage with us on social media and help us cross-promote our show with your projects!

  • www.wizazon.com 
  • Facebook @Wizazon
  • Instagram @wzazonpodcast
  • Twitter @WizazonPodcast

story:
Short Summary

  • I'm a filmmaker, comedian and indie media journalist
  • I want to see the truth about Russia with my own eyes
  • You will be helping me get the truth out about Russia to a western audience

What We Need & What You Get

I need $5000 to pay for my air travel, lodging and any travel costs for 10-14 days. Also to pay for an editor to take the hours of footage I will get and make a compelling short documentary.  If I only reach $3000 I can still go to Russia for 6-8 days and make the doc. 

The Impact

This project is important for people living in the West who have only been told one side of the Russia story. 

I have successfully funded and delivered two crowdfunding projects. The Los Angles Podcast Festival and Ear Buds: The Podcasting Documentary. I have also directed Laffghanistan: Comedy Downrange. A doc about doing comedy for the US Military in Afghanistan. Director/Producer for 13 episodes of the FNX Comedy Experience. 

Creator/Host of The Political Vigilante. Independent, progressive media show on Youtube. Regular on The Jimmy Dore Show and Aggressive Progressives on TYT .

Risks & Challenges

The challenge will be to go to a country where I do not speak the language and get average Russian people to talk to me on camera. Will the government allow this? I'm not sure. 

I know a western journalist living in Moscow and a Russian guide that can help me navigate shooting on the streets of Moscow. I have shot docs in war zones, Japan and the Australian outback. I am uniquely qualified to overcome the unforeseen challenges that arise in shooting a doc in a foreign country. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate you can help my project by:

Sharing on social media! Indie gogo makes it easy! 

You are all Political Vigilantes! The powers that be can't stop all of us.

story:
I created this series because despite the progress we're making in mainstream media, the black experience is predominantly shown from an African-American perspective. As someone who constantly has my blackness questioned due to my nationality, I've experienced first hand one of many consequences of having monolithic black representation.

Being black in The Ivory Coast is not identical to being black in Australia or Colombia. While we're all African descendants, one of the beautiful things about us as a race is that culturally we're everywhere. Each video will hone in on our similarities, while celebrating our differences.

When it comes to the diaspora, I've become fascinated with the unknown. Even in present day, countries such as Mexico only acknowledged their black population on the National Census in 2015. In a world where nations consider their most beautiful to be those with the closest proximity to whiteness, I always wonder: who else is getting overlooked? The more I research, the more I discover the presence of black populations that (more often than not) been around for centuries (e.g. India's black population that settled in the country 400 years ago). 

Black Beyond America is my oppourtunity to document the countless nuances that make up the black experience world wide. While we've successfully made a few videos in California, it's time to start our international journey, which is where you come in! The series can only go so far if we don't visit the countries in question - whether it's sharing stories with those back in the UK, digging into the black experince in Russia, or visiting the Carribean islands my grandparents came from, we need your help.

No donation is too big or small. Any amount you can give will go towards food, travel, housing and paying the crew that'll make this happen.

In the long run, I aim to break the misconception that a black person's culture measures their worth in society. I aspire to have the series be part of a larger archive that is constantly being updated with new content, new experiences and new perspectives.
