story:
Dom Trapani ("Derek"), Meagan Fulps (Creator, "Charlie"), Ashley Parchment ("Alex")

WHO ARE YOU & WHAT IS "LA TRAIN•HER"?

My name is Meagan Fulps and I created the web series “LA Train•her” with a team of incredibly talented weirdos. We’ve been working our tails off all year long and are PUMPED to finally show you our first teaser! With this show, we want to make you laugh and make you feel, all while making fun of the extremes and absurdities that exist in the Los Angeles fitness scene. Even though we parody this world, we still get real. Our characters have identity insecurities and struggle to find themselves in a world full of facades. Don’t get me wrong; Los Angeles is extraordinary for many reasons, including its justified credit as the fitness mecca of the world. But, that doesn’t mean it’s not a constant battle here to stay true to yourself while fighting to be your best, and THE best.

WHAT INSPIRED THE SHOW?

Many bits and pieces of the show are inspired by moments and real people that I’ve experienced while being a fitness trainer the last few years here in Los Angeles. I’ve also been inspired by so many successful female TV show creators who started their journeys by making a web series loosely based on their unique life experiences.

My life prior to writing and training was nothing but athletics, because obviously basketball is life. I was molded into the person I am today by my experience as a professional athlete. It gave me perspective, stories and fueled many of my creative endeavors. I’ve always dreamed of the day I would get to combine my careers and passions… and now, here we are!

It’s also still frustratingly rare to see genuinely athletic and physically strong women with real muscle definition on screen. Wake up faster people, strength is attractive, attainable, and admirable—we need more of it! Showing these types of women in my show has been, and will continue to be, a significant component. Let's be real, badass women dominate the fitness scene, and it’s time we all knew about it.  

WHO'S BEHIND THE PROJECT?

Your contribution to this project will not only make my dream a reality, but also support a team of 20+ wonderful and talented people who’ve donated so much of their time and sweat into putting this quirky little project on screen. I intentionally pulled together people directly from the fitness world to bring an element of authenticity, but also to show that there are SO MANY CREATIVES who work in fitness busting their butts every single day and working multiple jobs to pursue their dreams. It’s crazy how many actors, writers, producers, etc. consume the fitness industry, and I couldn’t be more grateful to be surrounded by them all. Bringing them onto this project has been amazing, not just because they’re talented, but also because they truly believe in what we’re creating and want to showcase this unique world we live in. Since we are all so passionate about fitness and our LA niche, we plan to use this show to promote and shed light on this hardworking, thriving community.

Olivier L. Gagnon (Director/Editor), THE CREW + A GOAT, Jacob Hellinga (Cinematographer)

HOW WILL DONATIONS HELP?

Every dollar donated will go towards paying for the crew, equipment, post-production, marketing, and more for the next two episodes and our eventual show launch! We've already shot three episodes that are currently being crafted in post-production and plan to keep the momentum going. Making scripted content takes a lot of work, a lot of time, and a lot of money. Even though these are short episodes, behind each one is months of hard work by multiple people. With your help we can give so many young, deserving people an opportunity to continue honing their craft, build their reels, strengthen their resumes; and have a damn good time while doing it.

SO NOW WHAT?

Watch the teaser above, donate if you feel inclined, follow our social media accounts, SHARE, SHARE, SHARE, and walk away knowing you helped further some artists’ careers and put smiles on many faces. Oh, and not to mention, you’ll snag some dope perks along the way (party invite, workout classes, swag bag & more... be sure to check them out on this page)! So thank you from the bottom of our hearts, we're blessed to have you on this journey with us!

All love & sweat,

Meagan Fulps

FOLLOW ALONG: INSTAGRAM, YOUTUBE, FACEBOOK
story_txt: Dom Trapani ("Derek"), Meagan Fulps (Creator, "Charlie"), Ashley Parchment ("Alex")WHO ARE YOU & WHAT IS "LA TRAIN•HER"?My name is Meagan Fulps and I created the web series “LA Train•her” with a team of incredibly talented weirdos. We’ve been working our tails off all year long and are PUMPED to finally show you our first teaser! With this show, we want to make you laugh and make you feel, all while making fun of the extremes and absurdities that exist in the Los Angeles fitness scene. Even though we parody this world, we still get real. Our characters have identity insecurities and struggle to find themselves in a world full of facades. Don’t get me wrong; Los Angeles is extraordinary for many reasons, including its justified credit as the fitness mecca of the world. But, that doesn’t mean it’s not a constant battle here to stay true to yourself while fighting to be your best, and THE best.WHAT INSPIRED THE SHOW?Many bits and pieces of the show are inspired by moments and real people that I’ve experienced while being a fitness trainer the last few years here in Los Angeles. I’ve also been inspired by so many successful female TV show creators who started their journeys by making a web series loosely based on their unique life experiences.My life prior to writing and training was nothing but athletics, because obviously basketball is life. I was molded into the person I am today by my experience as a professional athlete. It gave me perspective, stories and fueled many of my creative endeavors. I’ve always dreamed of the day I would get to combine my careers and passions… and now, here we are!It’s also still frustratingly rare to see genuinely athletic and physically strong women with real muscle definition on screen. Wake up faster people, strength is attractive, attainable, and admirable—we need more of it! Showing these types of women in my show has been, and will continue to be, a significant component. Let's be real, badass women dominate the fitness scene, and it’s time we all knew about it.  WHO'S BEHIND THE PROJECT?Your contribution to this project will not only make my dream a reality, but also support a team of 20+ wonderful and talented people who’ve donated so much of their time and sweat into putting this quirky little project on screen. I intentionally pulled together people directly from the fitness world to bring an element of authenticity, but also to show that there are SO MANY CREATIVES who work in fitness busting their butts every single day and working multiple jobs to pursue their dreams. It’s crazy how many actors, writers, producers, etc. consume the fitness industry, and I couldn’t be more grateful to be surrounded by them all. Bringing them onto this project has been amazing, not just because they’re talented, but also because they truly believe in what we’re creating and want to showcase this unique world we live in. Since we are all so passionate about fitness and our LA niche, we plan to use this show to promote and shed light on this hardworking, thriving community.Olivier L. Gagnon (Director/Editor), THE CREW + A GOAT, Jacob Hellinga (Cinematographer)HOW WILL DONATIONS HELP?Every dollar donated will go towards paying for the crew, equipment, post-production, marketing, and more for the next two episodes and our eventual show launch! We've already shot three episodes that are currently being crafted in post-production and plan to keep the momentum going. Making scripted content takes a lot of work, a lot of time, and a lot of money. Even though these are short episodes, behind each one is months of hard work by multiple people. With your help we can give so many young, deserving people an opportunity to continue honing their craft, build their reels, strengthen their resumes; and have a damn good time while doing it.SO NOW WHAT?Watch the teaser above, donate if you feel inclined, follow our social media accounts, SHARE, SHARE, SHARE, and walk away knowing you helped further some artists’ careers and put smiles on many faces. Oh, and not to mention, you’ll snag some dope perks along the way (party invite, workout classes, swag bag & more... be sure to check them out on this page)! So thank you from the bottom of our hearts, we're blessed to have you on this journey with us!All love & sweat,Meagan FulpsFOLLOW ALONG: INSTAGRAM, YOUTUBE, FACEBOOK

story:
Short Summary

My name is Christina Gray and I am a graduate student at Baylor University. In the summer of 2016, God confirmed my calling to combine my talents in filmmaking with my love for children. Now, I have the amazing opportunity to make my own kids video curriculum for my thesis project at Baylor. But I need your help in bringing together the team and the resources to make it all happen!

The cool thing about this project is that it includes a ton of research about how children respond to different storytelling methods. Throughout this process, I will observe how kids understand information from two videos, one of which I will make. My film will include the Gospel message, and I hope that it will plant seeds of faith in the hearts of the kids who watch it. Thank you for your financial help, as well as your prayers! Please pray that hearts are changed throughout this process!

What We Need & What You Get

In order to make this project possible, I need $1500! This budget will be divided over several categories including props, food, and cast/crew travel.

  • Crew 12%
  • Cast 24%
  • On-Set Expenses 29%
  • Other Expenses 35%

Take a look at the perks to see what each package offers! You can choose a perk or type in a custom donation amount by clicking the pink "Back It" button!

The Impact

The biggest impact of this project is the lives that it will touch on set and in the data collection process. God has paved the way for this project to reach a huge amount of children. The episode used for testing is all about God's transforming love found in the story of Saul becoming Paul. Children will also learn how God loves and wants to transform them too

Risks & Challenges

The major challenge is going to be how we film this project. Sometimes technology doesn't always work as we have hoped. However, I can guarantee that I am the BEST team that will do everything we can to make this project a success. I have full faith in each of them and their talents. When we all put our heads together in the planning process, we will troubleshoot these problems to prevent them from happening.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are not able to help financially, here's a list of things you can do instead!

  • Pray, pray, and pray again! There are going to be many challenges with this project, so please pray for God's wisdom and guidance.
  • Share this donation page on all of your social media. Email it out to your friends and family asking for their support.
  • Let me know that you are praying for this project! One of the most encouraging words is hearing that I am covered in prayer.

Thank you again for any contribution you can make!

story:
The Back Story...

I’m Kiki Haynes and I’m excited to film and star in my first self-produced project.

As I stated, I’m very passionate about the roles offered to black actresses and I decided to create this film to diversify my acting portfolio. Initially, the idea and motive was to showcase my talent and show levels & layers I haven’t been fully able to do in the roles I’ve been cast in thus far. But then my motive transcended into a purpose much greater than just myself. There's a responsibility to our young black girls and rising aspiring actresses alike who need to see more projects with characters of color in roles founded in areas like computer science, chemical engineering, astronomy, biology and just being overall heros. 

Just A Phase, written by my talented co-producer, Kent Faulcon, is near and dear to my heart because it is founded in all of the above.  My character is a scientist who has a stumbled-upon piece of world altering technology placed in her care to protect; I am depicting my brains vs relying on exploiting my looks or the physical attributes of my body. I hope to inspire young girls to see themselves in my character and take an interest in for S.T.E.M. (science, technology, engineering & math) courses and excelling in those subjects the way black girl magic only can!

The Long & the Short of it is...

• This is a science based film with a goal to bring a positive message to Hollywood that black female actresses are under-represented in technology and science-fiction projects.

• This film has been a year in the making 

• This film is done by a crew of people with extensive Feature Film & TV resumes who have all enthusiastically agreed to work on this small budgeted indie film because of how strongly they believe in & support the cause.

• This film will be made in its entirety no matter how much money we collect from this crowd funding campaign as this is a necessary goal and a passion project. 

• Our writer & director is not only a filmmaker, he is an incredibly acclaimed actor with a remarkable resume. He too joined forces with me to genuinely support my voice as a black actress. 

• This is NOT just a film, its a statement!

WRITER/DIRECTOR:

KENT FAULCON

Hi there, I'm KENT FAULCON, actor-writer-director, who you may recognize from such memorable films like “Selma,” “War of the Worlds,” “Men in Black,” and “Die Hard: With A Vengeance.” On TV, I played Richard Ellington for six seasons as a series regular on OWN’s “For Better or Worse” and you might also recognize that I'm Principal "Denzel Washington" Green on ABC’s hit-series “Blackish.” (And yes I have seen "Training Day" in real life!)  I've been blessed to share the big and small screen playing opposite great talents ranging from Gabrielle Union on BET’s “Being Mary Jane” to Annette Bening in “American Beauty.” My passion for acting is equaled by my passion for writing and directing. I'm a story teller.  From directing projects like my first award-winning feature film “Sister’s Keeper,” to episodes of Amazon web series “Bougie Dilemma,” to the television series multi-cam sitcom“Mi Casa, Mi Casa” I strive to tell stories that feature and spotlight strong, 3-dimensional, full-voiced women characters.  I couldn't be more excited to bring the thrilling suspenseful story of Hanna Morse, JPL lab researcher and soon-to-be world protector to the screen. A new hero is on the verge of being born and I truly hope you will help us bring this extraordinary character to life.

 

PRODUCER/UPM:

Dr. Lana Bettencourt, is a former GE aircraft engines supervisor and Johnson & Johnson manager turned prolific Hollywood producer. In a short amount of time Dr. Lana has amassed over 10 production credits to her name and is currently the production manager for Tri Destined Studios.

WHAT'S THE MONEY FOR?:

Every penny donated by you guys will go towards the making of this movie:

Below is a list of things that we need to pay for to make this film great!

Location + Permits. 

SFX (Special FX) This is Sci-Fi people.  Y'all know that ain't cheap!

Crew. Making sure everyone can work on the film and still pay their rent.

Food. A well fed crew is a hard working crew! We believe in doing right by people.

Equipment + Insurance. For cameras, lights, G&E equipment, trucks, etc.

Art. Which includes props, set decorations, costumes., etc.

Post Production. Color Correction, the final sound mix, and music. 

Actors

Color Correction

Promotion

Production Design

Transportation

Hair and Make up

... and more

It is not a small task, but we are motivated and determined. We want to finish the piece in its entirety regardless of how much money we collect because dreams are priceless. Our voices, stories and perspectives need to be heard.
